finding: The variant rs1808828, mapped to ABLIM3, exhibited significant differences in effect size between sexes and was noted for its involvement in hormonal regulating pathways.
title: Sex differences, cross-ancestry generalizability, and noise-smoking interactions in the polygenic architecture of hearing loss in adults

finding: This variant in ARHGEF28 showed significant hormonal effect size differences between sexes, contributing to the understanding of estrogen's role in hearing functions.
title: Sex differences, cross-ancestry generalizability, and noise-smoking interactions in the polygenic architecture of hearing loss in adults

finding: SNP rs5008475 demonstrated significant associations while being located near genes related to various traits, thus underlining its involvement in impulsivity.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans and mice

finding: Found to be significant for both CRF-vo2max and CRF-slope, this SNP was associated with a female signal in the combined sample but showed heterogeneity.
title: The genetic case for cardiorespiratory fitness as a clinical vital sign and the routine prescription of physical activity in healthcare

finding: The rs114468556 variant in the NR2F1 gene within 5q15 was shown to have significant effects on cognitive performance and educational outcomes, mainly affecting the posterior multimodal network, linking it to intellectual capacity.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The variant rs7712227 was shown to be associated with increased varenicline effectiveness as well as reduced mean reticulocyte volume, indicating its relevance in hematological traits linked to treatment response.
title: Genome-wide association study of varenicline-aided smoking cessation

finding: The intronic SNP rs7733410 in HTR4 was already reported for lung function and demonstrated a notably larger effect on FEV1 in ever-smokers as compared to never-smokers.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The low frequency missense variant in ADRB2 was linked to lower FEV1 and showed the strongest associations with increased eosinophil count, indicating its potential impact on airway responsiveness.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: This SNP in ITGA2 was associated with higher FEV1 and FEV1/FVC, suggesting a relationship with the immune modulation pathway which could have therapeutic implications in COPD.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The lead SNP rs11956411 at locus 5q31.3 was identified as an eQTL for the PCDHGA3 gene in brain tissue, further supporting its role in SCZ and shared traits.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and schizophrenia in East Asians

finding: The AA genotype at rs1042713 (G>A) of the ADRB2 gene demonstrated a protective association against congenital malformations of the tracheobronchial tree (OR=0.182). Additionally, this genotype and the A allele were associated with a lower incidence of aggravated allergy history among first-degree relatives (OR=0.112 for AA and OR=0.453 for A allele).
title: Association of Polymorphic Variants of HHIP, ADRB2 and IL-33 Genes with Clinical Manifestations of Bronchial Asthma in Children

finding: Associated with the expression of coagulation factor XII, indicating a role in coagulation processes.
title: Using human genetics to understand the causes and consequences of circulating cardiac troponin I in the general population

finding: The rs871269 variant within an intron of the TNIP1 gene was identified in several large-scale GWAS as a protective variant for Alzheimer's disease (AD), with an odds ratio for AD case status of 0.96 for the T allele, suggesting its role in decreasing the risk for AD.
title: Post-GWAS multiomic functional investigation of the TNIP1 locus in Alzheimer’s disease implicates mediation through GPX3

finding: The rs34294852 variant, which was in low linkage disequilibrium with rs871269, showed a significant decrease in CSF GPX3 levels per copy of the minor allele during an analysis that included AD biomarker categories, particularly in A+T+ individuals, indicating a possible mechanism by which this SNP contributes to AD pathology.
title: Post-GWAS multiomic functional investigation of the TNIP1 locus in Alzheimer’s disease implicates mediation through GPX3

finding: For the SNP rs2307111 located in the POC5 gene, significant associations were observed in the liability GWAS for type 2 diabetes, which were not detected by the binary approach. This result aligned with previously published research on type 2 diabetes genetics.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The A allele of rs373863828 was linked with a greater increase in plasma insulin levels 30 minutes after a meal challenge among men of Māori or Pacific ancestry, suggesting enhanced insulin release. Despite this increased insulin, there was no significant difference in insulin sensitivity index or glucose disposal during hyperinsulinemic-euglycemic clamp studies. Furthermore, the A allele was associated with a 30-40% reduction in the risk of developing type 2 diabetes in Polynesian populations, even though it also correlated with an increase in body mass index (BMI) of about 1.36-1.45 kg/m² per allele. This allele's protective effect against type 2 diabetes appeared to stem from improved beta-cell function rather than an increase in insulin resistance.
title: The CREBRF diabetes-protective rs373863828-A allele is associated with enhanced early insulin release in men of Māori and Pacific ancestry

finding: The SNP rs1173773 located at 5p13.3 showed a significant association with time to remission of COVID-19 symptoms in a genome-wide association study with a P value of 4.94 × 10^-8. It was found near the NPR3 gene. The C allele was associated with a higher symptom remission rate, with hazard ratios indicating that the TT, CT, and CC genotypes had remission rates of 44%, 54%, and 59% by day 15, respectively. The statistical analysis suggested that rs1173773 might have a causal role, and although it was found to be associated with symptom remission duration, functional analyses did not confirm its regulatory role. This variant was previously associated with higher standing height and respiratory measurements.
title: Genetics of symptom remission in outpatients with COVID-19

finding: The variant rs5744672 was associated with gene expression levels of HMGCR, an enzyme crucial for cholesterol synthesis. This finding, derived from data in the Genotype-Tissue Expression Project, indicated a normalized effect size of 0.14 (P = 2.9 x 10^-6) in skeletal muscle, supporting its role in mediating cholesterol levels.
title: Multi-ancestry Polygenic Mechanisms of Type 2 Diabetes Elucidate Disease Processes and Clinical Heterogeneity

finding: The SNP rs2861761 showed a significant association with obesity-related traits in published GWASs, indicating its relevance in the genetic architecture of adiposity.
title: The genetic architecture of changes in adiposity during adulthood

finding: The SNP rs17443704 was identified in the GWAS of accelerometer-measured moderate to vigorous PA (MVPA), showing a novel genome-wide significant association with a p-value of 3.8×10²⁻⁹.
title: Association of Sedentary and Physical Activity Behaviors with Body Composition: a Genome-Wide Association and Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs401681 situated in CLPTM1L at 5p15.33 was associated with PSA levels at a P-value of 7.0 x 10^-54, contributing to novel insights into the genetic factors associated with PSA screening.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The variant rs291812 was identified as a new PSA-associated SNP detected with significant implications for PSA levels, marking a significant discovery.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The rs7732515 variant located in 5q14.3 presented a significant association with PSA, further broadening the landscape of genetic factors influencing PSA levels.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The rs2853677 variant within the TERT locus was associated with an increased risk of overall clonal haematopoiesis (CH), with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.31 [1.24-1.37] and a P-value of 1.69 x 10^-24. This finding was consistent with previous studies conducted in European populations.
title: Comparative analysis of 136,401 Admixed Americans and 419,228 Europeans reveals ancestry-specific genetic determinants of clonal haematopoiesis

finding: The SNP rs7715383 was linked to the gene ADAMTS16 located at the multi-variant locus on chromosome 5p15.32. ADAMTS16's association highlights the importance of proteases in collagen processing, possibly contributing to the connective tissue vulnerability implicated in hernias.
title: Comprehensive genome-wide association study of different forms of hernia identifies more than 80 associated loci

finding: The SNP rs3835066, located in the LOX gene on chromosome 5q23.2, was associated with hernias. LOX is important for cross-linking collagen and elastin which plays a vital role in maintaining the structural integrity of connective tissues, further implicating its relevance in hernia pathogenesis.
title: Comprehensive genome-wide association study of different forms of hernia identifies more than 80 associated loci

finding: This SNP was noted as significant in cannabis use disorder studies, contributing insights into potential genetic influences.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: This SNP was associated with cervical dysplasia, locating downstream of CLPTM1L with a p-value of 2.1 × 10−9, reflecting its potential influence in cancer susceptibility.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: This SNP was linked to cervical cancer with a p-value of 1.3 × 10−14, locating upstream of CLPTM1L, and suggesting its involvement in various cancers.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs764985249, within EFNA5, showed a significant interaction with STST for PP in European populations with a P-value of 4.1×10^-9, indicating its potential role in hypertension.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The SNP rs540041583, within PAM, demonstrated significant interaction with LTST for PP in European populations with a P-value of 8.9×10^-5, confirming its relevance to hypertension.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The SNP rs11739167 was identified as the most significant paternally transmitted ASD-SV, with a finding showing a 17.6-fold increase above expected frequencies. It is centered on the MSNP1 gene, a pseudogene regulating MSN, and was confirmed to link with ASD through Mendelian inheritance patterns.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The SNP rs4307059 was associated with ASD as its expression was found to be significantly greater in individuals homozygous for the T allele compared to controls. This SNP was also located near MSNP1, further substantiating its connection to ASD through gene expression patterns.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The SNP rs888783 within SLIT2 showed an association with 23% of cases through its ASD-SV, indicating a critical role in axon guidance which is perturbed in ASD.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The SNP rs544452250 (5-154268943-C-G; E144Q) was identified as a predicted deleterious variant shared among three individuals within a family. The individuals presented with schizophrenia, Bipolar Affective Disorder (BPAD), and substance use disorder, indicating a potential link between this variant and neuropsychiatric syndromes involving motor dysfunction and cerebellar atrophy, as discussed in the context of Neurodevelopmental Disorder with Cerebellar Atrophy and Motor Dysfunction.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing in dense families suggests genetic pleiotropy amongst Mendelian and complex neuropsychiatric syndromes

finding: The SNP rs7702187, associated with SEMA5A, was found to increase the probability of patients being classified into the 'moderate' PD progression category.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: The SNP rs1073548 was significantly associated with estradiol levels and was mapped to the UGT3A1 gene, another glucuronosyltransferase important for the elimination of estradiol.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Estradiol Levels, and the Causal Effect of Estradiol on Bone Mineral Density

finding: This SNP associated with 'excessive, frequent and irregular menstruation' also connected to thyroid traits, highlighting potential thyroid-related reproductive health issues.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: This SNP, like rs7727976, was associated with menstrual disorders and thyroid traits, suggesting a complex relationship between these phenotypes.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: The SNP rs62355902 was linked to regulatory regions that influence MAP3K1 expression. The odds ratio (OR) for carrying a protein-truncating variant (PTV) was 8.54, reflecting a significant association with breast cancer.
title: Exome sequencing identifies novel susceptibility genes and defines the contribution of coding variants to breast cancer risk

finding: SNP rs984113 showed a strong association with MAP3K1 as a GWAS locus. In logistic regression models, its odds ratio remained stable even when accounting for PTV burden, indicating its independent contribution to breast cancer risk.
title: Exome sequencing identifies novel susceptibility genes and defines the contribution of coding variants to breast cancer risk

finding: The SNP rs112497245 was also identified as part of the regulatory landscape influencing MAP3K1. The analysis indicated that its odds ratio was not significantly altered by the presence of PTVs, showcasing its distinct role in breast cancer susceptibility.
title: Exome sequencing identifies novel susceptibility genes and defines the contribution of coding variants to breast cancer risk

finding: This variant was associated with BPH in the UKB European ancestry cohort, showing a genome-wide significant association.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: The variant rs627320 was genome-wide significant in connection with prostate conditions in the joint meta-analysis.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: The rs6883598 variant was associated with the FBN2 gene, which encodes fibrillin-2 known for its role in elastic fiber assembly and related to Beals Syndrome and aortic aneurysms.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: The rs4074793 variant was prioritized as the likely causal variant at the ITGA1 locus, with implications for CAD through liver expression and lipid modulation.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: The minor allele A of rs373863828 in CREBRF was associated with higher BMI, lower fasting glucose, and lower odds of type 2 diabetes in Polynesian populations. Specifically, each copy of the A allele was linked to an increase in BMI by approximately 1.36 kg/m², a decrease in fasting glucose levels by about 1.65 mg/dL, and a reduction in the odds of type 2 diabetes (OR = 0.586). These associations suggest that while higher BMI was connected with greater risk for type 2 diabetes, the presence of the A allele conferred some protective effect against this risk, indicating a complex interplay between BMI, fasting glucose, and type 2 diabetes in Polynesian populations.
title: CREBRF missense variant rs373863828 has both direct and indirect effects on type 2 diabetes and fasting glucose in Polynesians living in Samoa and Aotearoa New Zealand

finding: The SNP rs3812036 at SLC34A1 was associated with activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) levels, with a significance level of P=3.54×10^-6. This association aligned with previously reported findings by Tang et al., who noted a more significant association (P=2.88×10^-18) at SLC34A1.
title: Systematic mediation and interaction analyses of kidney function genetic loci in a general population study

finding: The SNP rs35390 in the SLC45A2 gene exhibited a strong association with the phenotype 'Hair color (natural, before greying): black'. The trans-ancestry analysis indicated a beta coefficient of -0.456 with a p-value of 1.95×10^-78, showcasing significant heterogeneity (p=6.49×10^-192). This association was notably stronger in the European ancestry (beta=-1.928, p=5.12×10^-265) compared to other ancestries.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The variant rs55810502 in ANKRD31 demonstrated a significant association with LDL cholesterol, which was corroborated by cross-ancestry analyses revealing strong heterogeneity in effect sizes.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The study found that the T allele of rs2549794 was associated with increased odds of respiratory infections, particularly bacterial infections, with odds ratios (ORs) indicating modest increased risk (OR for pneumonia 1.03, OR for critical care admission with pneumonia 1.08, OR for death from pneumonia 1.07). These associations were derived from contemporary cohorts including UK Biobank, FinnGen, and GenOMICC. An opposing protective effect was noted for Crohn's disease (OR 0.86) and type 1 diabetes (OR 0.95). The findings suggested strong evidence for balancing selection influenced by the relationship between infection and autoimmune disease.
title: Variation in ERAP2 has opposing effects on severe respiratory infection and autoimmune disease

finding: Similar to rs2549794, the splicing SNP rs2248374 showed associations with respiratory infections, with effect estimates closely mirroring those of rs2549794 due to their linkage disequilibrium. The findings suggested that increased ERAP2 expression, which was linked to the C allele of rs2549794, was consequential in the context of autoimmune diseases such as Crohn's and type 1 diabetes, further supporting the hypothesis of ongoing balancing selection at the ERAP2 locus.
title: Variation in ERAP2 has opposing effects on severe respiratory infection and autoimmune disease

finding: The missense variant rs376199248 C>A (p.Asn451Lys) in the PCDHA2 gene was identified in an affected child who carried two copies of the alternate allele. Though this variant had limited computational support with conflicting results regarding pathogenicity, it had never been reported in ClinVar. It was included in the analysis due to its presence in a patient with ID, although it did not reach strong implications for ID development itself.
title: Rare splice and missense variants with evidence of pathogenicity in consanguineous families with autosomal recessive intellectual disability from Pakistan

finding: The variant rs147450666 was identified on chromosome 5, proximal to the genes FBN2 and SLC27A6. This finding was considered original as part of the new common loci associated with clinically diagnosed Alzheimer’s disease (AD), with the variant linked to protective roles against the disease.
title: Identification of 16 novel Alzheimer’s disease susceptibility loci using multi-ancestry meta-analyses of clinical Alzheimer’s disease and AD-by-proxy cases from four whole genome sequencing datasets

finding: The c.840C>T variant was utilized in a machine learning model to predict copy number variations specifically at the SMN1 and SMN2 loci. This SNP allowed for accurate inference of copy number due to its relationship with read depth, demonstrating both the model's effectiveness and the relevance of the SNP in assessing SMA.
title: A dual-mode targeted Nanopore sequencing assay for comprehensive SMN1 and SMN2 variant analysis

finding: The variant c.859G>C in SMN2 was associated with a less severe phenotype of Spinal Muscular Atrophy (SMA). This SNP's identification was crucial in understanding genotype-phenotype correlations in SMA patients, reinforcing its significance in SMA carrier detection.
title: A dual-mode targeted Nanopore sequencing assay for comprehensive SMN1 and SMN2 variant analysis

finding: The NM_000344.3:c.*3+80T>G variant was linked to SMN1 duplication haplotypes. Its detection enhanced carrier identification rates, especially when two SMN1 copies occurred on the same chromosome, making it a vital marker for SMA carrier screening.
title: A dual-mode targeted Nanopore sequencing assay for comprehensive SMN1 and SMN2 variant analysis

finding: The NM_000344.3:c.*211_*212del variant was also associated with SMN1 duplication haplotypes and contributed to improving the detection rates of silent carriers. This SNP played a key role in carrier detection strategies, aiding SMA screening efforts.
title: A dual-mode targeted Nanopore sequencing assay for comprehensive SMN1 and SMN2 variant analysis

finding: The SNP rs72831309, located in the intron of the TENM2 gene, was associated with a lower risk of the combined chronic kidney disease (CKD) and diabetic kidney disease (DKD) phenotype, with an odds ratio of 2.08 and a p-value of 9.8×10^-9. This association indicated a potential protective effect of the minor allele.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis and omics integration identifies novel genes associated with diabetic kidney disease

finding: The SNP rs115209326 located in FNIP1 was also significantly related to WHR<sub>adjBMI</sub> but only in women, indicating its potential impact on fat distribution.
title: Identification of rare loss of function variation regulating body fat distribution

finding: Identified as associated with coffee consumption for the first time in this study, indicating its potential as a novel locus marker.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: Identified as associated with the intake of non-caffeine components of coffee, suggesting its relevance in consumer health traits.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: Grouped into a signal cluster, rs201955087 exhibited a moderate positive effect size of 0.173, suggesting a relevant positive contribution to the blood pressure traits.
title: CLUSTERING OF RARE VARIANTS FOR CAUSAL VARIANTS IDENTIFICATION AND EFFECT DIRECTION CLASSIFICATION

finding: The rs39840 variant, located intronically in ERAP1, was revealed as having multiple independent signals in the conditional analyses, indicating its association with VTE.
title: Cross-Ancestry Investigation of Venous Thromboembolism Genomic Predictors

finding: In both-controls GWAS, rs918520 corresponded to the IL12B locus and was associated with psoriatic arthritis, showing consistency with the internal-controls GWAS findings.
title: Accurate cross-platform GWAS analysis via two-stage imputation

finding: As part of the IL12B findings, rs1582515 demonstrated similar λGC-adjusted p-values and replicated well in the both-controls GWAS, reinforcing the association with psoriatic arthritis.
title: Accurate cross-platform GWAS analysis via two-stage imputation

finding: The SNP rs75851973, associated with TNIP1, was replicated in both the both-controls and external-controls scenarios, improving results for suggestive loci in psoriatic arthritis.
title: Accurate cross-platform GWAS analysis via two-stage imputation

finding: It was part of the improved suggestive loci associated with TNIP1 in both-controls GWAS, enhancing the understanding of its role in psoriatic arthritis.
title: Accurate cross-platform GWAS analysis via two-stage imputation

finding: Linked to TNIP1, this SNP also exhibited strong statistical significance when analyzed in both-controls GWAS, reinforcing its role in psoriatic arthritis.
title: Accurate cross-platform GWAS analysis via two-stage imputation

finding: The SNP rs35972942 was also found to be genome-wide significant for gastric cancer using TAPE and TAPE-LTFH. Like rs760077, rs35972942 had earlier associations identified in Chinese and Japanese populations, yet this was the first time it was recognized in association with gastric cancer among Korean samples in this context.
title: Incorporating family disease history and controlling case-control imbalance for population based genetic association studies

finding: The eRNA-QTL rs6866783 showed strong colocalization with cervical cancer, indicating its potential role in cancer susceptibility.
title: Enhancer RNA transcriptome-wide association study reveals an atlas of pan-cancer susceptibility eRNAs

finding: SNP rs30266 was identified as associated with major depression symptoms in the genetic analysis conducted. It contributed to the associations related to the common genetic factor for major depressive disorder and had been previously documented in relevant GWAS of unipolar depression.
title: Genetic structure of major depression symptoms across clinical and community cohorts

finding: The SNP, rs76300969, observed on the gene AACSL, was significantly associated with AUD severity and SB, exhibiting a statistical significance with a p-value of 3.63E-08, reinforcing its role in the study of these phenotypes.
title: Genetic Factors Associated with Suicidal Behaviors and Alcohol Use Disorders in an American Indian Population

finding: SNP rs4916723 appeared as a genomic locus associated with non-SU externalizing traits, highlighting its contribution to genetic factors linked to polysubstance use (PSU). Specific gene connections were not provided.
title: Genetic associations among internalizing and externalizing traits with polysubstance use among young adults

finding: This SNP was associated with the most significant average increase in brain age of 0.63 years for each copy of the A allele, making it a notable finding in the study. It is located 3,405bp downstream of the BHMT2 gene, which is involved in choline metabolism.
title: Genetic architecture of brain age and its casual relations with brain and mental disorders

finding: Similarly, rs4543289 was part of the genetic cluster where LIPA was associated with a decreased risk of self-harm. Its role in the severity of depression symptoms highlighted its potential interaction with physical activity in mitigating self-harm risk.
title: Associations between physical activities and self-harm behavior in depression across the genotype: findings from the UK Biobank

finding: This intergenic SNP was experimentally shown to affect expression of several genes and was physically associated with the promoter of miRNA-146a, an important immune regulator and SLE biomarker, highlighting its regulatory role.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: SNP rs2853677, associated with the TERT locus, was found to be significantly negatively correlated with PACER in the GWAS analysis. This suggests its involvement in the modulation of clonal expansion rates in relation to mCAs.
title: Determinants of mosaic chromosomal alteration fitness

finding: The rs1043358053 SNP in TERT showed a significant link to decreased lifespan, with a p-value of 7.4 × 10^-5, reaffirming its relevance in longevity.
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: The SNP rs57221529 (CHR5:586,509; A>G) was identified as having a significant association with lung function in CF patients. It acted as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the gene SLC9A3, showing a robust association with gene expression in CF nasal epithelia, which explained 22% of the variation in SLC9A3 expression. Moreover, the minor allele (G) was associated with increased SLC9A3 expression and decreased expression of TPPP.
title: A cystic fibrosis lung disease modifier locus harbors tandem repeats associated with gene expression

finding: The SNP rs72711364 (CHR5:415,208; A>G) was also identified as a significant locus for CF lung function. It acted as an eQTL for SLC9A3 but did not show a significant association with SLC9A3 expression in CF nasal epithelia, despite being linked to VNTR #11, which did associate with increased SLC9A3 expression. This SNP contributed to the understanding of CF lung function through its association with gene expression alteration.
title: A cystic fibrosis lung disease modifier locus harbors tandem repeats associated with gene expression

finding: The SNP rs79449010 related to ALDH7A1 was associated with 6-oxopiperidine-2-carboxylate, suggesting its implication in lysine catabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs10038137 in CDO1 was positively associated with hypotaurine levels, suggesting its role in cysteine metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs33972313 in SLC23A1 was positively associated with ascorbic acid 3-sulfate, indicating its role in vitamin C transport.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: This SNP was significantly linked (p=1.20E-08) to impulsivity and several traits including educational attainment.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: There was a reported association between the missense variant in CREBRF, rs373863828, and fat-free mass, rather than fat mass, specifically in Samoan infants. This finding contributed to understanding how genetic variations may impact body composition in this population.
title: Characterization of Per- and Polyfluoroalkyl Substance (PFAS) concentrations in a community-based sample of infants from Samoa

finding: This intergenic variant was significantly associated with the combined cohort of all DGBI cases, situated 18K upstream of the ARL2BPP6 gene, highlighting its relevance to the broader DGBI spectrum.
title: Combined GWAS and single cell transcriptomics uncover the underlying genes and cell types in disorders of gut-brain interaction

finding: The study reported a high-level association of the rs60111579 intergenic variant on chromosome 5 with functional dyspepsia, marking it as an important genetic contributor to this condition.
title: Combined GWAS and single cell transcriptomics uncover the underlying genes and cell types in disorders of gut-brain interaction

finding: The rs185001252 intergenic variant on chromosome 5 was notably linked with functional diarrhea, revealing its potential role in the molecular mechanisms of this DGBI.
title: Combined GWAS and single cell transcriptomics uncover the underlying genes and cell types in disorders of gut-brain interaction

finding: The rs72801474 SNP was identified as the top significant expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) variant in the HSPA4 locus related to hypertension. In the analysis, when gene expression was adjusted for DNA methylation (DNAm), only the expression levels of HSPA4 remained significant in their effect on hypertension. This finding highlighted the relevance of rs72801474 in the context of hypertension and gene expression interplay.
title: An integrative multi-context Mendelian randomization method for identifying risk genes across human tissues

finding: The rs55920409 SNP located at 5p13.1 was found to significantly associate with endometriosis, showing a p-value of 2.66E-08. As a part of the newly identified loci, this finding expands the genetic landscape of endometriosis.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: The SNP rs12916 in the HMGCR gene exhibited metabolic effects aligning with those from statin use, indicating its critical role in lipid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide characterization of circulating metabolic biomarkers reveals substantial pleiotropy and novel disease pathways

finding: The SNP rs12916 near HMGCR was notably associated with various NMR traits and demonstrated significant effects in the context of statin usage, emphasizing its relevance as a target for lipid-lowering interventions in cardiovascular health.
title: Lipo-proteomic and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: Located at the ANKRD55 locus, rs7731626 was also marked with a high PIP (> 0.99) and related to CD4+ T cell-specific chromatin accessibility, highlighting its relevance in RA pathology.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The SNP rs13174255 was identified as a positive and original finding in relation to the development of brain metastases in melanoma patients. The research highlighted that variations at this locus might correlate with the levels of tumor-associated microglia and macrophages, which are implicated in the tumor microenvironment and could influence responses to immune checkpoint inhibitor therapy.
title: MET receptor activation by stromal cells serves as promising target in melanoma brain metastases

finding: The genotype of the 5-HT<sub>1A</sub> receptor promoter region polymorphism (rs6295) was found to influence the outcome of high-frequency (HF) transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS) in patients suffering from major depressive episodes. It was suggested that a greater load of G alleles in this polymorphism might be associated with lower serotonin release, which could lead to a post-synaptic upregulation of the 5-HT<sub>1A</sub> receptor. This indicates a significant relationship between genetic variation at this locus and the efficacy of TMS treatment in depression.
title: Effects of bilateral sequential theta-burst stimulation on 5-HT1A receptors on dorsolateral prefrontal cortex in treatment resistant depression

finding: The SNP rs142753275 was found to be linked to the gene Slit3 at the left pars opercularis, with a significance marked by a p-value of 2.75×10^-9. This gene has been associated with major depressive disorder (MDD).
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders over a 2-year Period in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: The study identified <italic>rs258760</italic> as a functional genetic variant influencing asthma risk. It was located within an intron of <italic>ARHGAP26</italic> and was found to eliminate a functional aryl hydrocarbon receptor (AHR) response element crucial for the transcriptional regulation of the glucocorticoid receptor gene <italic>NR3C1</italic>. The C allele was linked to increased transcription induced by AHR ligands, enhancing asthma risk.
title: Glucocorticoid-regulated bidirectional enhancer RNA transcription pinpoints functional genetic variants linked to asthma

finding: The SNP rs1848553 was identified as GWAS significant with a meta-analysis p-value of 2.97×10-8. It was located within an intron of the RGS7BP gene, which is involved in the regulation of vascular biology and infectious disease pathogenesis. Each T allele was associated with an approximately 1-point decrease in TBScore, indicating a clinically meaningful reduction in disease severity.
title: Tuberculosis severity associates with variants and eQTLs related to vascular biology and infection-induced inflammation

finding: The SNP rs274567 was associated with acetyl-carnitine and mapped to the carnitine transporter gene SLC22A5. It indicated a significant protective effect against very severe Covid19, with estimates suggesting a reduction in severe disease risk. The acetyl-carnitine increasing allele was linked to a 70% increased risk of muscle weakness (OR=1.68, 95% CI 1.30 to 2.16, p=0.00007). High levels of acetyl-carnitine in blood appeared to inhibit carnitine uptake in tissues, explaining the correlation with muscle weakness.
title: Mendelian randomization analyses show that higher acetyl-carnitine and carnitine levels in blood protect against severe Covid19

finding: The SNP rs61175833 was reported as significantly associated with atopic dermatitis in previous studies, specifically with a p-value of 1.947e-05. It is located in an intergenic region, with the nearest protein coding gene being SLC1A3. This SNP was included in the genome-wide significant SNPs for AD, highlighting its relevance to the disease.
title: An Integrated Genomic and Transcriptomic Analysis Reveals Distinct Molecular Features Associated with Mild-to-moderate Atopic Dermatitis

finding: The rs115399307 variant in the FOXI1 gene was associated with transferrin glycosylation and was seven times more common in the VIKING cohort than in the CROATIA-Korcula cohort, UK Biobank, and gnomAD.
title: Exome sequencing reveals aggregates of rare variants in glycosyltransferase and other genes influencing immunoglobulin G and transferrin glycosylation

finding: The presence of rs2910164 within MIR146A correlated with decreased levels of miR-146a-5p in individuals, which was associated with increased levels of TLR-2, a microglial receptor involved in neuroinflammation, particularly after binding to Aβ42. This finding was relevant in the context of Alzheimer’s disease as it highlighted a potential regulatory mechanism linking miRNA expression and pathological processes.
title: A multi-omics approach identifies a blood-based miRNA signature of cognitive decline in two large observational trials

finding: The SNP rs147625068 was identified near the gene 'LTC4S' and was associated with early ischemic stroke in individuals with sickle cell disease (SCD), reaching genome-wide significance with a P-value of 3.70 × 10−9.
title: Genome-wide association study of ischemic stroke risk in Sickle Cell confirms ADAMTS2, CDK18, uncovers 12 novel loci

finding: The variant rs534089428 located near 'ADAMTS12' was found near 'ADAMTS2' with a significant P-value of 2.43 × 10−5, indicating its relevance to early ischemic stroke risk.
title: Genome-wide association study of ischemic stroke risk in Sickle Cell confirms ADAMTS2, CDK18, uncovers 12 novel loci

finding: This intronic variant in FST was associated with ASATadjBMI (P = 5.1 x 10^-10), supporting a role in insulin resistance mechanisms.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The SNP rs273913 was associated with omega-3 fatty acids with a minor allele frequency of 0.3867 and was confirmed in external replication efforts.
title: Fifty-one novel, replicated loci identified in genome-wide association study of polyunsaturated and monounsaturated fatty acids in 124,024 European individuals

finding: The SNP rs166635 showed significant association with DHA, having a minor allele frequency of 0.3079 and located approximately 242kb upstream of the ACSL6 gene, confirmed in replication studies.
title: Fifty-one novel, replicated loci identified in genome-wide association study of polyunsaturated and monounsaturated fatty acids in 124,024 European individuals

finding: This SNP was associated with the AF-related heart failure subtype. It belonged to the PITX2/FAM241A gene region, indicating a potential genetic factor in atrial fibrillation-related heart failure.
title: Identifying subtypes of heart failure with machine learning: external, prognostic and genetic validation in three electronic health record sources with 320,863 individuals

finding: The SNP rs16903122 linked to the left/right putamen was shown to influence sleep duration traits.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: Located at 5q14.3, rs12657776 demonstrated co-association with multiple brain regions and sleep variants.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP in the left/right cerebellum white matter was relevant to linking sleep traits with genetic influences.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The finding related to SNP rs10040104 suggested that inflammation, which is linked to this SNP, played a critical role in the progression of myeloid malignancies, indicating its potential value as a marker in cancer prognosis.
title: Blood cytokine analysis suggests that SARS-CoV-2 infection results in a sustained tumour promoting environment in cancer patients

finding: The SNP rs7732130 was identified as the causal variant at the locus near ZBED3/PDE8B, associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D), HbA1c, and glucose. The G allele of rs7732130 was predicted to increase the enhancer probability of the region, leading to enhanced binding of transcription factors ZNF143 and RFX7, and was linked to increased chromatin accessibility in human islets and luciferase reporter activity in MIN6 beta cells.
title: Modeling islet enhancers using deep learning identifies candidate causal variants at loci associated with T2D and glycemic traits

finding: The rs373863828 SNP, a missense variant in the CREB3 Regulatory Factor (CREBRF) gene, was associated with higher body mass index (BMI) in Samoan adults, where each copy of the minor allele was linked to a 1.4 kg/m² increase in BMI. This association was replicated across multiple Polynesian and Micronesian cohorts. Additionally, significant associations were found between rs373863828 and phenotypes such as weight, abdominal circumference, hip circumference, and fat mass, highlighting its pleiotropic effects. The variant has been noted for being a risk factor for obesity, yet it also was associated with favorable lipid profiles and decreased odds of diabetes, indicating complex relationships between these traits.
title: Multivariate analysis of a missense variant in CREBRF reveals associations with measures of adiposity in people of Polynesian ancestries

finding: The SNP rs329122 in the ubiquitin ligase JADE2 achieved a conservative significance threshold of P=3.69×10^-9; it has also been associated with smoking behavior and splicing-related variants in lung cancer.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analyses of lung cancer in the Million Veteran Program reveal novel risk loci and elucidate smoking-independent genetic risk

finding: The minor A allele of rs373863828 was originally found to be associated with higher body mass index (BMI) and obesity risk, while paradoxically linked to lower fasting glucose and reduced odds of type 2 diabetes. In this study involving Samoan adults, it was confirmed that the A allele correlated with elevated weight and BMI, particularly in women. The allele also contributed to a significant increase in total fat mass, trunk fat, and android fat mass in women, as well as greater lean mass in both sexes. However, no significant differences in fat distribution were found, suggesting that the protective effect against type 2 diabetes might be due to greater lean mass rather than favorable fat distribution.
title: The association of CREBRF variant rs373863828 with body composition in adult Samoans

finding: The non-coding variant rs12916 in the HMG-CoA reductase (HMGCR) gene was found to be associated with 27 out of 56 selected metabolites and overall with 180 out of 249 tested metabolite traits, highlighting its pleiotropic nature and previous links to cardiovascular disease.
title: Genome-wide association study for circulating metabolites in 619,372 individuals

finding: In a study analyzing COVID-19 severity, SNP rs13167486 located in a region of chromosome 5 associated with increased disease severity in individuals of African ancestry, with a significance p-value of 0.03 after correction for multiple testing. This finding was linked to long noncoding RNA SPRY4-AS1, indicating its potential role in immune responses to COVID-19.
title: Deconvoluting complex correlates of COVID19 severity with local ancestry inference and viral phylodynamics: Results of a multiomic pandemic tracking strategy

finding: Located upstream of RGS14, this SNP was associated with immune response modulation, contributing to the understanding of atopic dermatitis genes.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: It was validated as a significant SNP in the analysis, contributing to the understanding of immune cell type distributions.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals different T cell distributions in peripheral blood of healthy individuals at high genetic risk of type 1 diabetes and long COVID

finding: This SNP was shown to be associated with a distinct immune cell phenotype, furthering insights into immune system genetics.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals different T cell distributions in peripheral blood of healthy individuals at high genetic risk of type 1 diabetes and long COVID

finding: The SNP rs62376947 was established as a sentinel variant at a second locus on chromosome 5q35.1 with a p-value of 2.49 x 10^-8. It resides in an intronic region of the gene SLIT3, signifying its potential importance in the genetic factors contributing to TN.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals genetic risk factors for trigeminal neuralgia

finding: In this study, the SNP rs12916 in the HMGCR gene was identified as the leading SNP associated with low-density lipoprotein (LDL) levels. Genetic variation in HMGCR showed a significant association with a reduced risk of Parkinson's Disease (PD), with an odds ratio of 0.54, indicating that variations related to LDL might have protective effects against PD.
title: Genetic Associations of Lipid-Lowering Drugs and Parkinson’s Disease: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs10942735 was identified as the leading SNP associated with the tremor-dominant subtype of Parkinson's Disease within the same genomic proximity as rs12916. While rs10942735 indicated an increased risk of the tremor-dominant subtype (OR = 8.43), the association highlighted a contrast where overall HMGCR inhibition corresponded to reduced PD risk.
title: Genetic Associations of Lipid-Lowering Drugs and Parkinson’s Disease: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs27432 was identified as a significant risk factor for Birdshot Chorioretinopathy (BSCR). Specifically, it was associated with an odds ratio (OR) of 2.46 (95% CI 1.85-3.26; p=4.07e-10) indicating that this variant likely contributes to increased risk for the disease within HLA-A29 controlled cohorts.
title: ERAP1, ERAP2, and two copies of HLA-Aw19 alleles increase the risk for Birdshot Chorioretinopathy in HLA-A29 carriers

finding: The SNP rs10044354 was linked to a risk for BSCR, showing an odds ratio (OR) of 1.95 (95% CI 1.55-2.44; p=6.2e-09). This finding was consistent across both the current study and previous analyses, indicating it plays a significant role in modulating BSCR risk.
title: ERAP1, ERAP2, and two copies of HLA-Aw19 alleles increase the risk for Birdshot Chorioretinopathy in HLA-A29 carriers

finding: The SNP rs2248374 was found to be protective against BSCR, with individuals carrying this variant showing a reduced risk (OR 0.56; 95% CI 0.45-0.70; p=2.39e-07). This SNP disrupts ERAP2 expression and its presence indicates a potential mechanism by which lower ERAP2 expression may confer protection against the disease.
title: ERAP1, ERAP2, and two copies of HLA-Aw19 alleles increase the risk for Birdshot Chorioretinopathy in HLA-A29 carriers

finding: The SNP rs2287987, associated with ERAP1, was shown to have a significant prevalence among BSCR patients compared to healthy controls, indicating its contribution to the disease. Although specific statistics were not provided in the core findings of the study, the mention of its risk haplotype was significant enough to affirm its role in susceptibility to BSCR.
title: ERAP1, ERAP2, and two copies of HLA-Aw19 alleles increase the risk for Birdshot Chorioretinopathy in HLA-A29 carriers

finding: The SNP rs7705526 in the TERT promoter was assessed for its association with age and with variants across populations. Variants not associated with this SNP were removed as potential sequencing artifacts. The presence of rs7705526 highlighted its critical role in identifying true CHIP mutations and was part of the filtering criteria applied in the analysis to differentiate significant variants from artifacts. Thus, rs7705526 was confirmed to be a bona fide variant with strong associations with clonal hematopoiesis of indeterminate potential.
title: A practical approach to curate clonal hematopoiesis of indeterminate potential in human genetic datasets

finding: This SNP was identified as significantly associated with anti-MCPyV IgG levels (P=5.95e-15). It is an eQTL for STING1, suggesting its influence on the innate immune response to MCPyV.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: This SNP was associated with MCPyV IgG levels (P=2.97e-09), further validating the role of STING1 in the immune response.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: The recipient C6 rs9200 genotype was associated with hepatocellular carcinoma recurrence following orthotopic liver transplantation in a Han Chinese cohort.
title: Identification of potential core genes in hepatoblastoma via bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs16891982, associated with the SLC45A2 gene, was identified as a missense mutation that regulates skin, hair, and iris colour through its role in the transport of solutes necessary for melanin synthesis. It was also linked to pigmentation and risk of cutaneous malignant melanoma.
title: Ethnicity is not biology: retinal pigment score to evaluate biological variability from ophthalmic imaging using machine learning

finding: Part of a super variant on Chromosome 5 (OR=1.353, p=2.87×10^-8) associated with COVID-19 susceptibility and severity.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: Included in the super variant specified on Chromosome 5, which had an OR of 1.353 (p=2.87×10^-8) and was related to COVID-19 mortality.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: This SNP was part of a super variant on Chromosome 5 associated with heightened risk for COVID-19 mortality, exhibiting an OR of 1.353 (p=2.87×10^-8).
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: Found in the significant super variant on Chromosome 5 linked to COVID-19 mortality with an OR of 1.353 and p-value of 2.87×10^-8.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: Identified in the super variant on Chromosome 5, associated with COVID-19 risk, showing an OR of 1.353 and a p-value of 2.87×10^-8.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: Mapped to Chromosome 5 as part of a super variant linked to COVID-19 severity, having an OR of 1.353 (p-value=2.87×10^-8).
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: Adjacent to rs180899355 in the TAS2R gene on Chromosome 5, this SNP was previously related to COVID-19 susceptibility in patient studies.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: Part of the super variant ch5_138 with an OR of 1.306 (p=5.71×10^-7) that suggested variations affecting severity of COVID-19 infection.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: This SNP was identified through traditional GWAS with significant association to COVID-19 mortality (p=2.66×10^-8) and was located within the region of JAKMIP2 gene.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: Part of the traditional finding in the context of JAKMIP2 gene association with COVID-19 testing positive, indicating a related risk factor for COVID-19.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: The SNP rs9687138 was found to be an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the gene ANKH. The A allele of this SNP was associated with increased expression of ANKH, which in turn was linked to increased aortic strain. This finding aligned with the established role of the ANKH protein in inhibiting vascular calcification.
title: The Genetic Determinants of Aortic Distension

finding: The study identified rs4449583 as a shared causal variant between ovarian cancer (OC) and seborrheic keratosis, suggesting a genetic link impacting both conditions.
title: Phenome-wide association study of ovarian cancer identifies common comorbidities and reveals shared genetics with complex diseases and biomarkers

finding: The study found a potential novel association between rs10069690 at the TERT locus and a lower risk of seborrheic keratosis, indicating a potentially protective role.
title: Phenome-wide association study of ovarian cancer identifies common comorbidities and reveals shared genetics with complex diseases and biomarkers

finding: The variant was identified as being in linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs4449583, suggesting that it is related to the genetic risk associated with OC as observed in the Phelan OC GWAS.
title: Phenome-wide association study of ovarian cancer identifies common comorbidities and reveals shared genetics with complex diseases and biomarkers

finding: The variant rs373863828 was identified as a genetic risk factor associated with increased body mass index (BMI) in Samoan adults. Notably, while this variant's minor allele (A) was linked to higher BMI, it paradoxically correlated with lower odds of developing type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM). This findings emphasized the unique metabolic implications of the CREB3 Regulatory Factor (CREBRF) variant in Pacific Islander populations.
title: Characterization of sleep apnea among a sample of adults from Samoa

finding: In this study, the imputation quality for rs200884524, located on chromosome 5 in the BTNL9 gene, was determined to be significantly higher when using reference panels that included Samoan haplotypes, with an r2 value ranging from 0.89 to 0.95. The minor allele frequency (MAF) among the imputed genotypes for 1,834 Samoan individuals was found to be between 0.207 and 0.222, closer to the expected MAF of 0.202-0.233 identified from targeted genotyping in separate cohorts of similar ancestry. The study highlighted that the TOPMed panel provided better imputation accuracy for MAF compared to the 1000G panel, likely correlating with the presence of Pacific haplotypes at this specific locus, suggesting the importance of population-specific panels in improving imputation quality for variant association studies.
title: Improving imputation quality in Samoans through the integration of population-specific sequences into existing reference panels

finding: The SNP rs6868292 was identified as a unique locus on chromosome 5 associated with endophenotype T2:93. This ENDO represented brain structures such as planum polare, supramarginal gyrus, and key subcortical areas including pallidum, putamen, and thalamus. The locus was found to have a significant association with a p-value of 9.02×10−11, marking it as an original finding not previously reported in traditional IDP-based UK Biobank GWAS.
title: New phenotype discovery method by unsupervised deep representation learning empowers genetic association studies of brain imaging

finding: The SNP rs60200309-A was identified as a risk variant associated with severe COVID-19, particularly in younger patients (<65 years) within the Japanese population. It demonstrated genome-wide significance with a p-value of 1.2 × 10^-8 and an odds ratio (OR) of 2.01, indicating a 101% increased risk for severe disease. This allele was prevalent among East Asians, with a minor allele frequency of 0.097, but was rare in European populations.
title: Japan COVID-19 Task Force: a nation-wide consortium to elucidate host genetics of COVID-19 pandemic in Japan

finding: This SNP was associated with decreased performance on the digit symbol coding task in individuals diagnosed with mood disorders, specifically showing a beta value of -28.3 and a P value of 0.006.
title: Genome-wide significant risk loci for mood disorders in the Old Order Amish founder population

finding: This SNP was suggested to be associated with processing speed in teenagers aged 10 to 17 years, highlighting its relevance to cognitive function.
title: Associations between DNA methylation and cognitive function in early-stage hormone receptor-positive breast cancer patients

finding: This SNP was reported to have associations with general cognitive performance when jointly analyzed with education-related variables and personality traits.
title: Associations between DNA methylation and cognitive function in early-stage hormone receptor-positive breast cancer patients

finding: This SNP was associated with general cognitive performance in a multivariate GWAS context, indicating its role in cognitive ability.
title: Associations between DNA methylation and cognitive function in early-stage hormone receptor-positive breast cancer patients

finding: The SNP rs7706161, located near the IRX1 gene, was found to be genome-wide significant and related to Raynaud's syndrome, suggesting potential implications in developmental processes affecting peripheral vasculature.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: The rs7705526-A variant at the TERT locus emerged as the strongest signal in the analysis of CHIP, showing an odds ratio (OR) of 1.26 (95% confidence interval (CI) 1.23-1.29) and a highly significant p-value of 2.6 x 10^-81, indicating a significant association with CHIP-related conditions.
title: Germline genomic and phenomic landscape of clonal hematopoiesis in 323,112 individuals

finding: The selenium increasing variant rs17823744 in DMGDH was negatively associated with insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF-1).
title: New insights into the genetic etiology of 57 essential and non-essential trace elements in humans

finding: The SNP rs117579809 was identified as a cis-pQTL for the protein HARS1 in the CKB study, but similar associations were not reported in the UKB-PPP. This suggests an evolutionary divergence in genetic regulation impacting HARS1 levels among different populations.
title: Ancestry diversity in the genetic determinants of the human plasma proteome and associated new drug targets

finding: The context indicates that this SNP, along with TGFBI levels, improved classification metrics for significant fibrosis stages, confirming its importance in the biomarker context for liver conditions.
title: Plasma Proteome Variation and its Genetic Determinants in Children and Adolescents

finding: The SNP rs2112347 contributed to the overlapping significant causal associations in the analysis of PCOS, indicating its influence alongside other obestiy-related SNPs.
title: Both general- and central- obesity are causally associated with polycystic ovarian syndrome: Findings of a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The lead variant rs10066378:T>C, located upstream of IRF1, increased the risk for critical illness with an OR of 1.09 (P = 2.7 × 10^-9) and for hospitalization (OR = 1.07, P = 3.74 × 10^-10).
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs272889 was found to be significantly associated with increased habitual dietary intake of dairy, with a strong correlation identified in a genome-wide association study (GWAS) conducted in a cohort of 3409 individuals. The study marked this SNP as the most strongly associated variant (p=3.6E-20) within the SLC22A5 gene, which codes for a transmembrane carnitine transporter protein involved in regulating intracellular carnitine levels. This association suggests a potential role for rs272889 in the metabolism of carnitine, which has implications for understanding its influences on conditions like autism.
title: Unraveling the metabolomic architecture of autism in a large Danish population-based cohort

finding: The variant rs4704210 at the HMGCR locus was associated with individuals taking HMG CoA reductase inhibitors, showing an OR of 1.11 and a highly significant p-value of 2.0×10^-27, highlighting its relevance in medication usage.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The rs10380 variant in the MTRR gene was linked to an improvement in positive symptoms among South African patients, indicating its potential relevance in treatment response.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The rs10473984 variant within the CRHBP locus was found to be associated with poorer treatment outcomes in African American patients taking citalopram.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The study found that the C allele of rs2431697 was associated with an increased risk of Psoriasis Vulgaris (PsV), with significant differences observed in both the genotype (CC+CT) and allele (C) frequencies between cases and controls (p=0.019; OR=1.463 for genotype and p=0.027; OR=1.496 for allele).
title: MicroRNA-146a polymorphisms are Associated with Psoriasis Vulgaris

finding: The findings indicated that the G allele of rs2910164 was linked to a higher susceptibility to Psoriasis Vulgaris (PsV), showing significant association with the GG genotype (p=0.027; OR=1.582) and the allele (G) (p=0.027; OR=1.582) among the studied cohort.
title: MicroRNA-146a polymorphisms are Associated with Psoriasis Vulgaris

finding: The SNP rs112537099 was utilized in the prioritization of genes contributing to gout-associated immune priming.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of 2,622,830 individuals reveals new pathogenic pathways in gout

finding: The rs517339 SNP was associated through SMR with regulatory effects on ERGIC1 suggesting gene involvement in ALS risk.
title: Common and rare variant association analyses in Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis identify 15 risk loci with distinct genetic architectures and neuron-specific biology

finding: The rs10463311 SNP demonstrated regulatory potential affecting GPX3 and TNIP1 through eQTL/mQTL links confirming its potential role in ALS.
title: Common and rare variant association analyses in Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis identify 15 risk loci with distinct genetic architectures and neuron-specific biology

finding: The SNP rs12657665 was located in the region of ADAMTS19, a protease involved in extracellular matrix remodeling. It was part of a credible set linked to an eQTL for ADAMTS19 in skeletal muscle, signifying its relevance in muscle biology.
title: Candidate gene modifiers of dystrophinopathy identified by the uniform application of genome-wide datasets to novel GWAS-identified loci

finding: The SNP rs114248865, associated with the gene GRIA1, was found to be significantly related to increased ΔNIHSS scores across cohorts, suggesting that the minor allele was linked to greater neurological decline post-stroke.
title: Multi-ancestry genetic study in 5,876 patients identifies an association between excitotoxic genes and early outcomes after acute ischemic stroke

finding: The SNP rs2459732 was also associated with circulating leptin and confirmed as a positive causal finding within metabolic traits linked to the reproductive conditions studied.
title: The role of obesity in female reproductive conditions: A Mendelian Randomisation study

finding: The rs871269 variant at the TNIP1 locus was identified as a novel genome-wide significant risk factor for FTLD-TDP, emphasizing its potential role in the disease's pathogenesis.
title: Deciphering Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for FTLD-TDP Pathological Subtypes via Whole-Genome Sequencing

finding: The SNP rs4150197 was associated with anthropometric traits such as hip circumference and weight. It also showed correlations with various image-derived phenotypes from diffuse MRI, though it was not directly linked to cancer risk or glioma risk factors.
title: Multi-omics Mendelian randomisation using expression, splicing and protein quantitative trait loci: identification of novel drug targets for gliomagenesis

finding: The SNP rs6882088 was identified as one of the significant SNPs likely affecting transcription factor binding, thereby influencing gene target expression.
title: Unveiling Shared Genetic Links between Blood Cell Traits and Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: This SNP represented a predicted high-confidence protein truncation variant linked to HF, contributing to the understanding of coding consequences in HF genetics.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The protein-increasing A-allele of rs351855 was associated with an increased risk for type 2 diabetes (beta=0.05, p-value=1.1×10−7). This was supported by a high posterior probability for a shared genetic signal with plasma levels of FGFR4.
title: From genome to phenome via the proteome: broad capture, antibody-based proteomics to explore disease mechanisms

finding: The lead cis-pQTL rs58198139 was associated with moderate LDL-cholesterol levels (beta=0.03, p-value=7×10−44), supporting its influence on lipid metabolism through TIMD4.
title: From genome to phenome via the proteome: broad capture, antibody-based proteomics to explore disease mechanisms

finding: The variant rs57262206, identified as c.-149G>A, was part of the pathogenic/likely pathogenic variants within the SLC22A5 gene associated with primary carnitine deficiency (PCD). This SNP was included in the detailed variant analysis which comprised 2209 variants in the gnomAD v4.1 database, supporting its relevance in the genetic understanding of PCD.
title: The global prevalence and genetic spectrum of primary carnitine deficiency

finding: The SNP rs16889360 was identified as being specifically associated with bone metastasis in colorectal cancer. Its -log10 p-value increased from 2.06 in the overall analysis to 7.97 in the bone-metastasis specific analysis, indicating its strong association as a bone-specific risk variant. This SNP was implicated as part of the genetic factors that may contribute to different metastatic pathways.
title: Functional annotation with expression validation identifies novel metastasis-relevant genes from post-GWAS risk loci in sporadic colorectal carcinomas

finding: The SNP rs7711080 was associated with colorectal cancer cases across all stages (I-IV). This SNP was recognized as tagging cases for broader metastatic potential rather than being subtype-specific. Although it increased significance in association testing, it was highlighted that it did not reach genome-wide significance possibly due to the small size of the replication population.
title: Functional annotation with expression validation identifies novel metastasis-relevant genes from post-GWAS risk loci in sporadic colorectal carcinomas

finding: This SNP was associated with the 5q22.3 region, showing a significant MTAG-CES p-value of 4.76×10<sup>−7</sup>, which was more significant than its p-value of 6.13×10<sup>−3</sup> in the MEGASTROKE-CES analysis.
title: MULTITRAIT ANALYSIS EXPANDS GENETIC RISK FACTORS IN CARDIOEMBOLIC STROKE

finding: Linked to the NKX2-5 gene, this SNP was previously noted in earlier studies and maintained significant relevance in the MTAG-CES analysis.
title: MULTITRAIT ANALYSIS EXPANDS GENETIC RISK FACTORS IN CARDIOEMBOLIC STROKE

finding: The lead variant rs13153019 was found at 5q35.3, near the fibroblast growth factor receptor 4 (FGFR4). This association was novel and indicated a relationship with psoriasis, as FGFR4 interacts with FGF19, known to regulate keratinocyte proliferation in psoriatic skin. Earlier studies had not noted this specific association.
title: Genetic study of psoriasis highlights its close link with socio-economic status and affective symptoms

finding: The SNP rs148371256 in the NRG2 gene was specific to the B1 line and was classified as rare (ExAC_SAS score of 0.0005). It was determined to be deleterious by three prediction tools, and its differential expression in the BD lines highlighted its potential involvement in the cellular migration irregularities associated with bipolar disorder.
title: Dysregulation in EGF/ERBB signaling pathway may explain abnormalities in cellular migration in bipolar disorder in patient-derived neural precursors

finding: The SNP rs12916 was identified as a validated instrument for HMGCR inhibition, showing a strong association with HMGCR expression in blood (p = 1.5E-36). This finding was relevant to exploring the on-target effect of statins in the context of depressive symptoms.
title: Statins and antidepressants induce similar in vitro gene expression responses

finding: The SNP rs17671591 was utilized as a strong eQTL for HMGCR expression in the brain prefrontal cortex (p = 2.5E-05). This finding suggested an important link between brain HMGCR expression and depression, complementing the analysis of the on-target effects of statins.
title: Statins and antidepressants induce similar in vitro gene expression responses

finding: The rs11748327 SNP was the lead variant at the second strongest RP locus, linked to higher expression of the IRX1 gene in skeletal muscle, with an OR of 1.20. The statistical colocalization suggested a shared genetic signal with skeletal muscle and tibial artery expression, confirming its role in increasing RP risk.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies ADRA2A and IRX1 as novel risk genes for Raynaud’s phenomenon

finding: The SNP rs1997583 was found at the 5q34 locus and had a combined odds ratio of 1.26 (P = 5.48 x 10^-14) while being intronic in GABRG2, associated with the GABA type A receptor. Pathogenic variants in this gene were previously linked to familial febrile seizures, highlighting its relevancy in seizure disorders.
title: Genome-wide association study of febrile seizures identifies seven new loci implicating fever response and neuronal excitability genes

finding: The SNP rs2112653 was identified as having a significant role as a shared xQTL among multiple gene-tissue pairs associated with the HMGCR gene affecting LDL-C. Although it was included in a 95% credible set, it did not reach the threshold for individual PIP > 0.5.
title: Uncovering causal gene-tissue pairs and variants: A multivariable TWAS method controlling for infinitesimal effects

finding: The SNP rs7707921 was significantly associated with breast cancer (BC) risk in two meta-analyses yielding an odds ratio of 1.07 (95% CI = [1.05-1.1], p=5e-11), indicating its potential role as a risk variant at the 5q14.1 loci.
title: Mapping of cis-regulatory variants by differential allelic expression analysis identifies candidate risk variants and target genes of 27 breast cancer risk loci

finding: The SNP rs3738 was identified as a strong candidate that may cis-regulate RPS23 by enabling specific binding of hsa-miR-6813-5p, which could decrease RPS23 expression, suggesting a post-transcriptional regulatory mechanism impacting BC risk.
title: Mapping of cis-regulatory variants by differential allelic expression analysis identifies candidate risk variants and target genes of 27 breast cancer risk loci

finding: The SNP rs111549985 was found to be a candidate risk variant associated with increased binding of RNA polymerase II to the promoter of ATG10, suggesting its significant role in regulating this gene, which is linked to BC risk.
title: Mapping of cis-regulatory variants by differential allelic expression analysis identifies candidate risk variants and target genes of 27 breast cancer risk loci

finding: This SNP was shown to preferentially bind critical transcription factors (cMYC and MAX) and was associated with BC risk through influences on RPS23 and ATP6AP1L gene expressions.
title: Mapping of cis-regulatory variants by differential allelic expression analysis identifies candidate risk variants and target genes of 27 breast cancer risk loci

finding: The SNP rs6880209 was indicated to promote binding by MYC and POL2, contributing to increased transcription of ATG10 and ATP6AP1L, thereby affecting BC risk in the examined regulatory pathways.
title: Mapping of cis-regulatory variants by differential allelic expression analysis identifies candidate risk variants and target genes of 27 breast cancer risk loci

finding: The asthma-associated SNP rs1837253 in the TSLP locus exhibited a higher odds ratio in the top quartile of systemic respiratory disease topic weight (1.17±0.02) than in the bottom quartile (1.05±0.02), with P=1 × 10^-4 for difference. This indicated a potential connection between TSLP genetic variation and the comorbidity profile of asthma and atopic dermatitis.
title: Age-dependent topic modelling of comorbidities in UK Biobank identifies disease subtypes with differential genetic risk

finding: The SNP rs2453763 was identified as a genome-wide significant association with Tourette Syndrome (TS) in the context of a novel cohort meta-analysis. It was associated with a decreased risk for TS, with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.7512 and a p-value of 2.62e-8. It exhibited strong imputation quality, indicating its reliability as a marker. Additionally, it was shown to be an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) and splicing quantitative trait locus (sQTL) for genes including NR2F1 and the long non-coding RNA NR2F1-AS in various tissues.
title: Genome-wide Association Study identifies two novel loci for Gilles de la Tourette Syndrome

finding: The rs37369 SNP located in the AGXT2 gene was associated with urinary and plasma levels of 3-aminoisobutyrate and represented an original finding in the context of metabolite associations.
title: Genome-wide characterization of 54 urinary metabolites reveals molecular impact of kidney function

finding: The rs11133665 SNP was associated with multiple amino acids including tryptophan, glycine, and histidine, representing a significant original finding with established prior associations.
title: Genome-wide characterization of 54 urinary metabolites reveals molecular impact of kidney function

finding: Associated with RP, rs12653958 had an odds ratio of 1.17 and a p-value of less than 4.8x10^-13. This SNP acted as the lead variant at a locus previously linked to myocardial infarction and is located near the gene IRX1, where higher expression was related to increased RP risk.
title: ADRA2A and IRX1 are putative risk genes for Raynaud’s phenomenon

finding: As part of the ten prioritized pleiotropic loci, SNP rs17421627 gained significance with an increased sample size and was associated with multiple ocular disorders, reflecting its role in genetic pleiotropy.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: The rs71636247-G variant in MSH3 was also significantly associated with decreased overall survival in subjects treated with temozolomide. Individuals carrying any copy of the G allele had a median survival of 6.2 years compared to 12.2 years for those with the A/A genotype.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The SNP rs146901049-A in MSH3 was associated with poor survival outcomes, with carriers of the A/G pair having a median survival time of only 4.7 years, contrasting sharply with 13.3 years for G/G carriers.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The rs6151863-A variant in MSH3 was associated with an increase in overall survival (HR=0.67), where individuals with any A allele had a median survival of 20.5 months compared to 15.7 months for G/G genotype.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The rs34799825-T SNP was significantly associated with improved survival in subjects treated with temozolomide, with those carrying the C/T or T/T genotype having a median survival of 35.6 months compared to 19.9 months for C/C genotype.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma
