finding: The lead SNP rs72810098 was identified within the A3 dimension, known as 'classical ASD,' and was previously associated with sex hormone-binding globulin levels and implicated in brain development through regulatory apoptotic pathways.
title: Three Imaging Endophenotypes Characterize Neuroanatomical Heterogeneity of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The lead SNP rs1173727 was associated with increased expression of the NPR3 gene, which encodes the C-type natriuretic peptide receptor. This SNP was linked to increased blood pressure and left atrial volume (LAVmaxi). Furthermore, the C-allele of this SNP was nominally significantly associated with an increased risk of heart failure. The study highlighted a novel connection between the NPR3 locus and LAVmaxi, as well as its overlapping effects with genetic variations in other genes in the natriuretic peptide pathway, such as NPPA and NPPB.
title: Genetic and environmental determinants of diastolic heart function

finding: The rs3777175 SNP on chr.5q15 was previously associated with IgA levels (Beta=0.08, P=7.81×10^-30). It showed independent signals with complex associations and highlighted ELL2 as a candidate gene, where the IgA-increasing allele was linked to lower expression of ELL2.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: The rs6859219 SNP on chr.5q11.2 showcased a positive association with IgA levels (Beta=0.07, P=1.41×10^-20) and was implicated in several immune-mediated disorders.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: The variant rs115018790 was identified as a significant recessive signal with an odds ratio of 2.63 (95% CI: 2.03-3.41) in homozygous carriers, indicating a doubled risk for type 2 diabetes compared to baseline. It showed a strong association with reduced expression of the PELO gene and linked to multiple diabetes-related traits, including a 10% decrease in LDL and a 20% increase in triglycerides.
title: Genome-Wide Association Meta-Analysis Using a Recessive Model Illuminates Genetic Architecture of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: This low-frequency variant (MAF=0.01) was associated with a large effect size for type 2 diabetes, with an odds ratio of 6.94 (95% CI: 3.63-13.27). It was identified within an intron of the ADAMTS6 gene and displayed significant dominance deviation, further supporting its significant role in diabetes risk.
title: Genome-Wide Association Meta-Analysis Using a Recessive Model Illuminates Genetic Architecture of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: The rs7730971 SNP was found to be significantly associated with splicing of a cryptic exon in the FBXO38 gene in whole blood and lung tissue. The G allele of rs7730971 was associated with an increased risk of COPD and was linked to increased inclusion of the cryptic exon, which leads to a transcript with a premature stop codon likely subject to nonsense mediated decay. Additionally, the G allele was associated with decreased gene expression of FBXO38, suggesting its potential protective role against COPD.
title: Overlap between COPD genetic association results and transcriptional quantitative trait loci

finding: The SNP rs10037493 was associated with additional exons of FBXO38 that resulted in shorter protein isoforms. The risk allele was linked to these truncated versions, which lacked the F-box domain, implicating it in a loss of function mechanism potentially contributing to COPD risk.
title: Overlap between COPD genetic association results and transcriptional quantitative trait loci

finding: The SNP rs2061770, located intronic of SNX24 at the SNCAIP locus, was identified in the GWAS of factor 23. This locus was associated with heart rate response to exercise.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The downstream variant rs6899303 near PCSK1 was significantly associated with BMI at peak infancy, indicating its relevance to early obesity.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity

finding: The rs263377 SNP associates with multiple anthropometric traits, showing peak influence on BMI at one year, linking it to childhood obesity pathways.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity

finding: The rare intergenic variant rs528577783 was significantly associated with HGSOC, although specific risk estimates were not detailed in the findings.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study of 398,238 women unveils seven novel loci associated with high-grade serous epithelial ovarian cancer risk

finding: The SNP rs13184621 was also investigated in relation to vaccine responses in patients with cancer. The findings from this cohort study revealed that the vaccination responses were appropriate and adverse events were within the expected range, supporting the safety profile of mRNA vaccines among immunocompromised individuals.
title: mRNA-COVID19 vaccination can be considered safe and tolerable for frail patients

finding: The SNP rs7701440 was associated with the isoform ENST00000511382 of the gene PDE4D and showed a strong link to schizophrenia (SCZ) risk with an imputed fetal expression P = 2.4 × 10^-8. This finding built upon previous GWAS findings that implicated PDE4D in SCZ.
title: Isoform-level transcriptome-wide association uncovers extensive novel genetic risk mechanisms for neuropsychiatric disorders in the human brain

finding: The sentinel variant rs1756167317 displayed an increased risk of IPF in females (OR 2.18) and a decreased risk in males (OR 0.63). This SNP was also found to have consistent effects in other studies, but its association was not previously reported in relation to IPF.
title: Genome-wide SNP-sex interaction analysis of susceptibility to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The SNP rs16891982 located in the SLC45A2 gene was associated with eye color and risk of chronic hepatitis, with a beta of -0.35 and a p-value of 2.8×10^-88.
title: A predictive atlas of disease onset from retinal fundus photographs

finding: The AGXT2 locus, through SNP rs191495, was shown to have a decrease of -0.05 in valine levels, marking its relevance in amino acid metabolism.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: This previously known association at the BHMT2 locus linked selenium level regulation to genetic factors.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: rs62360376 was identified as the sole colocalizing cis-eQTL for GDNF, located in skeletal muscle, indicating tissue specificity.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The SNP rs2909950 was linked to TLA during the evening (6pm-8pm), highlighting its role in influencing physical activity trends related to evening hours.
title: Genome-wide association studies of 27 accelerometry-derived physical activity measurements identifies novel loci and genetic mechanisms

finding: SNP rs12717867 was associated with lipid-related phenotypes, suggesting a genetic connection to metabolic factors that may influence physical activity behavior.
title: Genome-wide association studies of 27 accelerometry-derived physical activity measurements identifies novel loci and genetic mechanisms

finding: The rs17057880 variant was linked to male-specific associations in primary open-angle glaucoma, suggesting a role in gender-influenced genetic susceptibility to the disease.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: This SNP exhibited a strong association with the inflammation component (PC3) in males (-1.23SD), indicating it has potential implications in AD pathology specific to the male population.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The rs116635225 variant was associated with lower MCH levels and demonstrated statistical significance in analyses of African ancestry individuals.
title: Whole genome sequencing association analysis of quantitative red blood cell phenotypes: the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: The SNP rs7063 was linked to alternative polyadenylation events in the gene ERAP1, leading to increased usage of a distal poly(A) site and an isoform switch from a shorter isoform to a longer isoform with an extended 3' UTR. This switch was associated with the expression level of differentially used 3' UTRs in smoking-related diseases and traits, highlighting the role of this genetic variant in posttranscriptional modulation affected by cigarette smoking.
title: Cigarette Smoking-Associated Isoform Switching and 3’ UTR Lengthening Via Alternative Polyadenylation

finding: The TT genotype of rs1065407 was found to have a significant synergistic effect on the risk of developing Behçet's disease. This finding highlighted an important SNP that increases disease risk and was extracted from a study utilizing MB-MDR on a sample of 1,524 matched patients.
title: Understanding the role and adoption of artificial intelligence techniques in rheumatology research: an in-depth review of the literature

finding: The TT genotype of rs30187 had significant antagonistic effects on Behçet's disease, indicating that this SNP may decrease risk or mitigate the effects of the disease in the evaluated population of 1,524 matched patients.
title: Understanding the role and adoption of artificial intelligence techniques in rheumatology research: an in-depth review of the literature

finding: The AA genotype of rs469876 was associated with significant antagonistic effects on Behçet's disease, suggesting a potential protective role in the context of this disease within the studied cohort of 1,524 matched patients.
title: Understanding the role and adoption of artificial intelligence techniques in rheumatology research: an in-depth review of the literature

finding: This SNP located in the lncRNA CTD-2337A12.1, was 119 kilobases 3' of the PCSK1 gene, and was significant for ascending aortic distensibility.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: The SNP rs76430661 was identified as having the strongest association signal for longevity located at 5q35.3. It was linked to six prioritized genes including COL23A1, and it functioned as an eQTL, suggesting potential influences on aging despite not having prior associations noted in aging.
title: Polygenic prediction of human longevity on the supposition of pervasive pleiotropy

finding: The lead variant at the ISL1 locus, rs9291768 at 5q11.1, was replicated with a p-value of 1.48×10⁻³ and an odds ratio of 1.62, indicating its involvement in the phenotypic presentation of bladder exstrophy.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals contribution of rare and common variation to structural kidney and urinary tract malformations

finding: The rare indel rs550737686 showed a strong association in the ISL1 region with a p-value of 2.35×10⁻⁵ and an odds ratio of 6.11, suggesting potential relevance in bladder exstrophy pathology.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals contribution of rare and common variation to structural kidney and urinary tract malformations

finding: This rare intergenic variant rs115201978 was found to have a high CADD score of 16.9 and significant association at this locus (p-value 1.28×10⁻⁴) while being potentially causative, although it was not in linkage disequilibrium with the nearby lead indel.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals contribution of rare and common variation to structural kidney and urinary tract malformations

finding: As another novel shared SNP, rs9986189 contributed to the evidence supporting a genetic correlation between BMI and MS.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: The A allele of rs373863828 in the CREBRF gene was found to be associated with a significant increase in body mass index (BMI), with an increase of up to 3 kg/m2 per A allele. Additionally, this SNP was linked to significantly lower circulating levels of the muscle inhibitory hormone myostatin. The study demonstrated that the A allele was related to a trend toward increased relative lean mass (although not statistically significant, p=0.06) and a significant reduction in total fat mass (p=0.031). Overall, findings suggested that this allele contributed to lower myostatin levels, likely resulting in an increase in lean muscle mass, and it was associated with a reduced risk of type-2 diabetes (T2D). Thus, the rs373863828 A-allele could be regarded as beneficial in these populations, particularly among Māori and Pacific peoples.
title: The minor allele of the CREBRF rs373863828 p.R457Q coding variant is associated with reduced levels of myostatin in males: Implications for body composition

finding: The SNP rs2973744 in the gene COL23A1 was identified as a significant risk factor for eczema herpeticum (EH) in atopic dermatitis (AD) patients. This SNP was found in 5% of ADEH+ patients, compared to 1.6% of healthy donors and 0% of ADEH- patients, indicating a strong association with EH development (p=0.034). The presence of this SNP resulted in higher expression levels of COL23A1 in keratinocytes, which were more susceptible to HSV-1 infection. Enhanced COL23A1 expression was linked to greater HSV-1 gene expression and cell-to-cell spread, suggesting a mechanism where this genetic variant promotes HSV-1 infection by downregulating immune response genes.
title: Identification and characterization of collagen XXIII alpha 1 as a novel risk factor for eczema herpeticum

finding: The rs1801020 SNP, located in the F12 gene, was associated with activated partial thromboplastin time (APTT) with a p-value of 4.13E-16. This association replicated findings from a previous study conducted in the East Asian population.
title: A Chinese host genetic study discovered type I interferons and causality of cholesterol levels and WBC counts on COVID-19 severity

finding: The variant rs335189 on 5q23.2 in PRDM6 was significantly associated with breast texture variation (P = 7.30 × 10−5). This locus is previously linked to mammographic density and has implications in breast cancer tumorigenesis.
title: A genome-wide association study of mammographic texture variation

finding: The nonsynonymous variant rs116483731 (p.Arg20Gln) in SPDL1 was implicated in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF), and in 15 non-suspicious loci, this variant had the highest posterior inclusion probability (PIP).
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: The missense variant rs16903574 (p.Phe319Leu) in OTULINL indicated a significant increase in PIP (1.0) and was important in the asthma meta-analysis.
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: The SNP rs6580223 was previously discovered and was associated with the joint phenotype of IBD-PBC, indicating its relevance in the shared genetic architecture between these diseases.
title: Rare Comorbidity between Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Primary Biliary Cholangitis: Evidence from Causality, Shared Genetic Architecture and Transcriptomics

finding: SNP rs6889076, associated with CCNO, was found to be linked with eosinophil counts. Additionally, mutations in CCNO are related to primary ciliary dyskinesia, which can lead to obstructive lung disease, implicating its relevance to COPD.
title: Leveraging deep-learning on raw spirograms to improve genetic understanding and risk scoring of COPD despite noisy labels

finding: The SNP rs7705526 was associated with several cancers, especially reproductive cancers such as ovarian and prostate cancer, indicating its potential overlap in mechanisms with FGT polyps.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study to determine the genetic underpinnings of female genital tract polyps

finding: The variant rs2853677 was identified as a lead variant in the 5p15.33 region associated with overall clonal hematopoiesis (CH) susceptibility, with a genome-wide significant P-value of 2.4×10−50. This finding was part of the increasing number of significant loci implicated in CH, contributing to the understanding of the inherited predisposition to this condition.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: In the same 5p15.33 region, rs7705526 was recognized as a previously reported variant, remaining genome-wide significant upon conditioning analyses, illustrating a strong association with CH, reinforcing the genetic architecture related to this phenotype.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: The SNP rs13156167 was documented as another lead variant in the 5p15.33 region connected to CH susceptibility, which supports findings related to inherited risk factors leading to this condition.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: Similarly, rs2086132 served as a distinct signal in the 5p15.33 locus for CH susceptibility, helping to elucidate the genetic factors implicating clonal hematopoiesis.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: Identified as a fifth independent association at 5p15.33, rs13356700 was found approximately 776 kb from TERT and showed significant association with CH, indicating its potential role in the genetic landscape of clonal hematopoiesis.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: The variant rs2736100 was confirmed as a risk locus for TET2-CH, demonstrating associations within the same region as overall CH susceptibility, extending the genetic framework for CH subtypes.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: Located at 5p13.3, rs72755524 represents a previously unreported locus for small clone CH, enhancing the understanding of genetic variation associated with this subtype of CH.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: The ncRNA intronic variant rs56397275 found at locus 5p15.33 was associated with lung cancer risk, independent of the previously known genes TERT and CLPTM1L in the region. This was significant for adenocarcinoma.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs150464151 near KCNN2 on 5q22.3 was associated with various forms of lung cancer, including squamous cell carcinoma (SCC), and showed predominance in Asian populations.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The variant rs6883387 in ANKRD33B on 5p15.2 was associated with non-small cell lung cancer, indicating its role in immune response linked to eosinophil counts.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: Near DCTN4-RBM22 on 5q33.1, rs142858153 demonstrated association with adenocarcinoma risk, marking its relevance in lung cancer biology.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The sentinel association rs2853677 was revealed on 5p15.33, showing connections to TERT and CLPTM1L in relation to lung cancer risk.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The variant rs13167280 located in TERT was also recognized in association with lung cancer risk in multifactorial evaluations.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs31487 near CLPTM1L was statistically significant in contributing to lung cancer risk, emphasizing its relevance in genetic studies.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: Linked to DNAH5, involved in ciliary microtubule functions. This variant is considered ultra-rare and predicted to have damaging effects.
title: The genetics of idiopathic intracranial hypertension (IIH): Integration of population studies and clinical data

finding: The SNP rs986391 showed a significant association with TUD, with a p-value of 3.08E-14, and was identified as deleterious (CADD=18.9), indicating its connection to smoking initiation and cessation.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorder prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: The variant rs72810983-A in CPEB4 was associated with an increased risk of NMSC.
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease Risk Variants Are Associated with an Increased Risk of Skin Cancer

finding: The SNP rs2307111 indicated high posterior probability as a likely causal variant in the POC5 locus for BMI association, showing strong evidence across different population analyses.
title: WHOLE GENOME SEQUENCING ANALYSIS OF BODY MASS INDEX IDENTIFIES NOVEL AFRICAN ANCESTRY-SPECIFIC RISK ALLELE

finding: This SNP, located on the gene TNIP1, was associated with Alzheimer’s disease and hippocampal volumes. It was noted for its intronic placement and acted as an eQTL affecting expression levels of LACTB, RAB8B, and RPS27L in multiple brain tissues. It also reached suggestive genome-wide significance with a P-value of 3.7×10^-5 and genome-wide significance in a meta-analysis with a P-value of 8.7×10^-9.
title: Identification of novel associations of candidate loci with Alzheimer’s disease by leveraging the shared genetic basis with hippocampal volume

finding: Located on the previously reported AD risk gene IGIP, this SNP was new to Alzheimer's disease research. It had a conjFDR of 0.0215, indicating it was part of significant findings related to hippocampal volume and AD.
title: Identification of novel associations of candidate loci with Alzheimer’s disease by leveraging the shared genetic basis with hippocampal volume

finding: Located near C5orf56, this SNP was previously associated with asthma and lung function. It exhibited significant association with ACO, yielding an odds ratio of 1.12 and a p-value of 9.37×10^-12, indicating its contribution to ACO risk.
title: Genetic associations and architecture of asthma-chronic obstructive pulmonary disease overlap

finding: A missense variant in FAM105A, this SNP was identified for asthma earlier and was associated with ACO in this study with odds ratio of 1.20 and p-value of 3.8×10^-10, where it was predicted to be deleterious.
title: Genetic associations and architecture of asthma-chronic obstructive pulmonary disease overlap

finding: This intergenic signal near TSLP was linked to ACO with an odds ratio of 1.16 and a p-value of 1.53×10^-18, and there were significant chromatin interactions observed, suggesting its role in asthma and allergic disease.
title: Genetic associations and architecture of asthma-chronic obstructive pulmonary disease overlap

finding: The rs26653 variant, a missense mutation in the ERAP1 gene, changed the amino acid from arginine to proline. It was associated with severe Hemorrhagic Fever with Renal Syndrome caused by PUUV, showing a genome-wide significant p-value of 2.93×10^(-8). This finding indicated that genetic factors related to viral peptide processing influence the severity of PUUV infections.
title: Genetic analysis implicates ERAP1 and HLA as risk factors for severe Puumala virus infection

finding: The SNP rs78408340, corresponding to the p.S539W allele in the PAM gene, was identified as a hypomorphic T2D-risk allele. Carriers of this allele displayed a significant reduction in response to GLP-1 receptor agonists, with a relative loss of 44% in glucose lowering effect, measured by glycated hemoglobin. This finding demonstrated that genetic variation in PAM had crucial effects on incretin signaling and T2D medication response.
title: Type 2 Diabetes risk alleles in Peptidyl-glycine Alpha-amidating Monooxygenase influence GLP-1 levels and response to GLP-1 Receptor Agonists

finding: The SNP rs35658696, associated with the p.D563G allele in the PAM gene, was also recognized as a hypomorphic T2D-risk allele. Individuals carrying this allele experienced a 20% reduction in the glucose lowering effect of GLP-1 receptor agonists. This indicated that the presence of this genetic variation in PAM influenced the therapeutic response in T2D patients.
title: Type 2 Diabetes risk alleles in Peptidyl-glycine Alpha-amidating Monooxygenase influence GLP-1 levels and response to GLP-1 Receptor Agonists

finding: The shared genetic variant rs1472215 was identified between F2R expression in blood from eQTLGen and in tubulointerstitial tissue from NEPTUNE, with a posterior probability of 89.1%. This finding supported the link between genetically proxied expression of F2R and its potential implications in renal phenotypes.
title: Genetically-proxied lower PAR1 and renal phenotypes: a drug-target Mendelian Randomization study

finding: The genetic variant rs250753 was found to be shared between F2R expression in blood from GTEx and tubulointerstitial tissue from NEPTUNE, with a posterior probability of 95.4%. This result indicated a significant connection of rs250753 to F2R expression relevant to renal phenotypes.
title: Genetically-proxied lower PAR1 and renal phenotypes: a drug-target Mendelian Randomization study

finding: Associated with ABLIM3 at p=2.87×10−14, rs1011400 was linked to changes in gene expression in the macula, suggesting its role in the development and health of retinal tissue.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: Proxy for rs2277066, associated with CCNI2 and SEPT8 expression changes in non-macular retinal pigment epithelium at p=3.00×10−5, indicating its relevance in retinal cell dynamics.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: The TERT rs2853669 polymorphism was identified in 40% of the patients in the extension FFPE cohort, which included 8 PCNSL and 6 SCNSL samples. This SNP was associated with increased cancer risk, indicating its relevance in the pathogenesis of these lymphomas.
title: The genomic and transcriptional landscape of primary central nervous system lymphoma

finding: Variant rs62358361, located in the C9 gene intron, was found to have a protective association with AMD by significantly reducing CREBBP, implicating liver metabolic pathways in AMD pathology.
title: A Proteogenomic Signature of Age-related Macular Degeneration in Blood

finding: This SNP demonstrated evidence of colocalization with platelets, neutrophils, and the platelet to lymphocyte ratio (PLR) in the 5p15.33 region related to IDH-wildtype gliomas, indicating multiple candidate mechanisms in this locus. It was implicated as a risk variant specifically for IDH-wildtype tumors with significant associations to immune-related traits.
title: Genetic predisposition to altered blood cell homeostasis is associated with glioma risk and survival

finding: The SNP rs325500 was documented in shared loci relating to both PTSD and various cardiovascular health measures, reflecting its potential influence.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: A 2017 study involving Caribbean Hispanic individuals identified a novel and population-specific locus near FBXL7 with the lead SNP rs75002042. This SNP exhibited a much higher minor allele frequency in individuals with African ancestry (around 20%) compared to those of European ancestry (0.009%). The study also replicated six previously reported loci in European populations, further emphasizing the relevance of ancestry in genetic risk factors for neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Assessing the lack of diversity in genetics research across neurodegenerative diseases: a systematic review of the GWAS Catalog and literature

finding: The SNP rs12522573 was recognized as a novel association with CBC setpoints. This highlighted its potential role in genetically driven variations in hematologic parameters.
title: Hematologic setpoints are a stable and patient-specific deep phenotype

finding: The SNP rs10043270 was determined to be a novel association with CBC setpoints. Its detection contributed to the genetic understanding of individual blood count regulation.
title: Hematologic setpoints are a stable and patient-specific deep phenotype

finding: The variant rs2937516 was identified on chromosome 5 at 5p14.3 with a P-value of 1.62×10−8 and OR of 0.68, indicating a protective association with ulcerative colitis (UC). This finding supported previous significant associations in the literature related to UC.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The SNP rs2070721-G was linked with a reduction in IRF1 expression, correlating with a higher risk of ER-positive breast cancer while also increasing the risk for ulcerative colitis, further indicating its role in autoimmune and cancer risks.
title: Mapping inherited genetic variation with opposite effects on autoimmune disease and cancer identifies candidate drug targets associated with the anti-tumor immune response

finding: Consistently fine-mapped for height but showed non-significant association in BBJ due to LD with rs1966265.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: This missense variant in <italic>FGFR4</italic> was fine-mapped for height and showed correlation with rs244711.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: SNP rs28363070, located in the SLC6A3 gene, was significantly associated with progression to dementia in PD, reporting a HR of 4.42 and a p-value of 2.32 x 10^-08. This gene, known for encoding the dopamine transporter, relates to dopamine metabolism and its implications in cognitive performance.
title: Association between the LRP1B and APOE loci and the development of Parkinson’s disease dementia

finding: was linked to pigmentation traits, particularly hair colour and tanning responses.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: Another shared pQTL across ancestries, this SNP related to blood levels of numerous proteins further illustrating its biological significance.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: This SNP correlated with increased serum IgA levels, which has been implicated in lower multiple myeloma risk, suggesting its significance in immunoglobulin production.
title: The genetics and epidemiology of N- and O- IgA glycomics

finding: This SNP was associated with lower multiple myeloma risk and showed a stronger association with circulating IgA levels compared to IgG, potentially indicating a specific role for IgA in malignant transformations.
title: The genetics and epidemiology of N- and O- IgA glycomics

finding: This SNP was linked to lower IgA N-glycan sialylation and has implications in the context of multiple myeloma, suggesting that IgA glycosylation could influence disease progression.
title: The genetics and epidemiology of N- and O- IgA glycomics

finding: This SNP in the ANKH gene was noted as significantly enriched in centenarians, associated with lower Alzheimer's risk due to its effects on brain pathology.
title: Cognitively Healthy Centenarians are genetically protected against Alzheimer’s disease specifically in immune and endo-lysosomal systems

finding: The rs2927608 eQTL for ERAP2 had a beta of 1.06 and was significant with a p-value of 5.60e-32, suggesting a strong association. Previous studies linked SNPs in ERAP1/ERAP2 to increased risk for developing psoriasis, demonstrating a genetic influence on disease onset.
title: Immunosuppression causes dynamic changes in expression QTLs in psoriatic skin

finding: The rs2242652-A allele was linked with the VNTR6-1-Long allele, showing a high association with reduced risks of bladder and prostate cancers while being associated with an elevated risk of glioma, breast, endometrial, ovarian, and thyroid cancers. The association was fully explained by the VNTR6-1-Long allele.
title: Genetic regulation of TERT splicing contributes to reduced or elevated cancer risk by altering cellular longevity and replicative potential

finding: The rs10069690-T allele was associated with an increased risk of glioma, breast, endometrial, ovarian, and thyroid cancers while showing a reduced risk for bladder and prostate cancers. This variant was noted to create an alternative splicing site in TERT intron 4 that influenced TERT expression and was in high linkage disequilibrium with VNTR6-1.
title: Genetic regulation of TERT splicing contributes to reduced or elevated cancer risk by altering cellular longevity and replicative potential

finding: The SNP rs17656349 was associated with both Crohn's Disease (CD) and ulcerative colitis (UC). It matched DAP for the CD74, IRGM, and TNIP1 genes in distinct cell types, suggesting a regulatory role in those cells during the disease process.
title: Integrated cell type-specific analysis of blood and gut identifies matching eQTL for 140 IBD risk loci and entrectinib as possible repurposing candidate

finding: For SNP rs11741861, it was found to match DAP for the CD74 and IRGM genes in small intestine enterocytes and memory CD4 cells, respectively. This supports the role of these genes in the pathogenesis of CD and UC.
title: Integrated cell type-specific analysis of blood and gut identifies matching eQTL for 140 IBD risk loci and entrectinib as possible repurposing candidate

finding: The intergenic variant rs10051765, located approximately 6kb upstream of SLC34A1, was associated with an odds ratio of 13.83 for increased kidney stone disease risk related to a 1 standard deviation decrease in serum phosphate levels. This variant suggested a role in increased urinary phosphate excretion.
title: Genetic variants predisposing to increased risk of kidney stone disease

finding: The SNP rs7719499 was identified as the lead eQTL for IL5, displaying significant eQTL associations in STARNET arterial tissues, particularly in aortic tissues from CAD patients, implicating its role in inflammatory responses linked to CAD.
title: Integrative multi-ancestry genetic analysis of gene regulation in coronary arteries prioritizes disease risk loci

finding: With a significant association noted (p=4.4E-03), the SNP rs1403525097 confirmed hypotheses drawn from earlier genetic studies related to tuberculosis.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: The rs2248374 variant was associated with an increased risk of non-small cell lung cancer when part of the AG haplotype in the ERAP2 gene. This indicated a potential role of ERAP2 in tumor pathogenesis, particularly in lung cancer.
title: Pan-cancer analyses reveal genomics and clinical characteristics of the down regulated genes for recurrent myocardial infarction in cancer

finding: The rs2549782 variant, when part of the AG haplotype in the ERAP2 gene, was found to potentially alleviate the risk of non-small cell lung cancer, suggesting a protective effect attributed to this haplotype.
title: Pan-cancer analyses reveal genomics and clinical characteristics of the down regulated genes for recurrent myocardial infarction in cancer

finding: The mutation at rs1131769 (c.695G>A, R232H) was identified as a loss-of-function variant that reduced the SLE risk with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.2515 (95% CI = 0.1648-0.3836; p < 0.0001) in an autosomal recessive pattern.
title: Role of STING/TMEM173 mutation in systemic lupus erythematosus: from animal model to intrinsic human genetics

finding: Variant rs77704739 was noted as a lead variant previously identified in the GERA cohort and was in complete linkage disequilibrium with rs115018790, but no additional direct findings in the current study were mentioned.
title: Genome-Wide Association Meta-Analysis Using a Recessive Model Illuminates Genetic Architecture of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: The rs2034244 SNP was classified as potentially deleterious and included among the genetic loci that were novel contributors to pain intensity.
title: The genetic architecture of pain intensity in a sample of 598,339 U.S. veterans

finding: The variant rs12916 was identified as having a high posterior probability (98.7%) for being associated with both plasma LDL-cholesterol and gallstone disease, supporting the effectiveness of statins in reducing the risk of gallstone disease. This finding was significant in the context of the study, which analyzed distinct pathways of LDL-cholesterol lowering.
title: Trans-biobank Mendelian randomization analyses identify opposing pathways in plasma low-density lipoprotein-cholesterol lowering and gallstone disease

finding: The variant rs3792783 was identified at the TNIP1 locus and was associated with lower TNIP1 mRNA levels in lung tissue from patients with systemic sclerosis-associated interstitial lung disease (SSC-ILD), indicating its role as a functional risk variant linked to the disease.
title: Integrative single-cell analysis of epigenomic and transcriptomic states in patients with systemic sclerosis-associated interstitial lung disease

finding: The alternative allele (T) of rs6897932 was associated with lower excision of the IL7R transmembrane domain, resulting in reduced IL7R plasma levels and a decreased risk of dermatitis and eczema.
title: Genetic determinants of blood gene expression and splicing and their contribution to molecular phenotypes and health outcomes

finding: This SNP affected IL7R splice variants, with the risk allele associated with a secreted isoform that exacerbated symptoms in MS, while being protective in AD.
title: Triangulating molecular evidence to prioritise candidate causal genes at established atopic dermatitis loci

finding: The SNP rs17421627-G, an intron variant in LINC00461 linked to MEF2C, was associated with increased thickness of the INL layer (Beta 0.41 SD, P=7.5x10^-193) and a significant 3um increase in retinal vascular caliber (P=7.0x10^-16).
title: Insights into human health from phenome- and genome-wide analyses of UK Biobank retinal optical coherence tomography phenotypes

finding: SNP rs17421627, located at locus 5q14.3, was significantly associated (p=4.7×10-17) with MacTel. This intergenic SNP is thought to modulate retinal vascular calibre, and its strong association with vascular defects underlines its importance in the pathology of MacTel.
title: Identification of genetic factors influencing metabolic dysregulation and retinal support for MacTel, a retinal disorder

finding: The SNP rs414965 was identified as the lead isoQTL for the isoform ENST00000511268.6 of the CLPTM1L gene, which was significantly associated with lung cancer risk (LUNG). IsoTWAS prioritized this isoform as having a 90% posterior inclusion probability (PIP), and it colocalized with the GWAS signal, indicating that this specific isoform's expression mediates the genetic risk of lung cancer.
title: Isoform-level analyses of 6 cancers uncover extensive genetic risk mechanisms undetected at the gene-level

finding: The SNP rs2937573 was identified as significantly associated with sensitivity to chewing sounds, representing a common misophonic symptom. This SNP is intronic to the TENM2 gene, which is involved in cell adhesion and is highly expressed in neurons and synapses, indicating its potential role in the neurobiological basis of misophonia.
title: Genetic evidence for the link of misophonia with psychiatric disorders and personality

finding: SNP rs2915860 was part of the main GWAS findings and showed a significant association with misophonia, with a p-value of less than 1.28 × 10^-11. This SNP is located within the same linkage disequilibrium block as rs2937573.
title: Genetic evidence for the link of misophonia with psychiatric disorders and personality

finding: The SNP rs7728595 was identified in the GWAS as significantly associated with misophonia, achieving a p-value of 1.28 × 10^-11. It was among the deleterious SNPs present in the LD block of rs2937573, suggesting its relevance in the disorder.
title: Genetic evidence for the link of misophonia with psychiatric disorders and personality

finding: SNP rs2915858 was included in the main GWAS analysis and was found to be significantly associated with misophonia, with a p-value of 1.28 × 10^-11, also located within the same LD block as rs2937573.
title: Genetic evidence for the link of misophonia with psychiatric disorders and personality

finding: The SNP rs609659 at locus 5p13.2 was found to have the largest effect size for the cleft lip with cleft palate (CL[P]) subtype, making it a significant original finding linked to the cleft lip phenotype.
title: Genome-wide association study of multiethnic non-syndromic orofacial cleft families identifies novel loci specific to family and phenotypic subtypes

finding: The rs76067074 SNP in the SLC6A19 gene was associated with severe COVID-19 phenotype definitions, indicating a p-value of 2.65E-3 for very severe respiratory confirmed cases and 2.52E-4 for hospitalized COVID-19.
title: ACE2 Netlas: In-silico functional characterization and drug-gene interactions of ACE2 gene network to understand its potential involvement in COVID-19 susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs10060180 was identified in the context of neurodevelopmental disorders (NDDs) as it relates to the protein KIAA0100, which modulates cancer cell aggression behavior of MDA-MB-231 through microtubule and heat shock proteins. This discovery provided significant insights into the contributions of certain proteins to both neurodevelopmental disorders and cancer phenotypes, highlighting its relevance in understanding the clustering of missense variation.
title: Proteome-Wide Assessment of Clustering of Missense Variants in Neurodevelopmental Disorders Versus Cancer

finding: Although SNP rs11741255 was approximately 20kb away from rs886285 at the same locus, it showed significant association with ALL in the analysis with a p-value of 1.69×10−4. Its low linkage disequilibrium with rs886285 suggests it may be a distinct signal although caution is warranted due to potential chance association.
title: Genome-wide trans-ethnic meta-analysis identifies novel susceptibility loci for childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: A novel variant located in an intron of IL7R, it was associated with AUD in AAs. The IL7R plays a critical role in immune cell development, which aligns with known impacts of chronic alcohol consumption on immune responses.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: SNP rs10069648 was positively identified with significant effects on cardiovascular traits in both populations, particularly noted for its stronger association in the AFR cohort (p=3.8 x 10^-08), making it a positive and original finding.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: SNP rs11379773 was associated with cardiovascular-related traits in previous studies, and continued to show significance across cohorts, feeding into its status as a positive and original finding.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: The SNP rs2853677 was another intronic SNP associated with regulatory variation. It was confirmed to belong to the polycomb sequence class affecting gene expression activity, indicating its potential role in cancer pathways.
title: Novel discoveries and enhanced genomic prediction from modelling genetic risk of cancer age-at-onset

finding: The Thr164Ile variant (rs1800888) was associated with reduced lung function in individuals but was not linked to COPD or asthma, according to self-reports and diagnostic codes. Additionally, it was found to be associated with increased eosinophil counts and specific blood lipid measurements, suggesting roles in immune and lipid metabolism pathways.
title: The role of the ADRB2 Thr164Ile variant in lung function determination, plasma proteome variability and other phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: Variant rs58970548 was identified in the intergenic region of NMUR2 and GRIA1 associated with Long COVID (OR=0.94, p=4.27x10^-8) and suggested potential involvement in psychiatric conditions through functional mapping.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of Long COVID identifies immune-related loci and etiological links to chronic fatigue syndrome, fibromyalgia and depression

finding: The variant rs1131769 in the DNAJC18 gene was significantly associated with oral mucositis (OM) after radiotherapy in head and neck cancer patients. This gene is known for regulating chaperone molecules that protect cellular proteins.
title: Systematic Review of Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Acute Pain and Relevant Acute Toxicities Induced by Radiotherapy for Head and Neck Cancer

finding: The SNP rs141408991, near KIAA0825, was specifically identified as a novel genome-wide significant variant for AD in NHW with a P-value of 2.9×10^-8 and an OR of 0.50, indicating a protective effect.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis of 56,241 individuals identifies LRRC4C, LHX5-AS1 and nominates ancestry-specific loci PTPRK, GRB14, and KIAA0825 as novel risk loci for Alzheimer’s disease: the Alzheimer’s Disease Genetics Consortium

finding: The SNP rs1878936 was associated with the EBF1 locus at 5q33.3, reaching a Bonferroni-corrected significance level (P = 7.64x10-4), underlining its contribution to endometriosis pathology.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: The SNV rs77097530 was associated with BSA-indexed aortic valve regurgitation volume, with a p-value of -log10 p = 7.48. It was positioned closest to the downstream protein-coding gene CEP120 and the upstream gene PRDM6, the latter linked to bicuspid aortic valve and aortic root disease.
title: Genetic architecture of cardiac dynamic flow volumes

finding: In the study of the risk for developing depression, rs7700661 reached genome-wide significance (P = 1.99 × 10^-8), indicating an association with depression risk.
title: Genome-wide by environment interaction study of stressful life events and hospital-treated depression in the iPSYCH2012 sample

finding: The SNP rs549839389 was associated with AD risk, as indicated by a P-value of 3.34×10−4. This association was highlighted in a study where ADAMTS2, the gene of interest, showed significant differential expression between individuals with neuropathologically confirmed Alzheimer's disease (SymAD) and those who were cognitively resilient despite having pathological evidence of the disease (AsymAD). ADAMTS2's robust expression patterns and links to cognitive decline were supported by other studies, emphasizing its potential role in Alzheimer’s disease pathology.
title: Transcriptome Signatures for Cognitive Resilience Among Individuals with Pathologically Confirmed Alzheimer Disease

finding: This variant, located near HSPA4, was associated with multiple cardiometabolic risk factors and identified as part of a candidate cis-regulatory element, implicating its role in gene regulation that influences cardiovascular phenotypes across various studies.
title: Unsupervised cardiac MRI phenotyping with 3D diffusion autoencoders reveals novel genetic insights

finding: The rs11744756 SNP was associated with Parkinson's disease as indicated by a meta-analysis that provided a meta P-value of 9.27e-07 and an odds ratio of 1.15, with a 95% confidence interval ranging from 1.08 to 1.21. This association suggested a potential role for the ERCC8 gene, which is involved in nucleotide excision repair, in the pathogenesis of PD.
title: Parkinson’s disease patients display a DNA damage signature in blood that is predictive of disease progression

finding: SNP rs12916 located in HMGCR was found to be associated with hypercholesterolemia through the CC-liability method and was significant in various GWAS studies related to this condition.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The SNP rs2736100 in the TERT gene showed a protective association with IPF risk, granting an odds ratio (OR) of 0.70 (95% CI: 0.61-0.79; p < 0.05). This protective effect was stronger in Asian populations compared to Europeans, implicating TERT's role in telomere maintenance and cellular longevity in lung tissue.
title: Genetic landscape of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis: A systematic review, meta-analysis and epidemiological evidence of case-control studies

finding: This SNP was associated with Paget's disease, showing a significant connection (P=6×10^-11) to the genetic basis of this disorder.
title: Leveraging large-scale multi-omics to identify therapeutic targets from genome-wide association studies

finding: This variant demonstrated a significant association with polymyalgia rheumatica and was suggested to be related to increased risk of various autoimmune disorders, marking a novel association in the context of IL6ST.
title: Leveraging large-scale multi-omics to identify therapeutic targets from genome-wide association studies

finding: Similar to rs486907, the polymorphism rs2910164 was implicated in susceptibility to melanoma skin cancer through its interaction with RNASEL rs486907, showcasing a sex-specific effect relevant to disease risk.
title: Systematic review reveals multiple sexually antagonistic polymorphisms affecting human disease and complex traits

finding: The novel SNP rs79833209 near CCNG1 had a high impact with an OR of 1.54 and statistically significant P-value of 2×10^{-8}, indicating its association with increased risk of severe COVID-19.
title: Common genetic variants identify therapeutic targets for COVID-19 and individuals at high risk of severe disease

finding: The major allele of rs397768 was connected to slightly downregulated APC expression, suggesting its role in endometrial carcinogenesis.
title: Germline cancer gene expression quantitative trait loci influence local and global tumor mutations

finding: The rs28645263 SNP also reached genome-wide significance with a P-value of 9.46e-9, showing association with COVID-19 BI. This SNP mapped to RETREG1, a gene that regulates reticulophagy, which may help inhibit SARS-CoV-2 replication. The findings indicated that RETREG1 could play a role as an inhibitor of COVID-19 infection due to its involvement in endoplasmic reticulum-associated degradation pathways.
title: Genome-wide association study of COVID-19 Breakthrough Infections and genetic overlap with other diseases: A study of the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs4307059 was identified as being associated with autism in a Chinese Han population, supporting previous GWAS findings. This association suggested its relevance in the genetic landscape of autism, connecting it to the neurodevelopmental aspects of the condition.
title: An unbiased de novo network analysis uncovering causal genes and the developmental intersection between autism and co-occurring traits

finding: It was identified as the top colocalization sQTL for ADCY2 in BIP, implicating splicing dysregulation of this gene, which encodes adenylate cyclase, a crucial regulator of cAMP signaling.
title: Cross-ancestry, cell-type-informed atlas of gene, isoform, and splicing regulation in the developing human brain

finding: The SNP rs2853677 was identified as part of a Mendelian randomization analysis which suggested that an increase in the genetic risk of CHIP associated with reduced odds of Alzheimer's disease (AD), with an odds ratio of 0.92 per log-odds increase. This was statistically significant with a p-value of 5.6 × 10⁻³.
title: Clonal hematopoiesis is associated with protection from Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs7726159 was included in the analysis that demonstrated a relationship between the genetic risk of CHIP and reduced risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD). The findings indicated that for each log-odds increase in the risk of CHIP, the odds of developing AD decreased, evidenced by an odds ratio of 0.92.
title: Clonal hematopoiesis is associated with protection from Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The intergenic variant rs28419191 at 5q31 was associated with an increased risk of oral cavity (OC) cancer, with an odds ratio of 1.23 (95% CI: 1.15, 1.31, p_meta=3.16×10^-10).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The rs1131769 missense variant in STING1 was linked with increased risk for overall HNSCC, showing an odds ratio of 1.13 (95% CI: 1.09, 1.18, p_meta=2.38×10^-10).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: This locus was identified as novel in the context of retinal thickness, further supporting findings related to retinal health.
title: Multi-omic spatial effects on high-resolution AI-derived retinal thickness

finding: The rare variant rs138675130 was associated with reduced circulating plasma retinol per C allele, showing significant findings with minimal heterogeneity among contributing studies and suggesting a notable impact on retinol levels.
title: Genetic influences on circulating retinol and its relationship to human health

finding: The SNP rs146886108, a missense variant in the ANKH gene encoding p.Arg187Gln, was identified as a novel protective variant for type 2 diabetes. It exhibited a strong association with several proteins including heat shock protein 90 beta (p = 1.08e-13) and glucose 6 phosphate isomerase (p = 2.04e-15). Additionally, the UK Biobank Mendelian trait GWAS indicated a significant association with random glucose levels, suggesting it may influence glucose regulation mechanisms.
title: Novel subgroups of type 2 diabetes based on multi-Omics profiling: an IMI-RHAPSODY Study

finding: The SNP rs2736098 on chromosome 5p15.3 was identified as one of the polymorphisms associated with bladder cancer susceptibility during the systematic analysis of genome-wide association studies.
title: A systematic review of genome-wide association studies on bladder cancer

finding: The SNP rs401681 was reported twice on chromosome 5p15.3 within the findings of previous studies, indicating its relevance in the genetic predisposition to bladder cancer.
title: A systematic review of genome-wide association studies on bladder cancer

finding: At the GCNT4 locus, the common A allele at rs3761743 was associated with decreased HDL levels in the 'current smokers' exposure group, with a significant P value of 6.9x10^-4 in an African-ancestry subset. This association was attenuated in non-smokers, presenting a significant interaction P value of 1.5x10^-5. Additionally, rs3761743 showed decreased expression of GCNT4 in the aorta and increased expression in the testis, indicating its relevance to cardiovascular traits modified by smoking behavior.
title: Multi-omics insights into the biological mechanisms underlying gene-by-lifestyle interactions with smoking and alcohol consumption detected by genome-wide trans-ancestry meta-analysis

finding: Variant rs9312937 was discovered as a common variant associated with PCOS for the first time, with a p-value of 1.7 x 10<sup>-8</sup> and OR of 1.16 [1.10-1.22]. This SNP was located in an intronic region of MYO10, suggesting a potential novel genetic factor influencing PCOS risk.
title: Leveraging Northern European population history; novel low frequency variants for polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: In the current study, rs12657665 was among the top SNPs identified with a PPLD value indicative of association with loss of ambulation in patients with DMD, with support from Cox proportional hazards regression analysis.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of loss of ambulation in dystrophinopathy patients suggests multiple candidate modifiers of disease severity

finding: Identified as a lead SNP with high PPLD values in the GWAS analysis, indicating its potential role as a modifier in DMD progression.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of loss of ambulation in dystrophinopathy patients suggests multiple candidate modifiers of disease severity

finding: The SNP rs2099810 was linked to reaction time in the context of habitual daytime napping. However, after excluding this SNP due to indications of unbalanced horizontal pleiotropy, the association was no longer present, indicating that its initial significance may have been confounded by pleiotropic effects.
title: Is there an association between daytime napping, cognitive function and brain volume? A Mendelian randomisation study in the UK Biobank

finding: The exonic variant rs61749613 was associated with the gene VCAN and demonstrated a significant p-value of 3.62×10^-9, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors related to heart failure.
title: Exploring novel risk loci for heart failure and the shared genetic etiology with blood lipids, blood pressure, and blood glucose: a large-scale multi-trait association analysis

finding: The missense variant rs116483731 in SPDL1 (p.Arg20Gln) was associated with an increased risk of IPF (odds ratio for the A allele, 3.13; P=9.97×10^-16) and showed protective effects against most cancers (odds ratio for cancer, 0.81; P=2.05×10^-15), thus demonstrating antagonistic pleiotropy.
title: Genetic variant in SPDL1 reveals novel mechanism linking pulmonary fibrosis risk and cancer protection

finding: The rare loss-of-function mutation rs770066110 (p.Arg774X) in TERT was reported with an extremely high odds ratio for IPF (9833.99; P=9.16×10^-12), indicating its significance as a risk variant for the disease.
title: Genetic variant in SPDL1 reveals novel mechanism linking pulmonary fibrosis risk and cancer protection

finding: The rare missense mutation rs776981958 (p.Asp684Gly) in TERT was identified additionally associated with IPF with an odds ratio of 1029.96 (P=6.53×10^-21), supporting its role in congenital telomere length variance.
title: Genetic variant in SPDL1 reveals novel mechanism linking pulmonary fibrosis risk and cancer protection

finding: The SNP rs1128450 in the FBXO38 gene showed a significant increase in luciferase activity with the risk allele, supporting its involvement in prostate cancer risk.
title: Large-scale alternative polyadenylation (APA)-wide association studies to identify putative susceptibility genes in human common cancers

finding: The lead variant rs113742171 was associated with SDHA in breast cancer and supported by 3' aQTL analysis, providing evidence for its regulatory role.
title: Large-scale alternative polyadenylation (APA)-wide association studies to identify putative susceptibility genes in human common cancers

finding: In the study, a rare coding variant, rs145272862, was identified in the CHSY3 gene that segregated with familial thumb carpometacarpal joint osteoarthritis (CMCJ OA) as an apparent autosomal dominant trait. The variant resulted in a non-synonymous substitution (p.G629R) in a highly conserved amino acid in the enzymatic domain of CHSY3, a glycosyltransferase involved in the synthesis of chondroitin sulfate proteoglycans, particularly important in cartilage function. This finding suggested that alterations in chondroitin sulfate content might be a significant risk factor for the development and severity of CMCJ OA.
title: Familial Clustering and Genetic Analysis of Severe Thumb Carpometacarpal Joint Osteoarthritis in a Large Statewide Cohort

finding: The rs7724386 variant associated with neutrophil count showed a greater frequency in UKB-EUR (0.58) compared to UKB-AFR (0.26), highlighting its significance in immune response variation.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: This SNP was associated with lung cancer susceptibility in the context of existing loci at 5p15.33, providing additional evidence supporting its role in lung cancer.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: The SNP rs4916723 was the only association shared among all GWAS methods and was linked to the gene LINC00461, which had been previously associated with educational attainment and ADHD.
title: ADuLT: An efficient and robust time-to-event GWAS

finding: SNP rs115325222 was linked to the upregulation of TMEM161B_AS1, MEF2C, and MEF2C-AS1, indicating its association with transcriptional changes related to neurodevelopment in schizophrenia. Additionally, it showed a downregulation of LINC00461. This finding illustrated a connection between specific genetic variants and altered gene expression patterns within excitatory neurons, which were identified as significantly affected in schizophrenia.
title: Single-cell multi-cohort dissection of the schizophrenia transcriptome

finding: SNP rs10117 was associated with the upregulation of FAM53C and downregulation of REEP2, linking it to dysregulation in gene expression tied to schizophrenia. This alteration aligned with the identified transcriptional changes that segregated schizophrenia subjects based on their transcriptional pathology.
title: Single-cell multi-cohort dissection of the schizophrenia transcriptome

finding: The CREBRF rs373863828 genotype was found to be significantly associated with excessive daytime sleepiness (ESS) scores in bivariate analyses. In particular, these scores were higher with each copy of the minor allele (A). However, this association did not persist in multivariable models that controlled for body mass index (BMI), abdominal circumference, and diabetes status. This finding was significant in the context of understanding the impact of genetic variants on metabolic and behavioral traits in the Samoan population.
title: Correlates of Daytime Sleepiness and Insomnia among Adults in Samoa

finding: This variant was located at the 5p15.2 locus and exhibited suggestive significance in the discovery stage (OR=10.19, 95% CI: 4.12-25.21; P=5.1×10^-7). It replicated in both SJLIFE EUR (OR=2.47, 95% CI: 1.23-4.98; P=0.011) and CCSS EUR (OR=1.48, 95% CI: 1.06-2.07; P=0.021) cohorts.
title: Trans-ancestral genetic study of diabetes mellitus risk in survivors of childhood cancer: a report from the St. Jude Lifetime Cohort and the Childhood Cancer Survivor Study

finding: The variant rs35658696 in the PAM gene showed evidence for a small effect on risk of T2D, with an SLP of 5.68 and an odds ratio of 1.15 (1.08 – 1.21), indicating a moderate association.
title: Weighted burden analysis in 200,000 exome-sequenced subjects characterises rare variant effects on risk of type 2 diabetes

finding: The variant rs78408340 in the PAM gene also exhibited a significant association with T2D, presented with an SLP of 6.92 and an odds ratio of 1.20 (1.13 – 1.28), supporting its potential risk effect.
title: Weighted burden analysis in 200,000 exome-sequenced subjects characterises rare variant effects on risk of type 2 diabetes

finding: The lincRNA LINC01948 was proposed as a causal gene for the cross-ancestry POAG locus rs112142644 on chromosome 5, indicating a significant role in the disease.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: The stop-gain variant rs200884524 in the BTNL9 gene was found to have a strong association with lower high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) levels and higher triglycerides (TG) in a cohort of 2,851 Samoan adults. The association was confirmed through meta-analysis across additional Polynesian cohorts, with a β coefficient of -1.60 mg/dL for HDL-C (p = 7.63 × 10^-10) and 12.00 mg/dL for TG (p = 3.82 × 10^-7). This variant was notably Polynesian-specific with a high minor allele frequency in the Samoan population.
title: A stop-gain variant in BTNL9 is associated with atherogenic lipid profiles

finding: The SNP rs10078721 also displayed cross-ancestry association, with a beta of 0.01 and a p-value of 4.9×10^-8 in the European ancestry discovery cohort. In the African ancestry group, it had a beta of 0.02 and a p-value of 0.009, confirming its significance.
title: Gene Discovery and Biological Insights into Anxiety Disorders from a Multi-Ancestry Genome-wide Association Study of >1.2 Million Participants

finding: The SNP rs34691025 was identified in the ARHGEF28 gene on chromosome 5q13.2, with a significant p-value of 1.76 x 10^-8, indicating its association with widespread pain. This finding underscored the role of genetic factors in pain disorders and connections to other phenotypes such as hearing disorders and cardiovascular diseases.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Widespread Pain in the UK Biobank (N=172,230)

finding: The SNP rs326153, which is located in ADCY2, exhibited a strong association with plasma OT levels (β = 0.54, p < 10^-3). Its higher frequency in the study population highlighted its significant implications in oxytocin signaling.
title: Genetic and epigenetic signatures associated with plasma oxytocin levels in children and adolescents with autism spectrum disorder

finding: The SNP rs1073917 near SPOCK1 was discovered to correlate with testosterone levels in men (β=-0.0160, P=4.69E-08), implicating its role in hormone regulation.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The SPINK1 missense variant was linked to chronic pancreatitis risk, demonstrating a clear association despite prior conflicting annotations.
title: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease

finding: Similar to rs1460573878, this variant in SLC34A1 was also associated with increased risk for renal stones, reaffirming its biological relevance.
title: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease

finding: This missense variant was noted as one of the functional SNPs related to cardiorenal traits, including significant associations with hypertension.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: The SNP rs1867598 was associated with Parkinson's disease (PD) and was mentioned in the context of its high D' statistic (D'=0.94) when analyzed in relation to an independent short tandem repeat (STR) signal at the NDUFAF2 locus. This finding indicated a strong linkage disequilibrium between the SNP and the STR, suggesting a significant relationship with PD risk.
title: Genome-wide contribution of common Short-Tandem Repeats to Parkinson’s Disease genetic risk

finding: The SNP rs4074995 was identified as the top SNP associated with circulating levels of PTH, calcium, phosphate, and FGF23. In adults with chronic kidney disease (CKD), the minor allele of this SNP correlated with lower levels of phosphorus and FGF23, as well as a lower prevalence of hyperparathyroidism.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS for circulating FGF23 Identifies Novel Network Interactions Between HRG-HMGB1 and Cardiac Disease in CKD

finding: The SNP rs145715205, found in the CDH18 gene region, emerged as a significant signal for albumin excretion trajectory. Although it showed suggestive association with the latest ACR phenotype, it could not be replicated in the SUMMIT cohort. The PheWAS identified urinary sodium excretion and urine albumin-to-creatinine ratio as the most strongly associated phenotypes, with the effect allele (C) also displaying rarity in European populations.
title: Genome-wide association study of longitudinal urinary albumin excretion in patients with type 1 diabetes

finding: The variant rs32137 in the CTNND2 gene was identified as nominally significant in the analysis of lung function decline within African American cohorts. It was previously noted in a GWAS of asthmatics for its association with FEV1 decline.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study reveals novel genetic signals for lung function decline

finding: The SNP rs2431697 was identified as a cell-specific enhancer that may disrupt regulatory elements and regulate the expression of miR-146a. This disruption was implicated in the development of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), suggesting a significant role in the epigenetic regulation associated with this autoimmune disease.
title: Global research hotspots and frontier trends of epigenetic modifications in autoimmune diseases: a bibliometric analysis from 2012 to 2022

finding: The study indicated that the SNP rs587783031 represents a rare germline variant (c. 4666 dup A, p. Thr1556fs) in the APC gene. This variant was linked to alterations in the APC-related Wnt signaling pathway, which provides significant context as it relates to Gardner's syndrome and its associated phenotypes, specifically the presence of familial adenomatous polyposis.
title: Sc-RNA seq in familiar Gardner syndrome combined left atrial appendage fibroma reveals APC-C-MYC signaling modulates fibrotic subpopulation remodeling

finding: The missense variant rs2652098 in VCAN was associated with multiple DTI parameters. It contributed to significant associations with a range of effect sizes ([−0.48, 0.42] standard deviations) across 12 mean diffusivity traits, revealing VCAN's pivotal role in white matter traits and its implications in neurological disorders.
title: Mapping rare protein-coding variants on multi-organ imaging traits

finding: The missense variant rs143368552 in VCAN was also significantly associated with various DTI parameters, reinforcing the findings observed for rs2652098 and highlighting VCAN's established connections to white matter and its potential relevance in neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Mapping rare protein-coding variants on multi-organ imaging traits

finding: This SNP also showed a significant correlation with vitamin K1 levels, reinforcing the association between vitamin K1 antagonism by warfarin and reduced stroke risk.
title: An Informatics Consult approach for generating clinical evidence for treatment decisions

finding: SNP rs17364066 was identified in the meta-analysis along with rs3045 as associated with chondrocalcinosis, marking it as a positive finding.
title: Genome-wide association study in chondrocalcinosis reveals ENPP1 as a candidate therapeutic target in calcium pyrophosphate deposition disease

finding: This SNP was also associated with chondrocalcinosis in the meta-analysis, indicating its relevance as a genetic risk factor for the disease.
title: Genome-wide association study in chondrocalcinosis reveals ENPP1 as a candidate therapeutic target in calcium pyrophosphate deposition disease

finding: Located on chromosome 5 at locus 5q14.3, this SNP had a z-score of 8.37 and contributed to connectivity metrics of the left middle frontal cortex, representing a novel finding.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: The SNP rs3212227 in IL12B was significantly associated with TB severity, evidenced by a combined p-value of 0.0006. This association was replicated across two independent cohorts, supporting earlier findings that implicated IL12B in susceptibility to tuberculosis.
title: Interaction between host genes and M. tuberculosis lineage can affect tuberculosis severity: evidence for coevolution

finding: Although rs3213094 was borderline significant in Cohort 1 with a p-value of 0.06, it achieved significance in Cohort 2 and showed a combined p-value of 0.0009. This SNP was also implicated as part of the association of IL12B with TB severity, reinforcing the involvement of this gene in the clinical manifestation of tuberculosis.
title: Interaction between host genes and M. tuberculosis lineage can affect tuberculosis severity: evidence for coevolution

finding: The SNP rs3212220 in IL12B was identified as having the most significant combined p-value of 0.0005, indicating its strong association with TB severity. Like rs3212227, it was part of the replicated findings across both cohorts, suggesting IL12B's critical role in modulating TB severity.
title: Interaction between host genes and M. tuberculosis lineage can affect tuberculosis severity: evidence for coevolution

finding: The SNP rs17448496 located at locus 5q32 was significantly associated with COVID-19 susceptibility in European ancestry patients. It demonstrated an odds ratio of 0.173 (95% CI: 0.08–0.36; p=5.15×10^-6). This SNP was linked to the gene PPP2R2B, which is involved in regulating immune responses by inhibiting cytotoxic T-lymphocyte-associated protein function. Inhibition of CTLA-4 and PD-L1 expression by PPP2R2B may enhance T-cell functions, thereby playing a critical role in modulating the immune response against COVID-19.
title: Ancestral origins are associated with SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility and protection in a Florida patient population

finding: This SNP was identified as newly FDR significant after leveraging functional genomic data. It was one of the 12 newly significant SNPs that had high GenoCanyon scores.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: In relation to rs4916723, conditioning on <italic>CTC-498M16.4</italic> resulted in the explanation of 0.765 of the variance in the previously implicated ADHD GWAS loci on chromosome 5. The lead SNP GWAS P-value prior to conditioning was 1.8E-08, which changed to 6.4E-03 post-conditioning, indicating the influence of this genetic region on ADHD.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder identifies associated genes and phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs13163940 was found to be associated with the role of IQGAP1 in carcinogenesis, particularly influencing the Integrin β4/TNFAIP2/IQGAP1/Rac1 signaling axis. This axis was implicated in promoting DNA damage drug resistance in triple-negative breast cancer, highlighting its potential as a therapeutic target.
title: Integrin β4 promotes DNA damage drug resistance in triple-negative breast cancer via TNFAIP2/IQGAP1/Rac1

finding: The study referenced in the publication by Kukkula et al. (2021) identified rs13174402 as a significant SNP related to the SUMO pathway in cancer. This SNP was associated with variations in SUMO4 functionality, which was shown to impact the DNA double-strand break repair process. It was highlighted that SUMO4 played a critical role in regulating SUMOylation and its effects on the BRCA1-A complex, emphasizing its importance in cancer therapy.
title: SUMO4 promotes SUMO deconjugation required for DNA double-strand break repair

finding: The SNP rs41545019, a low-frequency missense variant in MSH3, was linked to a significant increase in TCF4 instability (0.24 [0.05] s.d.; p=5.7×10^-6) and was similarly impactful as variants in FAN1. It also had a notable onset-hastening effect on Huntington's disease, showing a -2.25 year reduction in age at onset (p=0.006), hinting at its critical role in DNA repeat dynamics.
title: Insights into the causes and consequences of DNA repeat expansions from 700,000 biobank participants

finding: Located in the LINC01021 gene, this SNP achieved a p-value of 4.26x10^-9 and an OR of 2.505 for AAA. This gene has not been previously linked to aneurysmal formation.
title: Analysis of UK Biobank Cohort Reveals Novel Insights for Thoracic and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms

finding: The SNP rs4073476 was linked to strong associations with bone mineral density and height in multiple studies, particularly noting a very strong association with p-values less than 10^-8 for both traits among the UK Biobank cohort.
title: Sex-specific phenotypic effects and evolutionary history of an ancient polymorphic deletion of the human growth hormone receptor

finding: This SNP was associated with neuroendocrine tumors (NETs) and identified in a study by Hofving et al. (2021), highlighting the immune microenvironment's characteristics of small intestinal neuroendocrine tumors, suggesting a potential role in tumor immunity.
title: Druggable Growth Dependencies and Tumor Evolution Analysis in Patient-Derived Organoids of Neuroendocrine Cancer

finding: The rs2910164 genetic variant of miR-146a-3p was associated with increased overall mortality in patients with follicular variant papillary thyroid carcinoma, indicating a significant correlation between this SNP and cancer outcomes.
title: Somatic mutations in miRNA genes in lung cancer – potential functional consequences of non-coding sequence variants

finding: The SNP rs10070219 was associated with alterations in the inflammatory tumor microenvironment, correlating with the regulation of TP53 function and tumor suppression mechanisms. This finding had specific implications for how TP53 mutations could influence tumor behavior and immune interactions, especially in non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC). In the context of this study, it highlighted the significance of the tumor microenvironment in relation to TP53 mutations and provided a basis for understanding potential response to immunotherapeutic approaches.
title: A cellular and spatial atlas of TP53-associated tissue remodeling in lung adenocarcinoma
