finding: The SNP rs2307111 was associated with two traits in opposite directions, including its involvement in blood pressure phenotypes.
title: Multivariate Genomewide Association Analysis with IHT

finding: The study reported a positive association of the KIBRA rs17070145 polymorphism with episodic memory performance during the early stages of a human neurodevelopmental disorder. This finding emphasized the potential role of KIBRA in influencing cognitive functions related to memory.
title: PICK1 links KIBRA and AMPA receptors in coiled-coil-driven supramolecular complexes

finding: The SNP rs1216565, located at chr5:96,929,854-96,931,091, was located in the intergenic enhancer on the LNPEP/ERAP2 haplotype. Although specific expression alterations were not detailed, it was implied to influence gene expression as part of the larger study of enhancers affecting genes.
title: A Systematic Strategy for Identifying Causal Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms and Their Target Genes on Juvenile Arthritis Risk Haplotypes

finding: The rs75335466-T allele was identified as being associated with reduced expression of miR-146a-5p specifically upon stimulation by LPS and R848, demonstrating its role in immune response within African-ancestry individuals.
title: Population variation of miRNAs and isomiRs and their impact on human immunity to infection

finding: The rs2910164 C/G variant affected miR-146a-3p isomiRs, with the derived G allele associated with increased expression of miR-146a-3p and a shift in mature miRNA start and end sites, redefining its target binding capacity and links to allergic rhinitis and asthma risk.
title: Population variation of miRNAs and isomiRs and their impact on human immunity to infection

finding: The SNP rs7731625 was suggested to influence Treg function in T1D, indicating its potential to affect disease mechanisms.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: The SNP rs2563249 exhibited both universal and testis-specific eQTL effects, indicating its dual role in gene expression regulation.
title: Mechanisms of tissue-specific genetic regulation revealed by latent factors across eQTLs

finding: The rs246105 SNP, which represented a missense mutation (A688D/V), was associated with a higher allele frequency in non-small cell lung cancer patients who experienced recurrence within three years after surgery. This suggested that the C-terminal region of Praja2, where this SNP affects the protein's sequence, plays a significant physiological role, potentially influencing interactions with Tau.
title: E3 ligase Praja1 mediates ubiquitination and degradation of microtubule-associated protein Tau

finding: The finding related to SNP rs251124 indicated its association with intracranial aneurysm as reported in a study by Sathyan et al. in 2014. It was highlighted as a polymorphism within the Versican (VCAN) gene, suggesting its relevance in pathological conditions linked to vascular anomalies.
title: Chemical, molecular, and single cell analysis reveal chondroitin sulfate proteoglycan aberrancy in fibrolamellar carcinoma

finding: SNP rs2287926, characterized as G428D within the Versican (VCAN) gene, was also associated with intracranial aneurysm in the same study by Sathyan et al. This connection further suggested the potential impact of this gene on vascular integrity and related disease phenotypes.
title: Chemical, molecular, and single cell analysis reveal chondroitin sulfate proteoglycan aberrancy in fibrolamellar carcinoma

finding: This variant was identified as causing a donor loss, resulting in a truncated protein and subsequent NMD of the mRNA. It was previously characterized and linked to strong balancing selection.
title: Resurrecting the Alternative Splicing Landscape of Archaic Hominins using Machine Learning

finding: This Neanderthal SAV was classified as a donor gain and introduced a canonical 5' splice site leading to NMD. It was found at low frequencies among several populations and was noted to occur alongside the non-truncated version of rs2248374.
title: Resurrecting the Alternative Splicing Landscape of Archaic Hominins using Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs76549217 at the ANKH locus was identified as functional significant by LOGO-3357, and although its findings were part of a broad investigation, it did not reach genome-wide significance in other populations outside of European ancestry, emphasizing the need for deeper analysis of its functional implications.
title: Integrating convolution and self-attention improves language model of human genome for interpreting non-coding regions at base-resolution

finding: The protective allele rs7731626, associated with RA and MS, reduced expression of ANKRD55 and IL6ST in CD4+ T-cells. The findings suggest that this SNP may influence immune signaling pathways, representing a notable association to autoimmune disease mechanisms.
title: Genetic associations at regulatory phenotypes improve fine-mapping of causal variants for twelve immune-mediated diseases

finding: The rs3846662 variant was identified as a fine-mapped causal variant associated with exon expression of the HMGCR gene, which is linked to levels of LDL cholesterol. A significant colocalisation was detected in 51 out of 95 datasets, highlighting the relevance of this variant to LDL cholesterol modulation.
title: eQTL Catalogue: a compendium of uniformly processed human gene expression and splicing QTLs

finding: The rs9332 variant was linked to an increased relative expression of the MTRR transcript's short isoform and was associated with a higher risk of spina bifida. This effect was a result of the creation of a proximal canonical PAS.
title: The length of the expressed 3’ UTR is an intermediate molecular phenotype linking genetic variants to complex diseases

finding: The rs5855 variant served as an apaQTL for the PAM gene, which plays a vital role in the biosynthesis of peptide hormones and neurotransmitters. The alteration brought about by this variant was thought to increase the strength of the canonical PAS, thus affecting the transcript's isoform.
title: The length of the expressed 3’ UTR is an intermediate molecular phenotype linking genetic variants to complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs55803832 was noted as the most significant association with cerebellar volume, functioning as an eQTL for the extracellular matrix protein gene VCAN in cerebellar tissue.
title: Identifying genetic variants associated with cerebellar volume in 33,265 individuals from the UK-Biobank

finding: The SNP rs79727797 was significantly associated with age at onset of Huntington's disease (HD). Individuals carrying the minor allele experienced an onset that was 2.3 years later than expected based on their CAG repeat length in the HTT gene. The study's findings indicated that the association could be attributed to a quasi-tandem repeat (QTR) hexamer in the TCERG1 gene, which was shown to reduce age at onset for each additional repeat hexamer by approximately one year. This finding was instrumental in confirming the role of TCERG1 as a genetic modifier of HD onset, originally proposed in previous genome-wide association studies (GWAS).
title: Huntington’s disease age at motor onset is modified by the tandem hexamer repeat in TCERG1

finding: The SNP rs13174489 was associated with the onco-fetal chondroitin sulfate expression, which was highlighted as a highly expressed therapeutic target in the context of non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC). This finding was originally reported by H. Z. Oo et al. in the Cancers journal in 2021, emphasizing the potential of utilizing onco-fetal targets for therapeutic interventions in malignancies.
title: Onco-fetal protein Nogo-A restricts human and mouse glioma vascularization and growth via VEGF-Notch-hippo-metabolic signaling

finding: Associated with sudden cardiac death (P = 4.12 x 10^-8), this variant formed strong cardiac-specific loops to related genes.
title: Detailed Regulatory Interaction Map of the Human Heart Facilitates Gene Discovery for Cardiovascular Disease

finding: The SNP rs1862416, situated within the TENM2 gene on chr5q34, was significantly associated with nicotine dependence (ND) with a p-value of 1.5×10^-8. This SNP represented a novel association with ND. Unlike rs2714700, it did not show significant association with the heaviness of smoking index (HSI) in the UK Biobank (p=0.39). The rs1862416-T allele was associated with an increased risk for severe ND as compared to mild ND (odds ratio 1.08). Furthermore, this SNP acted as a lung-specific cis-eQTL for TENM2 and appeared in a promoter region relevant to neurodevelopment, indicating a potential role in the regulation of ND.
title: Expanding the Genetic Architecture of Nicotine Dependence and its Shared Genetics with Multiple Traits: Findings from the Nicotine Dependence GenOmics (iNDiGO) Consortium

finding: The rs373979283 variant caused a substitution of Tyrosine to Aspartic Acid at position 226 of the HEXB protein. This mutation was predicted to be deleterious and was previously reported in patients with Sandhoff disease. Despite Tyrosine being non-conserved at this position, the physiochemical differences between Tyrosine and Aspartate could impact protein folding, potentially leading to functional impairment.
title: Comprehensive Analysis of HEXB Protein Reveal Forty Two Novel nsSNPs That May Lead to Sandhoff disease (SD) Using Bioinformatics

finding: The rs121907985 variant resulted in the substitution of Proline with Serine at position 504 of the HEXB protein. This change was associated with significant structural consequences due to Proline's rigidity and size. It was previously linked to cases of Sandhoff disease and noted for disrupting normal protein folding, leading to increased precursor/mature protein ratio and reduced heat stability.
title: Comprehensive Analysis of HEXB Protein Reveal Forty Two Novel nsSNPs That May Lead to Sandhoff disease (SD) Using Bioinformatics

finding: The rs764552042 variant marked the substitution of Arginine to Cysteine at position 533 of the HEXB protein. This charge and size difference compromised the protein's external interactions and its structure, with previous reports linking this mutation to Sandhoff disease. It was noted that this substitution could lead to severe misfolding of the protein's C terminal loop.
title: Comprehensive Analysis of HEXB Protein Reveal Forty Two Novel nsSNPs That May Lead to Sandhoff disease (SD) Using Bioinformatics

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with the joint phenotype MS-IBD in the analyses performed.
title: Investigating the shared genetic architecture between multiple sclerosis and inflammatory bowel diseases

finding: This SNP was one of the novel loci identified in the joint analyses of MS and IBD.
title: Investigating the shared genetic architecture between multiple sclerosis and inflammatory bowel diseases

finding: This SNP was identified in the cross-trait meta-analysis as being associated with MS and CD.
title: Investigating the shared genetic architecture between multiple sclerosis and inflammatory bowel diseases

finding: The SNP rs10040093 was associated with the regulation of the AP-1 family members, which was discussed in the context of CD30-positive lymphomas. This finding highlighted the SNP's role in influencing gene expression related to oncogenesis in these lymphomas, thereby establishing a significant link between the SNP and cancer development.
title: SifiNet: A robust and accurate method to identify feature gene sets and annotate cells

finding: This SNP in the SLC22A4 gene was associated with autoimmune thyroid disease in a Chinese population, indicating broader implications for immune-related disorders including those affecting the gastrointestinal system.
title: Identification of hub genes and key pathways in pediatric Crohn’s disease using next generation sequencing and bioinformatics analysis

finding: This allergy-associated SNP interacted with the SIK1 gene which was upregulated after T cell activation, demonstrating a connection between genetic variation and immune response.
title: Dynamic chromatin architecture identifies new autoimmune-associated enhancers for IL2 and novel genes regulating CD4+ T cell activation

finding: This SNP, located in the ERAP2 gene, was associated with strong positive selection events during the Black Death pandemic in northern Europe. The CNN estimated the selection strength as approximately 0.017, with a time of selection beginning around 2,000 years ago, corroborating its role in host defense against pathogens.
title: Deep estimation of the intensity and timing of selection from ancient genomes

finding: This splice region SNP in the ERAP2 gene was confirmed to exhibit significant positive selection across different continental regions, with CNN estimates suggesting recent selection starting roughly 2,000 years ago.
title: Deep estimation of the intensity and timing of selection from ancient genomes

finding: The SNP rs144596626, located at locus CDH18, was revealed as the most significant SNP with a p-value of 2.68e-10 that manipulates change in brain segregation, as shown through Louvain modularity analysis. The CDH18 gene mediates calcium-dependent adhesion and is expressed in the brain, being associated with several neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Brain Connectivity Changes for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Individuals with the SNP rs185971980, which was located in the intergenic region of FAM170A and PRR16, exhibited a lower abundance of Acinetobacter johnsonii in urine (p=4.46×10^-10). This SNP was also correlated with several hematological parameters such as mean hemoglobin content and blood iron levels.
title: Unraveling the impact of host genetics and factors on the urinary microbiome in a young population

finding: The SNP rs2617503 was implicated in autism spectrum disorder (ASD) risk, as documented in reports concerning polymorphisms in the GABRB2 gene, which encodes a subunit of the GABA type A receptor pivotal for brain inhibitory signaling.
title: Investigating the impact of paternal aging on murine sperm miRNA profiles and their potential link to autism spectrum disorder

finding: Having been associated with autism spectrum disorder (ASD), SNP rs12187676, identified in the context of GABRB2 gene polymorphisms, highlights the relevance of this gene in ASD risk due to its role in the brain's inhibitory mechanisms.
title: Investigating the impact of paternal aging on murine sperm miRNA profiles and their potential link to autism spectrum disorder

finding: SNP rs12653866 was implicated in the gene TNFRSF14, which is connected to inflammatory processes in autoimmune diseases and asthma. A cluster of SNPs, including rs12653866, showed a high posterior inclusion probability of being associated with gene expression. This variant resided in a region with increased accessibility in response to PHA treatment in monocytes and was associated with differential binding scores, indicating a role in the transcriptional regulation related to asthma.
title: Functional characterization of eQTLs and asthma risk loci with scATAC-seq across immune cell types and contexts

finding: The SNP rs13184721 was associated with the regulation of immune responses in the context of tumor-associated cells, as demonstrated by Linder and Pogge von Strandmann (2021). The findings suggested that genes linked to this SNP played significant roles in cell signaling pathways that could affect stress responses in tumor environments.
title: Transcriptional memories mediate the plasticity of sulfide stress responses to enable acclimation in Urechis unicinctus

finding: Located in the promoter of the DNAJC18 gene, the alternative allele, T, was associated with consistently reduced H3K27ac peak heights and reduced expression of DNAJC18 when compared to GG homozygotes. The gene has implications in cardiac function.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: In the cancer cell line RPMI-8226, the study identified that this cell line had monoallelic expression specifically from the A allele of the rs2736098 SNP located in exon 2 of TERT. Sanger sequencing confirmed that RPMI-8226 was heterozygous for A and G alleles, but only the A allele was expressed. The methylation pattern showed that the expressed A allele was associated with unmethylated regions, while the repressed G allele was hypermethylated. This finding highlighted the significant role of DNA methylation in regulating the expression of alleles at the TERT locus in cancer.
title: Pervasive promoter hypermethylation of silenced TERT alleles in human cancers

finding: The SNP rs13184668 was connected to the study by Spaan et al. in 2021, which highlighted that upregulation of the bcl-2 protein bfl-1 correlated with increased NF-kB pathway activity and relapse in multiple myeloma, indicating its relevance to treatment resistance.
title: Comparison of Transcriptomic Changes in Younger and Older Multiple Myeloma Patients from the MMRF-CoMMpass Study RNA-Seq Data

finding: The SNP rs35329108 was linked to hyperglycinuria/iminoglycinuria and demonstrated a frequency difference between Ukrainians and neighboring populations, suggesting potentially unique evolutionary influences on the population's genetics.
title: Genome Diversity in Ukraine

finding: The SNP rs10060161 was positively linked to the expression of the transcription factor Kruppel-like factor 2a (klf2a), which was identified as force-responsive in tenocytes during a study on tendon adaptation to mechanical forces. This finding suggested that variations in this SNP could have implications in the regulation of tendons under mechanical stress, potentially affecting tendon diseases or injuries.
title: Transcriptome profiling of tendon fibroblasts at the onset of embryonic muscle contraction reveals novel force-responsive genes

finding: The variant rs11950040, a downstream gene variant for CCL28 on chromosome 5, was associated with maximum forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1 max). The allele was common globally, with an allele frequency of 42.8%, and had shown nominally significant associations with peak expiratory flow in cohorts of European ancestry. This highlights its potential relevance in respiratory traits across diverse populations.
title: Whole-genome Studies of Malagasy People Uncover Novel Body Composition Associations

finding: The SNP rs6295, associated with the HTR1A gene, was examined in the context of its interaction effect with the 5-HTTLPR polymorphism. Specifically, it was found to impact the frontoparietal network, which is a critical functional connectome hub. This finding was significant as it demonstrated how genetic variation can influence the connectivity and functionality of brain networks, aligning with the broader themes of neural pathophysiology and cognitive processing.
title: Mapping Consistent, Reproducible, and Transcriptionally Relevant Connectome Hubs of the Human Brain

finding: The SNP rs79727797 was associated with a delaying age at motor onset modifier effect (5BM1) in the TCERG1 gene, showing significant p-values (age at motor onset: p=8.9E-14; age at TFC6: p=1.8E-18). This association related to cognitive and motor dysfunction in Huntington's disease.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: The SNP rs202157262 tagged a second modifier haplotype (5BM2) in TCERG1 that was genome-wide significant for delayed age at TFC6 (p=3.3E-08), but did not achieve suggestive significance for age at motor onset (p=9.3E-05). This highlighted its distinct effect despite being conditional on rs79727797.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: The SNP rs113361582 exhibited a significant effect in both clinical and somatic expansion studies (5AM2/5ABEM2), reinforcing its role in modifying Huntington's disease pathology.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: The SNP rs245100 was a key tag SNV for a common hastening modifier effect seen in both clinical and somatic expansion contexts (5AM1/5ABEM1).
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: The SNP rs245105 represented a significant link to increased CAG expansion (5ABEM1), supporting its relevance in the modification of pathology.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: The SNP rs1650689 was indicated as part of a significant cumulative effect observed in the MSH3 area, detailing the survival impact of mutations.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: The SNP rs10709981 was found to be located within a homopolymer repeat that was positively associated (nominal p<0.01) with the expression of the gene SLC36A1 across 15 tissues, specifically tied to the phenotypes related to basophil percentage of granulocytes.
title: Multi-tissue analysis reveals short tandem repeats as ubiquitous regulators of gene expression and complex traits

finding: The SNP rs113004948 was located in the gene CDKL3, which encodes a cyclin-dependent kinase protein. Prior studies indicated significant associations between this gene and eosinophil counts, which relate to cardiac complications. This finding illustrated the genetic basis shared between Delta ECG and CVD correlates, particularly relating to eosinophils.
title: Genetic underpinnings of predicted changes in cardiovascular function using self supervised learning

finding: The SNP rs17229943 was detected as the lead signal in the RAD17 locus by both FiniMOM and SuSiE methods. This variant was associated with credible sets generated in the discovery GWAS; however, no strong signal was observed for variants in its credible sets during the replication GWAS.
title: Genetic fine-mapping from summary data using a non-local prior improves detection of multiple causal variants

finding: The SNP rs2736098 in the TERT gene was successfully replicated, aligning with earlier findings associating it with pancreatic cancer.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS assessment on genetic susceptibility to pancreatic cancer

finding: Associated with increased itch intensity from mosquito bites, this SNP has been steadily rising in frequency since about 9,000 years ago.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: The selected allele for the SLC45A2 locus, responsible for lighter skin pigmentation, increased in frequency from approximately 13,000 years ago.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: SNP rs4538604 was predicted as a trans-eQTL in stomach and resided in the inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) 5 locus, associated with Crohn's disease. It had several top predicted target genes connected to IBD, such as C5AR1, and highlighted its potential relevance in intestinal inflammatory processes.
title: Reverse regression increases power for detecting trans-eQTLs

finding: The intronic variant rs72799142 within LINC01470 was shown to be associated with morningness and had elevated allele frequencies particularly in the Brahui, Kalash, Makrani, and Sindhi populations.
title: Exploring adaptive introgression in modern human circadian rhythm genes

finding: The variant rs723427 found in the LINC01933-ENSG00000286749 intergenic region was linked to morningness, with notable frequencies in the Surui population.
title: Exploring adaptive introgression in modern human circadian rhythm genes

finding: The SNP rs27291 was an sQTL for the LNPEP gene, associated with an effect size of 0.672, indicative of exon inclusion, linked to a predicted decrease in PTBP1 binding affinity.
title: Profiling genetically driven alternative splicing across the Indonesian Archipelago

finding: The variant rs309587 in 5q14.3 was identified as positively influencing white matter microstructure, affecting several FA measures.
title: Common genetic variation influencing human white matter microstructure

finding: The C99Y mutation involved a substitution where Cysteine was replaced by Tyrosine at position 99, leading to significant structural changes. The mutant residue was larger than the wild-type and exhibited differences in hydrophobicity, impacting molecular interactions and potentially altering the protein's functionality.
title: Insilico Analysis Reveal Three novel nsSNPs May effect on GM2A protein Leading to AB variant of GM2 gangliosidosis

finding: The C112F mutation included a change from Cysteine to Phenylalanine at position 112, which was located in the core of a domain. This alteration caused structural disturbances due to size differences compared to the wild-type residue, likely affecting the core integrity of the protein.
title: Insilico Analysis Reveal Three novel nsSNPs May effect on GM2A protein Leading to AB variant of GM2 gangliosidosis

finding: Two mutations were associated with this SNP: C138R and C138S. The C138R mutation replaced Cysteine with Arginine, introducing a positive charge and increasing the residue size, which may disrupt interactions due to electrostatic repulsion and loss of hydrophobic engagements. Meanwhile, C138S led to a change from Cysteine to Serine, with a decrease in hydrophobicity that could also affect protein interactions on its surface.
title: Insilico Analysis Reveal Three novel nsSNPs May effect on GM2A protein Leading to AB variant of GM2 gangliosidosis

finding: The SNP rs1651285 was associated with lower SNHG18 expression in SMCs, implicating a role in increased SMC proliferation and contributing to CAD risk in the 5p15 locus.
title: Genetic regulation of human aortic smooth muscle cell gene expression and splicing predict causal coronary artery disease genes

finding: Similar to rs1651285, SNP rs1706987 was associated with lower SNHG18 expression, indicating its potential causal role in SMC proliferation and CAD risk.
title: Genetic regulation of human aortic smooth muscle cell gene expression and splicing predict causal coronary artery disease genes

finding: SNP rs1398337 was also linked to lower SNHG18 expression, reinforcing the idea of its role in SMC proliferation regulation and CAD susceptibility.
title: Genetic regulation of human aortic smooth muscle cell gene expression and splicing predict causal coronary artery disease genes

finding: This SNP was identified as the strongest variant associated with atopic dermatitis (AD) and was located in the TMEM232 gene. The study confirmed its association with AD through haplotype and genomic scanning methods.
title: Identification of theTMEM232 gene associated with atopic dermatitis through targeted capture sequencing

finding: This SNP was associated with AD as reported in a genome-wide association study (GWAS) among the Chinese Han population. It was part of a set of four significant SNPs corroborated by further genetic analyses.
title: Identification of theTMEM232 gene associated with atopic dermatitis through targeted capture sequencing

finding: This SNP was included in the group of four significant SNPs linked to AD. The association was derived from previous findings in the Chinese Han population's GWAS.
title: Identification of theTMEM232 gene associated with atopic dermatitis through targeted capture sequencing

finding: This SNP was part of the four significant SNPs found to be associated with atopic dermatitis (AD), based on the results from a genome-wide association study involving the Chinese Han population.
title: Identification of theTMEM232 gene associated with atopic dermatitis through targeted capture sequencing

finding: Similar to others in the list, this SNP was identified as significant in association with AD through previous studies conducted within the Chinese Han population.
title: Identification of theTMEM232 gene associated with atopic dermatitis through targeted capture sequencing

finding: This deletion was one of the six variants found to relate to atopic dermatitis (AD), as reported in the studies of the 5q22.1 genomic region.
title: Identification of theTMEM232 gene associated with atopic dermatitis through targeted capture sequencing

finding: This deletion was part of the significant variants linked to atopic dermatitis (AD) detailed in the investigation of the 5q22.1 region.
title: Identification of theTMEM232 gene associated with atopic dermatitis through targeted capture sequencing

finding: This SNP was identified amongst the significant deletions correlating with AD, further affirming the link established through earlier research.
title: Identification of theTMEM232 gene associated with atopic dermatitis through targeted capture sequencing

finding: The structural impacts of SNP rs76037120 were described as moderate to major according to structural prediction results.
title: Effect of Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms on the structure of long noncoding RNAs and their interaction with RNA Binding Proteins

finding: The SNP rs16891982 was identified as having the highest loadings in both Principal Component 1 (PC1) and Principal Component 2 (PC2) during the PCA analysis of the UK Biobank dataset. It also ranked third highest for loading in Principal Component 4 (PC4). Located within the skin pigmentation gene SLC45A2, this SNP is notable for being under positive selection, indicating its relevance in studies of genetic selection and population differentiation. The findings highlighted the effectiveness of PCA in uncovering significant genetic patterns and variations associated with population structure.
title: Fast and accurate out-of-core PCA framework for large scale biobank data

finding: The SNP rs1837253 co-localized with a meQTL at cg15557878 in both adult onset and childhood onset asthma GWASs. This association suggested an epigenetic mechanism relating to asthma pathogenesis, as rs1837253 was linked to hypermethylation of the TSLP gene, a key cytokine involved in the inflammatory response in asthma and allergy. The lack of linkage disequilibrium with other nearby SNPs supported rs1837253 as the likely causal SNP at this locus.
title: Multi-omics co-localization with genome-wide association studies reveals a context-specific genetic mechanism at a childhood onset asthma risk locus

finding: The SNP rs888747 was located at an activity-regulated gene (ARG), specifically in the gene <CYSTM1>, making it a significant finding as it related to Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk factors.
title: Immediate-Early Genes as Influencers in Genetic Networks and their Role in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The study discussed an association between the functional TERT promoter polymorphism rs2853669 and cervical cancer risk in South Indian women. This finding highlighted the relevance of this SNP in understanding genetic predispositions to cancer, specifically cervical cancer.
title: Enhanced C/EBPs binding to C>T mismatches facilitates fixation of CpG mutations

finding: In a significant study, the SNP rs12654812 was associated with nephrolithiasis risk among the Guangxi population in China. This finding delineated the role of RGS14 in phosphate metabolism, indicating that genetic variations in RGS14 could influence kidney stone formation.
title: Genetic variants disrupt human RGS14 binding to NHERF1 and regulation of NPT2A-mediated phosphate transport

finding: This SNP was associated with the regulation of four genes, specifically ADAM19, CTB-109A12.1, CTB-47B11.3, and CYFIP2. These findings were part of the COPD-associated eQTL-gene regulatory interactions identified through the CoDeS3D pipeline.
title: De novo discovery of traits co-occurring with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The SNP rs34417617 was identified as a significant variant influencing chromatin accessibility at the WNT-responsive regulatory element (WRE) located at chr5:157912521-157914710 and gene expression of CLINT1. The finding underscored its role in context-specific gene regulation in neural progenitors upon Wnt pathway stimulation.
title: Wnt activity reveals context-specific genetic effects on gene regulation in neural progenitors

finding: The SNP rs889312 in MAP3K1 was associated with increased risk for breast cancer and was also linked to standing height, although not with lean body mass measures.
title: Heritable genetic variants in key cancer genes link cancer risk with anthropometric traits

finding: The variant rs1800888 (p.Thr164Ile) was characterized in relation to eosinophil counts and percentages, demonstrating a significant association with immune phenotypes.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: An association was found between rs1042713 (p.Gly16Arg) and immune cell counts, further establishing its role in immune variation.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: This variant was also associated with immune cell counts, yet it was indicated to share effects with rs1042713.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: Lin et al. (2020) reported a strong association between rs373863828, a missense mutation in the CREBRF gene, and adiposity phenotypes in Native Hawaiians. This variant was previously not well imputed due to its absence in public databases, leading to its undetectable status in GWAS studies.
title: Tree-based QTL mapping with expected local genetic relatedness matrices

finding: The association signal for BMI was originally detected at rs12513649 in Samoans. Lin et al. (2020) indicated that this SNP served as a tag for the association near the CREBRF locus but missed detecting the causal SNP rs373863828.
title: Tree-based QTL mapping with expected local genetic relatedness matrices

finding: The rs373863828 allele was identified as protective against gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) in Māori and Pacific women with obesity, suggesting a significant role in disease risk.
title: Integrated bioinformatics analysis reveals novel key biomarkers and potential candidate small molecule drugs in gestational diabetes mellitus

finding: The SNP rs13184678 was associated with the tumor microenvironment of esophageal adenocarcinoma (EAC). It was noted that this finding contributed to understanding the differentiation status of EAC and the various cancer-associated fibroblast (CAF) phenotypes present in the tumor microenvironment of patients. This association underscored the importance of genetic factors in modulating the cellular composition of the TME and its implications for tumor progression.
title: Patient-Derived Tumor Organoid and Fibroblast Assembloid Models for interrogation of the tumor microenvironment in Esophageal Adenocarcinoma

finding: The SNP rs10060932 was associated with phenological changes in temperate forests, as demonstrated by a study which compared GPP-based phenology against reflectance indices and SIF observations, indicating that it played a key role in determining leaf phenology dynamics.
title: A general model for the seasonal to decadal dynamics of leaf area

finding: The SNP rs61748181 resulted in an amino acid change from alanine to threonine (A279T). It was linked to multiple diseases including bone marrow failure, lung cancer, and esophageal cancer. The variant exhibited similar cell growth kinetics to wild-type TERT in an ex vivo model, although primary cells expressing this minor allele showed a replication-dependent loss of telomere length.
title: Evaluations of short telomere risk-associated single nucleotide polymorphisms in telomerase reverse transcriptase gene on telomere length maintenance

finding: The TERT SNP rs34094720 caused a substitution from histidine to tyrosine (H412Y) and was associated with aplastic anemia, idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF), and systemic sclerosis. While the SNP was consistently identified in correlation studies with telomere biology disorders, its effects on telomerase activity varied; one study reported drastic reduction while others reported minimal to no change. In cell models, expressing this variant indicated potential telomere maintenance defects.
title: Evaluations of short telomere risk-associated single nucleotide polymorphisms in telomerase reverse transcriptase gene on telomere length maintenance

finding: The SNP rs1056893 was analyzed in the context of the gene ERAP2. Ornaments demonstrated improved detection of allele-specific expression, showing higher sensitivity in detecting imprinted signals at the transcript level compared to WASP, which only detected signals at the gene level.
title: Ornaments for Accurate and Efficient Allele-Specific Expression Estimation with Bias Correction

finding: The SNP rs1805377, located in the <italic>XRCC4</italic> gene, was shown to abolish a natural acceptor splice site while strengthening a cryptic acceptor site, resulting in a significant loss of the normal splice isoform and an increase in a shorter isoform, which could be validated by q-RT-PCR. The A/A genotype was associated with a much lower use of the cryptic site compared to other genotypes.
title: Expression changes confirm genomic variants predicted to result in allele-specific, alternative mRNA splicing

finding: The SNP rs121434579 was found to be related to Epilepsy through mutations in the GABRA1 gene. The analysis determined that this SNP corresponded to deleterious mutations that could impact protein interactions critical for neuronal function, providing insights into the underlying mechanisms of Epilepsy.
title: In silico analysis of the altered protein structure and functions caused by existing synaptic gene mutations in Indian population having neurological disorders

finding: The SNP rs10060196 was positively associated with altered regulation mechanisms of Pyk2, indicating its relevance in cancer development. The finding related to the modulation of kinase activity through the interplay of autophosphorylation and Src recruitment, as discussed in relation to the FAK and PYK2 pathways in cancer contexts.
title: Activation loop phosphorylation tunes conformational dynamics underlying Pyk2 tyrosine kinase activation

finding: The SNP rs17076061 located on chromosome 5q35.2 was significantly associated with the common neurobiological substrate (CCS) at genome-wide significance (p=1.46×10−9) and replicated in a separate cohort. The minor allele T of this SNP was associated with smaller CCS volumes. However, there was no significant genetic overlap found between this SNP and risk factors for major psychiatric disorders in the analyzed GWAS publications, indicating that its role in disease risk may be indirect and influenced by age and other factors.
title: Genetic factors influencing a neurobiological substrate for psychiatric disorders

finding: SNP rs56219078 indicated a joint association with CT and SA relevant to SCZ. The HMP values were 1.51×10^-4 for CT and 1.38×10^-6 for SA, suggesting its significant role in brain morphology alterations in SCZ.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs12054920 was identified as associated with lower SA measures in ADHD, which indicates its contribution to cortical surface area.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs4437406 was associated with increased thickness of the supramarginal cortex in major depressive disorder (MDD), demonstrating its influence.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The SNP rs148833559 (A/C) was associated with an increase in appendicular lean mass (ALM). The minor allele (A) of this missense SNP had a significant effect size on ALM (beta = 0.877 ± 0.13 kg). Despite its association with higher ALM, prediction tools indicated that this SNP might negatively affect the protein structure of the STC2 gene, which is expressed in human skeletal muscle.
title: Genome-wide associations reveal human-mouse genetic convergence and novel modifiers of myogenesis, CPNE1 and STC2

finding: The SNP rs13184720 was linked to cancer invasion and metastasis according to the findings by Asif et al. in 2021. This research highlighted the role of genetic variations in shaping cancer-associated fibroblasts' activity, impacting tumor progression and the TME.
title: From tumor microenvironment to immuno-therapeutic outcomes for solid tumors: A systems theoretic approach

finding: The variant rs2853677, located in the 5p15.33 region, was identified as the most significant variant with a GWAS p-value of 8E-20. It was linked to multiple cancer types including skin cancer, melanoma, prostate cancer, and lung cancer. This SNP is located in an intronic region of the TERT gene, known for its role in telomerase activity and cancer predisposition, thereby providing substantial clinical relevance.
title: Recessive effects in cancer predisposition exposed by genome-wide and proteome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs13174277 was mentioned in the context of an improved animal model of multiple myeloma bone disease by Mehdi et al. (2021). This finding indicated that the genetic characteristics associated with this SNP could affect the progression and management of bone disease related to multiple myeloma.
title: Immune-mediated tumor control in the 5TGM1 transfer model of multiple myeloma

finding: In the PheWAS study, rs17876032 was identified as one of the top signal loci associated with activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT), exhibiting a significant p-value of 3.29×10−83. This finding was part of the comprehensive analysis of phenotypes that included multiple significant SNP associations.
title: Phenome-wide association study of a comprehensive health check-up database in a Korea population: Clinical application & trans-ethnic comparison

finding: Significantly linked to prothrombin time (PT) with a p-value of 1.12×10−10, rs112911835 was associated with a long intergenic non-protein-coding RNA. This finding contributes to understanding the regulation of coagulation pathways.
title: Phenome-wide association study of a comprehensive health check-up database in a Korea population: Clinical application & trans-ethnic comparison

finding: The SNP rs2291418 was characterized in relation to a G-Quadruplex structure within pre-miRNA-1229, which was associated with Alzheimer’s disease. The variant impacted miRNA maturation, implicating it in the disease mechanism and suggesting its potential role in the pathogenesis of Alzheimer’s.
title: Genetic variations in G-Quadruplex forming sequences affect the transcription of human disease-related genes

finding: The study identified that rs11567701 was associated with a new hub protein, IL-7R, unique to the Leuven cohort, which facilitated a more granular classification of patient clusters in relation to ulcerative colitis (UC). This suggested that the presence of rs11567701 contributed to the clustering differences observed in the patient networks.
title: A systems genomics approach to uncover patient-specific pathogenic pathways and proteins in a complex disease

finding: Similar to rs11567701, rs11567699 was also noted to impact the newly identified hub protein IL-7R in the Leuven cohort, helping to enhance the complexity of the patient cluster structure related to UC.
title: A systems genomics approach to uncover patient-specific pathogenic pathways and proteins in a complex disease

finding: The SNP rs10514299, located in the TMEM161B-MEF2C gene region, was identified as a GWAS-supported variant. It was found to predict putamen activation during reward processing specifically in the context of alcohol dependence, thereby linking this genetic variant to neural response patterns relevant to mood disorders such as major depressive disorder.
title: Regional expression profiles of risk genes for depression are associated with brain activation patterns in emotion and reward tasks

finding: Located in the TERT gene, rs56345976 was found to be in modest linkage disequilibrium with variants associated with increased cancer risks such as those for breast, ovarian, and prostate cancers. Additionally, it showed a protective role in certain cancers, suggesting its complex role in cancer predisposition in the context of LOY.
title: Genetic predisposition to mosaic Y chromosome loss in blood is associated with genomic instability in other tissues and susceptibility to non-haematological cancers

finding: This SNP had divergent effects across immune cell types, being a significant caQTL in all cells, but with the G allele increasing accessibility in B cells and monocytes while the A allele increased accessibility in CD4+ and CD8+ T cells.
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: Located in the ITGA1 gene, this SNP exhibited strong associations with LDL levels, linking its effect to both coronary artery disease and lipid traits.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: A highly significant cfQTL was identified at rs26481 in epithelial cells for the gene ERAP2 (FDR = 5.5×10^-69). This variant represented an independent signal from rs2927610, which acted as a marginal eQTL, suggesting distinct regulatory mechanisms affecting ERAP2 expression in tumors compared to normal tissues.
title: A novel method to identify cell-type specific regulatory variants and their role in cancer risk

finding: The SNP rs34316 was identified as being genome-wide significant for intelligence (IQ) and educational attainment (EA). It was noted that this SNP is in high linkage disequilibrium (LD; r²=0.98) with other top associated SNPs spanning the 3’ end and downstream region of the MEF2C gene. The finding indicated that alleles associated with reduced IQ and EA corresponded to increased expression of MEF2C.
title: Genes influenced by MEF2C contribute to neurodevelopmental disease via gene expression changes that affect multiple types of cortical excitatory neurons

finding: The SNP rs254781 was found to be genome-wide significant for educational attainment (EA) and, like rs34316, was in high linkage disequilibrium (LD; r²=0.98) with other associated SNPs. This SNP also spanned the 3’ end and downstream region of MEF2C, supporting the association with reduced IQ and EA being linked to increased MEF2C expression.
title: Genes influenced by MEF2C contribute to neurodevelopmental disease via gene expression changes that affect multiple types of cortical excitatory neurons

finding: The SNP rs639725 was reported as being in high linkage disequilibrium (LD; r²>0.98) with the SNPs associated with intelligence (IQ) and educational attainment (EA). It was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for MEF2C in the cerebellum of both Alzheimer’s disease patients and healthy controls, indicating that the alleles associated with reduced IQ and EA corresponded with increased expression of MEF2C.
title: Genes influenced by MEF2C contribute to neurodevelopmental disease via gene expression changes that affect multiple types of cortical excitatory neurons

finding: At the ZBED3-AS1 locus associated with HbA1c, rs7732130 was highlighted as a potential causal variant supported by functional evidence. Fine-mapping indicated that rs7732130 was part of a smaller 99% credible set size for FG compared to HbA1c, influenced by whether intronic variants were included in the model. Functional studies indicated that perturbation of rs7732130 led to changes in gene expression for ZBED3 and associated genes, which are involved in glucose metabolism and insulin signalling pathways. Notably, a mouse knock-out model of Zbed3 displayed elevated glucose levels, reinforcing the link between this variant, glycaemic traits, and the regulatory functions of ZBED3.
title: Combining functional annotation and multi-trait fine-mapping methods improves fine-mapping resolution at glycaemic trait loci

finding: The rare variant rs570334020 in PDE4D reached significant levels of association with retinal detachment in the sensitivity analyses.
title: Insight into the genetic aetiology of retinal detachment by combining small clinical and large population-based datasets

finding: The SNP rs17070145 was associated with episodic memory in early stages of a human neurodevelopmental disorder, suggesting its involvement in cognitive processes related to learning and memory.
title: KIBRA Regulates AMPA Receptor Expression, Synaptic Plasticity, and Memory in an Age-Dependent Manner

finding: The study suggested that the FAF2:rs374702773 variant was associated with reduced alcohol-related cirrhosis. In the context of the study, knocking down the faf2 gene in zebrafish increased triglyceride (TG) accumulation and implicated FAF2 in regulating TG hydrolysis, hinting that the rs374702773 mutation may function as a gain of function.
title: Investigating the role of lipid genes in liver disease using fatty liver models of alcohol and high fat in zebrafish (Danio rerio)

finding: The SNP rs77635680 exhibited a p-value of 2.22 × 10-10, marking it as another previously suggested signal of selection.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: The SNP rs116352364 demonstrated a p-value of 5.24 × 10-11, thus establishing it as another novel signal of selection highlighted in the findings.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: The SNP rs6962 was linked to a high-confidence peptide TLNEADCAT[L/I]PPAIR with a mutation V609L/V609I in succinate dehydrogenase (P31040-2), identified with 88 confident and 3 semi-confident PSMs, validating its existence from the original study.
title: Quality control of variant peptides identified through proteogenomics- catching the (un)usual suspects

finding: The SNP rs11567705 was associated with a reduced risk of multiple sclerosis and correlated with decreased reactive lymphocyte concentration. This suggests that modulation of T-cell activation might be part of its etiology, further supporting IL7R as a potential therapeutic target for MS.
title: Genetic Analyses of Blood Cell Structure for Biological and Pharmacological Inference

finding: This SNP was identified as trait-specific for Crohn's disease. It was associated with the expression of genes TTC33 and PTGER4, with the strongest effect in the small intestine, which is relevant to Crohn's disease.
title: Genome-Wide Large-Scale Multi-Trait Analysis Characterizes Global Patterns of Pleiotropy and Unique Trait-Specific Variants

finding: This SNP was linked to prostate cancer, functioning as an eQTL for IRX4 across four tissues, with the largest effect observed in prostate tissue.
title: Genome-Wide Large-Scale Multi-Trait Analysis Characterizes Global Patterns of Pleiotropy and Unique Trait-Specific Variants

finding: This SNP was identified for Crohn's disease and was associated with the expression of genes IRGM, ZNF300, and RBM22, with some associations occurring in relevant digestive tissues.
title: Genome-Wide Large-Scale Multi-Trait Analysis Characterizes Global Patterns of Pleiotropy and Unique Trait-Specific Variants

finding: This SNP was reported in the context of the spatial quantitative systems pharmacology (spQSP) platform, which simulated tumor-immune interactions and the effects of checkpoint inhibitor immunotherapy. The analysis suggested that genetic variations could correlate with the immune response in patients undergoing treatment.
title: Informing virtual clinical trials of hepatocellular carcinoma with spatial multi-omics analysis of a human neoadjuvant immunotherapy clinical trial

finding: The finding for rs157845 emerged from the aLIT analysis, showing significant interactive involvement in obesity-related traits.
title: Identifying latent genetic interactions in genome-wide association studies using multiple traits

finding: The splice site variant rs7724759 present in the CAST gene was identified as an ASE likely to be driven by exon-level regulation, demonstrating its significant impact on exon expression without affecting the overall gene-level expression.
title: Regulatory sites for known and novel splicing in human basal ganglia are enriched for disease-relevant information

finding: The SNP rs11743851 was involved in establishing a causal link between eosinophil count and asthma. Although it was detected as significant despite other variations showing non-significance, it indicated that this SNP was crucial in the context of asthma research.
title: Constraint-based analysis for causal discovery in population-based biobanks

finding: This SNP was observed within a trimodal QTL related to PAM expression, illustrating its relevance in metabolic regulation and inflammatory pathways in monocytes.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The SNP rs181578390 was part of Component #181, which was associated with a dense cluster of protocadherin genes located in the 5q31 region. This component predominantly influenced diffusion and cortical surface area neuroimaging phenotypes. A total of 137 variants in high linkage disequilibrium contributed to the multivariate signal of this component, highlighting a significant z-score of 13.95.
title: Independent Genomic Sources of Brain Structure and Function

finding: The SNP rs201493000 was the top SNP in Component #181, acting as a missense variant in the PCDHA11 gene (PCDHA11:Q61>P). This gene is part of the protocadherin family associated with synaptic connections and was implicated in neuropsychiatric disorders. The genomic component it belonged to mostly affected diffusion and cortical surface area phenotypes.
title: Independent Genomic Sources of Brain Structure and Function

finding: Similarly, rs35397 located in the SLC45A2 gene was also highlighted as a large effect variant influencing skin pigmentation. The study's summary statistics revealed its substantial effect size when conditioning on other variants.
title: Interpreting SNP heritability in admixed populations

finding: The SNP rs173686 from the VCAN gene on chromosome 5 was shown to be associated with white matter integrity, impacting cognitive function related to intelligence <g>. This finding was part of a broader analysis involving a cluster of 22 FA measures that were assessed together.
title: A new Mendelian Randomization method to estimate causal effects of multivariable brain imaging exposures

finding: The SNP rs35483733, also part of the VCAN gene on chromosome 5, demonstrated an association with white matter integrity affecting intelligence <g>. It was included in a study that identified common instrumental variables (IVs) across various FA measures that significantly influenced cognitive performance.
title: A new Mendelian Randomization method to estimate causal effects of multivariable brain imaging exposures

finding: The SNP rs78483393, another variant from the VCAN gene on chromosome 5, was associated with the integrity of white matter and was integral to understanding how different FA measures worked together to affect cognitive function as indicated by intelligence <g>.
title: A new Mendelian Randomization method to estimate causal effects of multivariable brain imaging exposures

finding: This SNP, located in SLC45A2, has been linked to pigmentation traits in Europeans, highlighting its role in hair and skin color adaptation.
title: Ohana: detecting selection in multiple populations by modelling ancestral admixture components

finding: This SNP was associated with increased ANKRD55 transcript levels in PBMCs and CD4+ T cells. It was linked to an enhancer that regulates IL6ST and ANKRD55, which are crucial in Th17 differentiation and immune response, important in the context of autoimmune diseases.
title: Integration of genetic and epigenetic data pinpoints autoimmune specific remodelling of enhancer landscape in CD4+ T cells

finding: Identified on Chromosome 3, SNP rs264342 was associated with stomatal index (SI) at Duclos. Its detection alongside rs1436584 at a different location illustrated the variability of genetic associations, critical for understanding trait inheritance.
title: Identification and analysis of genomic regions influencing leaf morpho-physiological traits related to stress responses in Dioscorea alata

finding: SNP rs450349, which was on Chromosome 5, associated with leaf dry matter content (LDMC), accounting for 11.36% of the variation. The GA allele was linked to higher LDMC compared to GG, indicating its potential in improving water and nutrient utilization.
title: Identification and analysis of genomic regions influencing leaf morpho-physiological traits related to stress responses in Dioscorea alata

finding: The research identified rs304152 as an ALS-associated SNP located in the enhancer region of the MEF2C gene. It was shown that the minor G allele of rs304152 led to reduced expression of the MEF2C gene, leading to mitochondrial dysfunction and oxidative stress, which are significant features in ALS pathogenesis. Specifically, the rs304152 G allele impaired the binding of the transcription factor ATF4 to the MEF2C enhancer, which resulted in decreased transcriptional activity and subsequently affected mitochondrial-encoded genes, contributing to motor neuron degeneration.
title: Loss of MEF2C function by enhancer mutation leads to neuronal mitochondria dysfunction and motor deficits in mice

finding: The SNP rs7731626 was identified as a linked IBD risk variant that overlapped an enhancer active specifically in T cell subsets and fetal thymus tissue, indicating its role in regulating IL6ST expression in T cells.
title: Genome-wide maps of enhancer regulation connect risk variants to disease genes

finding: SNP rs6871146 had a male-specific association with Lactococcus, suggesting a significant gender divergence in host-microbiome interactions.
title: M-GWAS for the gut microbiome in Chinese adults illuminates on complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs1050152 was identified as an immune disease-related variant in European populations, specifically associated with Crohn's disease, asthma, and ulcerative colitis. Genotype CT was linked to an increased response to Ustekinumab in psoriasis patients compared to genotype CC, with a p-value of 0.037. Conversely, genotype TT was associated with a decreased response to Imatinib in individuals with gastrointestinal stromal tumors and leukemia. This SNP was recognized as a favored mutation in CEU (DFscore = 0.815), indicating its positive selection in relation to immune responses and drug efficacy.
title: PopTradeOff: a database for exploring population-specific trade-offs between adaptive evolution, disease susceptibility, and drug responsiveness

finding: The SNP rs10514231 was found to lead to breast cancer predisposition by altering the expression of the ATP6AP1L gene. This finding highlighted the relationship between genetic variations and increased risk of breast cancer.
title: Addressing the mean-variance relationship in spatially resolved transcriptomics data with spoon

finding: The SNP rs2291418 was identified as an Alzheimer's Disease-associated variant that affects the maturation of pre-miRNA-1229 by influencing the formation of a G-Quadruplex structure. This specific genetic variant had implications for the regulation of miRNA-1229, showcasing its role in miRNA biogenesis and the potential mechanisms by which it could be linked to Alzheimer's pathology.
title: G-quadruplexes regulate miRNA biogenesis in live zebrafish embryos

finding: The SNP rs13187817, located outside of the ZNF300 gene locus on chromosome 5, was found to mediate the effects of this SNP on placenta perimeter, area, and max diameter through DNA methylation at the ZNF300 locus. This association indicated that an increase in DNA methylation at the ZNF300 region is significantly associated with an increase in placenta area, with a p-value of 0.014. Additionally, the association between rs13187817 and placenta morphology was no longer significant when adjusted for DNA methylation, indicating that the methylation status is a key mediator in this relationship.
title: Placenta DNA methylation at ZNF300 is associated with fetal sex and placental morphology

finding: The SNP rs325506 demonstrated a strong association with both ASD and TS, achieving a p-value of 9.42 x 10^-9, with m-values of 1 for ASD and 0.984 for TS, highlighting its importance in the transdiagnostic framework.
title: Cross-disorder GWAS meta-analysis for Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, and Tourette Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs111896713 was found to partially dampen the repressive influence of R1, which acts as a ZNF274-dependent cis-repressor. This finding established that ZNF274-controlled R1 and R2 regions organized local chromosomal conformations at the PCDH locus and exerted repressive effects on gene expression.
title: Clusters of lineage-specific genes are anchored by ZNF274 in repressive perinucleolar compartments

finding: The SNP rs13174254 was associated with the tumor suppressor role of Thyroid Hormone Receptor Beta (TRβ) in solid tumors. This finding indicated that activation of TRβ could be a potential target for treatment strategies in anaplastic thyroid cancer (ATC) and may affect the response to therapies.
title: TRβ Agonism Induces Tumor Suppression and Enhances Drug Efficacy in Anaplastic Thyroid Cancer in Female Mice

finding: The variant rs459193 was associated with increased abdominal obesity across multiple metrics while also providing protection from type 2 diabetes in nearly every metric. This finding illustrated metabolic discordance, where increased fat accumulation was coupled with reduced diabetes risk.
title: Predicting mechanisms of action at genetic loci associated with discordant effects on type 2 diabetes and abdominal fat accumulation

finding: The T allele of rs6860588 was linked to protection from type 2 diabetes while concurrently being associated with increased abdominal obesity. It affected the expression of several effector genes such as GIN1 and PAM in adipose and skeletal muscle tissues, proposing a mechanism by which this variant confers increased fat accumulation but also provides diabetes protection.
title: Predicting mechanisms of action at genetic loci associated with discordant effects on type 2 diabetes and abdominal fat accumulation

finding: The common coding variant rs12513649 in the CREBRF gene was linked to increased BMI and overall adiposity while providing protection from insulin resistance in Samoans. This exemplified a genetic mechanism where increased fat mass did not correlate with heightened diabetes risk.
title: Predicting mechanisms of action at genetic loci associated with discordant effects on type 2 diabetes and abdominal fat accumulation

finding: The SNP rs2434531 was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the gene GALNT10. The derived allele of this SNP was associated with higher expression levels of GALNT10 in lymphoblastoid cells. Additionally, the overexpression of GALNT10 was found to be relevant to neurological disease, particularly schizophrenia, as individuals with schizophrenia exhibited higher levels of GALNT10 expression.
title: Machine-learning dissection of Human Accelerated Regions in primate neurodevelopment

finding: The SNP rs11740474 was found to be in linkage disequilibrium with 2xHAR.170 and associated with schizophrenia. This connection suggested that 2xHAR.170, which acts as an enhancer for GALNT10, may influence schizophrenia risk through the modulation of GALNT10 activity.
title: Machine-learning dissection of Human Accelerated Regions in primate neurodevelopment

finding: The SNP rs13184682 was identified as a positive and original finding in the context of MYC modulation by the gene MNT. This association was detailed in the study by Liano-Pons et al. in 2021, where it was discussed in relation to the pathway supporting cell proliferation and metabolic flexibility, particularly under glutamine-limiting conditions pertinent to cancer biology. The findings highlighted the genetic interactions that might influence glutamine dependency, which is characterized as a hallmark of several cancers.
title: FBXW7 alleviates c-MYC repression of pyruvate carboxylase to support metabolic flexibility

finding: The SNP rs13153869 was associated with the expression levels of Keratin 16 during the metastatic progression of breast cancer, indicating a significant role in cancer biology.
title: Manipulating the EphB4-ephrinB2 axis to reduce metastasis in HNSCC

finding: SNP rs3747479 showed an extremely high probability (greater than 99.9%) of being an eQTL, suggesting a strong association with complex traits.
title: Primo: integration of multiple GWAS and omics QTL summary statistics for elucidation of molecular mechanisms of trait-associated SNPs and detection of pleiotropy in complex traits

finding: SNP rs73134739 also demonstrated a probability greater than 99.9% of being an eQTL, indicating significant relevance to the complex traits studied.
title: Primo: integration of multiple GWAS and omics QTL summary statistics for elucidation of molecular mechanisms of trait-associated SNPs and detection of pleiotropy in complex traits

finding: SNP rs3846662 was cataloged as a top sVariant linked to cholesterol metabolism, strongly colocalizing with high cholesterol GWAS signals. The predicted structural changes relating to the splicing of exon 16 suggested potential disruption of a Coenzyme A binding domain in HMGCR, implying a reduction in enzyme function and cellular cholesterol levels.
title: The impact of genetically controlled splicing on exon inclusion and protein structure

finding: SNP rs56235845 (chr5:177371039 T/G) was strongly associated with the contribution to the overall promoter activity for only decomposed promoters 1 and 2 of gene RGS14, indicating a significant positive effect on expression variability regarding its decomposed promoter structure. The frQTL beta values were 0.210 and -0.181 for the first two decomposed promoters, respectively, and the findings were statistically significant with FDR values of 2.42×10−5 and 2.54×10−8. Although it showed limited association with decomposed promoter 3, it still had a significant negative contribution to overall promoter activity with a prQTL beta of -2.47 and an FDR of 3.57×10−5.
title: Promoter sequence and architecture determine expression variability and confer robustness to genetic variants

finding: The SNP rs159497 was associated with the psychiatric trait in human populations, particularly indicating a significant association with forced expiratory volume in 1 second (p = 5E-8). This association showcased how variants in the Pde4d gene might indirectly influence cannabinoid activity through its link to PDE4 function.
title: Genetic modulation of initial sensitivity to Δ9-tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) among the BXD family of mice

finding: The SNP rs4415084 was associated with breast cancer and was identified as a genetic variant linked to causative cis-regulatory mechanisms. It was found to potentially affect transcription factor-DNA binding, thereby dysregulating gene expression relevant to tumorigenesis.
title: Transcription Factor-Centric Approach to Identify Non-Recurring Putative Regulatory Drivers in Cancer

finding: A significant association was established with the rs2227282 SNP located 6-bp upstream of the IL4 gene, which acted as a cis expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL). This SNP influenced transcript levels of multiple genes, including IL4, and was situated within a critical enhancer region reflecting its importance in immune regulation.
title: A Differentially Methylated CpG Site in the IL4 Gene Associated with Anti-FVIII Inhibitor Antibody Development in Hemophilia A

finding: COL4A3BP, found near rs2112347, was reported as a positive finding, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors influencing body mass index.
title: A multi-component screen for feeding behaviour and nutritional status in Drosophila to interrogate mammalian appetite-related genes

finding: The SNP rs1801020 was identified as a cis-pQTL affecting the expression of the coagulation factor XII (F12) gene. The study replicated this finding and showed that it modulated the levels of the F12 protein. Notably, one participant with this genotype exhibited significantly lower levels of F12 and experienced a delayed activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT), linking the SNP with potential clinical implications.
title: Facets of individual-specific health signatures determined from longitudinal plasma proteome profiling

finding: This SNP was associated with non-small cell lung cancer and benign prostatic hyperplasia via LD with various GWAS peak SNPs. It showed ASM, particularly in the context of cancer samples.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: Linked to GBM (glioblastoma multiforme) and other malignancies, this SNP was in LD with GWAS peaks for cancer and was associated with significant allele-specific methylation.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: This SNP was characterized as a splice donor variant in the AGXT2 gene, which was significant in the analysis of blood metabolite associations.
title: Genome-microbiome interplay provides insight into the determinants of the human blood metabolome

finding: The SNP rs28473516 was found to have a high posterior probability of being causal for both gene expression and isoform use for the gene B4GALT7. This indicates that the same genetic variant influences the expression of both the gene and its isoform, demonstrating the shared regulatory mechanisms underpinning cardiac gene expression.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: The SNP rs2549009 was linked with the gene IRF1 and its antisense RNA IRF1-AS1, suggesting a relationship in cardiac remodeling and hypertrophy, where IRF1 is related to cardiac variability, with rs2549009 shown to be in strong LD with another variant associated with diastolic blood pressure.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: The SNP rs7734334 was in high linkage disequilibrium with rs2549009 and associated with blood pressure, implying a significant interaction effect in cardiac remodeling pathways.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: The SNP rs2291702 located in the AGXT2 gene exhibited a significant cis-eQTL effect specifically in NAFLD patients. Individuals homozygous for the non-reference allele displayed decreased AGXT2 expression compared to their no-NAFLD counterparts, with a P-value of 4.79 × 10-6. This association persisted when adjusting for confounding factors such as BMI and HOMA-IR. The findings were replicated in an additional cohort, resulting in a combined P-value of 8.05 × 10-8, demonstrating the role of rs2291702 in modulating AGXT2 expression and its potential impact on NAFLD pathogenesis.
title: Disease-specific eQTL screening reveals an anti-fibrotic effect of AGXT2 in nonalcoholic fatty liver disease

finding: The SNP rs6897932, located in exon 6 of the interleukin-7 receptor-α gene (IL7R), was originally identified as being associated with increased susceptibility to multiple sclerosis (MS). It was found that the disease-associated allele strengthens an exonic splicing silencer, leading to the skipping of exon 6. This alternative splicing resulted in increased production of soluble IL7R (sIL7R), which elevated levels were shown to exacerbate the experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis (EAE) model, a murine model of MS. The mechanism was mediated through the impact of splicing on IL7R transcripts, establishing the importance of this SNP in MS pathogenesis.
title: The RNA helicase DDX39B activates FOXP3 RNA splicing to control T regulatory cell fate

finding: The SNP rs16891982 was associated with genetic heritage from non-European populations. It was used alongside rs1426654 to categorize samples expressing the chimeric RNA SUZ12P1-CRLF3, revealing a direct correlation with population designations in the GTEx cohort and 1000 Genomes Project.
title: Discovery of A Polymorphic Gene Fusion via Bottom-Up Chimeric RNA Prediction

finding: The SNP rs13164148 was associated with PD-L1 overexpression, indicating a mechanism that could contribute to immune evasion in melanoma. This finding was based on the study by Jancewicz et al. (2021), which highlighted transcriptomic changes in persistently activated CD4+ T cells.
title: Dynamical modelling of proliferative-invasive plasticity and IFNγ signaling in melanoma reveals mechanisms of PD-L1 expression heterogeneity

finding: The SNP rs13174250 was linked to constitutive PD-L1 expression in melanoma, as reported by Ahn et al. (2021). It was indicated that this was associated with dedifferentiation of melanoma cells, and activation of interferon and tumor necrosis factor signaling pathways.
title: Dynamical modelling of proliferative-invasive plasticity and IFNγ signaling in melanoma reveals mechanisms of PD-L1 expression heterogeneity

finding: The SNP rs467095 was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the TERT-CLPTM1L region. It was part of the oral cavity/pharyngeal cancer PRS and was inversely associated with lung cancer risk, indicating negative pleiotropy.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: Similar to rs467095, the SNP rs10462706 served as an eQTL within the TERT-CLPTM1L locus and was included in the oral cavity/pharyngeal cancer PRS. It was also inversely associated with lung cancer risk, contributing to negative pleiotropy between these cancer types.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs2735940 was associated with increased cervical cancer risk at a genome-wide significance level, confirming previous suggestive association reports and aligning with the findings for bladder cancer.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: SNP rs401681 was associated with increased cervical cancer risk, representing a significant finding given its involvement in the CLPTM1L region.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The variant rs114285050 was identified as a stop-gain variant in GPR151, and it significantly contributed to obesity-related traits including lower BMI, waist circumference, and body fat measures. It showed a finding of 0.324 kg/m² lower BMI than average, with a strong association (p = 4.13 x 10^-7). The analysis confirmed its role in adipocyte biology, highlighting the variant's relevance to the understanding of obesity.
title: Components of genetic associations across 2,138 phenotypes in the UK Biobank highlight novel adipocyte biology

finding: The SNP rs254372, located around 73.8 Mb on BTA1 within the OPA1 gene, was under selection in the Fescue Belt ecoregion and implicated in various adaptive traits, impacting metabolic and cardiac functions. This association pointed towards its role in adaptation, particularly in relation to fescue toxicosis symptoms linked to environmental pressures.
title: Powerful detection of polygenic selection and environmental adaptation in US beef cattle populations

finding: The eQTL analysis for rs6889822 indicated a connection with the expression of SPINK9, whose levels are greater in the brain compared to other tissues, thereby suggesting its involvement in mood-related pathways.
title: The genomic basis of mood instability: identification of 46 loci in 363,705 UK Biobank participants, genetic correlation with psychiatric disorders, and association with gene expression and function

finding: The rs13168867 variant in the OSMR locus was associated with increased overall plaque vulnerability, indicated by a beta coefficient of 0.118 with a p-value of 3.00×10^-3 for the C allele. Although not statistically significant after correction for multiple testing, it exhibited strong associations with intraplaque fat and collagen content, suggesting that reduced OSMR expression potentially contributes to a more vulnerable plaque phenotype by allowing an increase in lipid core size and a decrease in fibrosis.
title: Common variants associated with OSMR expression contribute to carotid plaque vulnerability, but not to cardiovascular disease in humans

finding: The SNP rs1042713 was noted to be associated with EHR-OSA in females from the VUMC dataset, beta = -0.07 (p = 2.71 x 10^-2), highlighting its significance in the context of OSA.
title: Characterization of Genetic and Phenotypic Heterogeneity of Obstructive Sleep Apnea Using Electronic Health Records

finding: Although this SNP was most strongly associated with pulse rate, its effect did not survive conventional GWAS corrections (P=7.2×10^-08). Nevertheless, by leveraging tissue-specific eQTL data, it was suggested that this SNP could represent a novel trait-associated locus. The strongest association was detected with the expression of <italic>SLC27A6</italic> derived from heart tissue (MR P=7.8×10^-07), potentially elucidating the causal pathway from the genetic variant to the phenotype.
title: A transcriptome-wide Mendelian randomization study to uncover tissue-dependent regulatory mechanisms across the human phenome

finding: The SNP rs61160187 located in the ELOVL7 region displayed a significant causal association with educational attainment (P_MR=1.05×10^-13). It was linked to ERCC8, a gene previously associated with Cockayne Syndrome A (OMIM#216400), thus indicating an important genetic connection with educational outcomes.
title: Mendelian Randomization integrating GWAS and eQTL data reveals genetic determinants of complex and clinical traits

finding: The SNP rs60311862 was identified as being cis-regulated in the human hippocampus, with a statistically significant p-value of 6.00E-6, indicating its connection to genetic regulation that affects cognitive function.
title: Systems genetics identifies the association between Enc1 and cognitive function in the hippocampus
