This SNP may relate to similar mechanisms in breast cancer, suggesting that variants like rs10040126 contribute to the complexity of drug resistance in tumor environments.
title: Single cell decoding of drug induced transcriptomic reprogramming in triple negative breast cancers

finding: The SNP rs10061788 was also identified as associated with EA. This SNP was linked to cerebral cortex and hippocampal mossy fiber morphology, indicating its potential role in neurological development. Its association provided insights into the genetic contributions to changes in alcohol consumption patterns as influenced by EA.
title: Educational attainment impacts drinking behaviors and risk for alcohol dependence: results from a two-sample Mendelian randomization study with ~780 000 participants

finding: DeepSNP rs163105 on chromosome 5 was found to alter the expression of SKIV2L2 in MDD, contributing to understanding the genetic basis of mood disorders.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs154001 was linked to height in humans and was identified as a missense change in the FGFR3 gene, leading to the same amino acid change in both humans and cattle. This variant was part of a group of 11 variants associated with a predicted 2.7 cm variation in human height, which corresponds to approximately one third of a standard deviation in the UK Biobank cohort.
title: The conservation of human functional variants and their effects across mammals

finding: The SNP rs4704864 was found to disrupt a JUN transcription factor binding site, resulting in decreased transcriptional activity of NIPAL4, a gene linked to autosomal recessive ichthyosis; thus, it may affect cutaneous barrier integrity.
title: Disease-Linked Regulatory DNA Variants and Homeostatic Transcription Factors in Epidermis

finding: Deduced from high LD with a previous significant SNP associated with diffusion measures, this SNP strengthened the association between genetic factors and white matter aging.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: Also in the VCAN gene, similarly linked to mode 3<sub>6</sub>, suggesting a consistent genetic influence on brain structure related to aging.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: The G allele in rs35407, a 3 Prime UTR Variant in SLC45A2, was associated with a higher risk of not knowing how many times someone was sunburned during childhood. Additionally, it increased the risk for melanoma and cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma, linking this SNP with both survey nonresponse behavior and health outcomes.
title: Patterns of item nonresponse behavior to survey questionnaires are systematic and have a genetic basis

finding: The SNP rs4958561 exhibited a novel relationship with morning person status, showing a positive correlation with Neanderthal LD profile (R = +0.91). It was determined to be an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) negatively regulating the gene NMUR2 in frontal cortex cells, suggestive that Neanderthal introgressed alleles influence morning person propensity through downregulating NMUR2.
title: Quantifying the contribution of Neanderthal introgression to the heritability of complex traits

finding: The rs2287987 SNP, identified as 349V, was noted to have a frequency in the AFR population which was about half of that of allotype 10. However, this SNP was primarily present in uncharacterized allotypes. The association with allotype 10 raised insights into its implications on immune response variability, particularly in connection with Behçet’s disease.
title: Common allotypes of ER aminopeptidase 1 have substrate-dependent and highly variable enzymatic properties

finding: The rs2549782 SNP, a missense coding SNP, affected ERAP2 activity and specificity. This SNP was detected in 44.7% of samples and its associated allotype demonstrated an ability to influence regulatory mechanisms of antigen processing in conjunction with ERAP1 allotypes.
title: Common allotypes of ER aminopeptidase 1 have substrate-dependent and highly variable enzymatic properties

finding: The rs2248374 SNP was significant as it contributed to lack of ERAP2 expression due to nonsense-mediated RNA decay. Around 54.3% of individuals exhibited allotype B associated with this SNP, which indicated no detectable ERAP2 protein under steady state conditions. This absence of ERAP2 protein expression correlated with specific ERAP1 combinations, illustrating its impact on overall aminopeptidase activity.
title: Common allotypes of ER aminopeptidase 1 have substrate-dependent and highly variable enzymatic properties

finding: This SNP was associated with tyrosine, showing a significant connection (P = 6.6 × 10^-9) in a sample of 5447 participants. It is a variant of the LINC02142 gene, which encodes a long intergenic non-coding RNA, potentially influencing dopamine metabolism and associated cognitive and behavioral traits.
title: Meta-Analysis of Urinary Metabolite GWAS Studies Identifies Three Novel Genome-Wide Significant Loci

finding: This SNP showed a significant association with 3-aminoisobutyrate (P = 6.9 × 10^-10, N = 4656). It is an intronic variant of the RAI14 gene, which is involved in cellular processes and may relate to metabolic regulation and risk for cardiometabolic diseases.
title: Meta-Analysis of Urinary Metabolite GWAS Studies Identifies Three Novel Genome-Wide Significant Loci

finding: The SNP rs10060194 was identified in the context of TGF-β signaling in T cell biology, which has significant implications for cancer immunotherapy. The finding highlighted how variations at this SNP could influence the immune response in T cells, thereby affecting the efficacy of cancer treatments that target TGF-β pathways.
title: FLOW: maximum flow framework for the identification of factors mediating the signaling convergence of multiple receptors

finding: The SNP rs10040118 was associated with the polyaneuploid cancer cell (PACC) state in the context of therapy resistance and disease recurrence in prostate cancer. It was highlighted in the literature as having roles in the characteristics of polyploid/multinucleated giant cancer cells, which were shown to contribute to more aggressive metastasis and relapse following anticancer treatment.
title: Nuclear morphology and functional characteristics that enable survival of cells in the polyaneuploid cancer cell state following cytotoxic chemotherapy

finding: The SNP rs78191176 was identified as a causal variant with a high causal probability (PP=0.87) associated with COVID-19 severity. It enriched regulatory signals specifically in trait-relevant cell states within CD14+ monocytes, highlighting a selective role for this variant in modulating disease responses related to COVID-19. Furthermore, it was noted to overlap a regulatory region in cells enriched for the COVID-19 risk variant, indicating a significant functional impact of this genetic variant.
title: Variant to function mapping at single-cell resolution through network propagation

finding: Almeida et al. (2021) showcased the use of UAV photogrammetry for individual tree detection and qualitative inventory in eucalyptus stands, providing insights into the applicability of aerial imaging technologies in forest management.
title: Accurate tropical forest individual tree crown delineation from RGB imagery using Mask R-CNN

finding: The SNP rs13184510 was identified as an important genetic marker in the study of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC). The findings revealed that low levels of NSD2, which is influenced by this SNP, were linked to aggressive features of PDAC. The research demonstrated that NSD2 served as a putative tumor suppressor, and the presence of this SNP affected NSD2's ability to restrain inflammation and Kras-induced tumors, highlighting its role in the context of pancreatic tumorigenesis.
title: Multilevel regulation of NF-κB signaling by NSD2 suppresses Kras-driven pancreatic tumorigenesis

finding: The CD-risk allele rs2188962 was mentioned as having increased in frequency over time, relating to inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) risks.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: The SNP rs6897932 (C/T) within the IL7R gene was shown to be strongly associated with increased risk for multiple sclerosis (MS). The risk ‘C’ allele was found to enhance the exclusion of exon 6 from IL7R transcripts, thereby increasing the expression of the soluble isoform of IL7R (sIL7R). This increased sIL7R potentiated T cell activity, contributing to greater disability in the Experimental Autoimmune Encephalomyelitis (EAE) model of MS. Subsequent studies validated this finding by demonstrating a dose-dependent relationship: homozygous ‘CC’ individuals had the highest sIL7R levels and exon 6 exclusion, while homozygous ‘TT’ individuals displayed the lowest. Additionally, an epistatic interaction between rs6897932 and another SNP, rs2523506 near the DDX39B gene, was reported to further increase the MS risk and sIL7R levels.
title: Antisense modulation of IL7R splicing to control sIL7R expression in human CD4+ T cells

finding: The study indicated that the SNP rs2291418 is associated with the maturation of pre-miRNA-1229. Specifically, this variant, which is implicated in Alzheimer's disease, was linked to the characterization of a G-quadruplex structure in pre-miRNA-1229, suggesting that it could affect miRNA maturation processes. The findings highlighted the significant role of this SNP in relation to miRNA biology, which is pertinent in the context of disease mechanisms.
title: The Apurinic/Apyrimidinic Endodeoxyribonuclease 1 is an RNA G-quadruplex binding protein and regulates miR-92b expression in cancer cells

finding: The study reported that the SNP rs1064793022 was identified as a pathogenic intronic splice variant in the APC gene, which is notable for its involvement in colorectal cancer (CRC) pathogenesis.
title: Utilizing a dual endogenous reporter system to identify functional regulators of aberrant stem cell and differentiation activity in colorectal cancer

finding: The SNP rs4307059 was strongly associated with ASD based on multiple genome-wide association studies (GWAS). It was located in the intergenic region between CDH10 and CDH9; however, the genotype of this SNP did not correlate with the expression levels of either CDH gene in adult brains. This raises questions regarding its functional role, indicating that alterations in a nearby noncoding RNA might be responsible for the ASD connection rather than CDH9 or CDH10 itself.
title: Identification of CDH11 as an ASD risk gene by matched-gene co-expression analysis and mouse behavioral studies

finding: The SNP rs702634 revealed a T2D GWAS signal, colocalized with an FAP-specific caQTL. This SNP was associated with high chromatin contact frequency in the FST gene, indicating its potential role in muscle growth and insulin resistance.
title: Population-scale skeletal muscle single-nucleus multi-omic profiling reveals extensive context specific genetic regulation

finding: The SNP rs16901246 was also associated with the family Barnesiellaceae in the replication sample. This SNP demonstrated a consistent causal effect direction with the discovery sample, having a beta coefficient of -7.34×10⁻³ and a p-value of 0.03, indicating strong evidence of its association with TFM. It is located in the intron region of the CTNND2 gene on chromosome 5.
title: Mendelian randomization analysis revealed causal effects from gut microbiota to abdominal obesity

finding: The SNP rs16891982 at the SLC45A2 locus exhibited the strongest evidence of selection across multiple analyses. However, the evidence did not imply positive selection throughout the entire time period studied.
title: The evolution of skin pigmentation associated variation in West Eurasia

finding: This SNP caused a missense mutation leading to a substitution of isoleucine (I) to threonine (T) in the FOXI1 transcription factor. It was identified as one of the independent contributors to transferrin glycosylation.
title: Same role but different actors: genetic regulation of post-translational modification of two distinct proteins

finding: In a study including 520 patients and 1204 healthy controls, researchers found that the frequencies of the rs2910164 CC genotype and the C allele of miR-146a were significantly decreased in patients with pediatric uveitis compared to healthy controls. This suggested that miR-146a might be a susceptibility factor for developing pediatric uveitis.
title: Exploring MicroRNA Signatures in Pediatric Non-infectious Uveitis: Meta-Analysis and Molecular Profiling of Patient Samples

finding: The SNP rs6295 was associated with the functional serotonin 1A receptor promoter polymorphism. This association related to psychiatric illness and variations in transcription levels. The findings indicated that this SNP might be significant in understanding vulnerabilities, particularly in the context of Early Life Adversity (ELA) and its neurobiological impacts.
title: Sex-specific and Developmental Effects of Early Life Adversity on Stress Reactivity are Rescued by Postnatal Knockdown of 5-HT1A Autoreceptors

finding: The intergenic variant rs549656827 was identified in the GWAS for any psychotic experience, showing an odds ratio (OR=0.61) and significant p-value (p=3.30×10^-8). This association highlighted a possible correlation with psychotic experiences in the studied population.
title: Genetic association study of psychotic experiences in UK Biobank

finding: SNP rs2861139 in an intergenic region was associated with Lifetime Anxiety Disorder with a p-value of 2.6×10−9, contributing to the understanding of genetic influences on anxiety disorders.
title: A Major Role for Common Genetic Variation in Anxiety Disorders

finding: The SNP rs7723509 was found in an intergenic region on chromosome 5 and was significantly associated with Lifetime Anxiety Disorder in the meta-analysis, emphasizing the importance of non-coding regions in the genetic architecture of anxiety.
title: A Major Role for Common Genetic Variation in Anxiety Disorders

finding: The rs28777 variant located in the SLC45A2 gene was associated with average SpO2 levels in European ancestry individuals, achieving a combined p-value of 8.08 × 10^-10. This finding indicated SLC45A2's relevance in traits related to oxygen saturation, emphasizing its potential role in sleep-disordered breathing.
title: Whole-Genome Association Analyses of Sleep-disordered Breathing Phenotypes in the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: The SNP rs190982 was linked to the MEF2C gene, which showed significant association with ADHD risk in both the discovery phase using the PGC meta-analytic data (n=19,210) and in the replication phase (n=37,076). Functional characterization in Drosophila indicated that the knockdown of dMEF2 led to increased locomotor activity, which was consistent with ADHD-related behaviors in humans.
title: Intellectual Disability-related genes increase ADHD risk and locomotor activity in Drosophila

finding: The study reported that a germline mutation in FGFR4, specifically rs351855, was associated with enhanced STAT3 signalling. This enhancement was linked to promoted immune evasion in transgenic knock-in models of lung and breast cancers. Given the interaction between FGFR4 and HIP1, and the findings that HIP1 overexpression enhances STAT3 signalling, this suggests that rs351855 could play a significant role in the context of immune evasion in cancer.
title: HIP1 mediates oncogenic transformation and cancer progression through STAT3 signalling

finding: The SNP rs2736100 within the TERT gene was linked to 16 unique traits, including multiple cancers and blood cell counts. It was also associated with the epigenetic biomarker IEAA in the current study.
title: Genome-wide association studies identify 137 loci for DNA methylation biomarkers of ageing

finding: The SNP ANKRD31-rs4704171 was identified as a new genome-wide significant finding in the context of Alzheimer's Disease (AD) through a meta-analysis of the GR@ACE study combined with additional genomic databases, with an odds ratio of 1.19 and a p-value of 2.78 x 10^-8. It was associated with late-onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD).
title: Genome-wide association analysis of dementia and its clinical endophenotypes reveal novel loci associated with Alzheimer’s disease and three causality networks of AD: the GR@ACE project

finding: The SNP rs10060180 was found to be associated with high expression of the KIAA0100 gene in breast cancer tumors, which is implicated in breast-cancer aggressiveness. This finding indicates a potential role of this SNP in modulating cancer cell behavior through KIAA0100, aligning with previously reported behaviors in cancer studies.
title: Profile of the somatic mutational landscape in breast tumors from Hispanic/Latina women

finding: SNP rs200056603 was identified as a tag SNP for HsInv0201 and was involved in global selection tests across populations, indicating its relevance in human genetic diversity.
title: Functional and evolutionary impact of polymorphic inversions in the human genome

finding: Berninger et al. (2018) demonstrated that SAR-based estimation provided reliable above-ground biomass estimates and changes in tropical forests, reinforcing the effectiveness of SAR data in biomass predictions.
title: Using hypertemporal Sentinel-1 data to predict forest growing stock volume

finding: Schlund and Davidson (2018) explored above-ground forest biomass estimation through combined L- and P-band SAR acquisitions, contributing to the understanding of biomass dynamics.
title: Using hypertemporal Sentinel-1 data to predict forest growing stock volume

finding: The study identified that rs10060157 was associated with improved response to therapy in non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC) patients treated with targeted therapies. Specifically, the SNP was linked to the modulation of ERK1/2 signaling, which is known to influence the resistance mechanisms in cancer treatment. The findings emphasized the importance of this SNP as a biomarker for predicting the efficacy of compounds like Laxiflorin B that target the ERK pathway.
title: A Novel Selective ERK1/2 Inhibitor, Laxiflorin B, Targets EGFR Mutation Subtypes in Non-small-cell Lung Cancer

finding: The SNP rs13175330 was identified as a polymorphism in the peptidylglycine α-amidating monooxygenase (PAM) gene. It was associated with hypertension in a Korean population, indicating a potential link between PAM genetic variability and the regulation of blood pressure.
title: A Single Membrane Protein Required for Atrial Secretory Granule Formation

finding: The SNP rs494958 was associated with age at natural menopause. In the context of the studied reproductive function, it was located within a genomic region that was significantly more methylated in the ovaries of DSS-treated mice compared to control groups. This methylation was correlated with levels of gene expression, suggesting a potential mechanistic link between this SNP and reproductive lifespan through epigenetic regulation of the gene Srd5a1.
title: Early-life environment programs reproductive strategies through epigenetic regulation of SRD5A1

finding: rs12658032 demonstrated a strong association with both ADHD and MDD, with a meta-analysis p-value of 1.54x10^-16. This SNP was mapped to chromosome 5q21.2, in a region lacking protein-coding annotations and brain eQTL evidence. It was also associated with depressive symptoms and bipolar disorder, indicating a potential involvement in related mental health traits.
title: Investigating regions of shared genetic variation in attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder and major depressive disorder: A GWAS meta-analysis

finding: Identified as a candidate variant regulating SNHG18, it showed a marked reduction in expression levels when targeted in the CRISPRi experiments.
title: Comprehensive identification of coronary artery disease-associated variants regulating vascular smooth muscle cell gene expression

finding: The SNP rs2194025 was significantly linked to arteriolar calibre and showed strong linkage disequilibrium with rs73171800. This connection highlighted its relevance in the vascular phenotype associated with MacTel.
title: Genetic Disruption of Serine Biosynthesis is a Key Driver of Macular Telangiectasia Type 2 Etiology and Progression

finding: SNP rs17421627 bore significant association with increased macular thickness and was in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs73171800. It was posited to influence retinal vascular formation through enhancer activity impacting miRNA expression.
title: Genetic Disruption of Serine Biosynthesis is a Key Driver of Macular Telangiectasia Type 2 Etiology and Progression

finding: The rs77010315 variant, a missense variant in the SLC36A2 gene, was found to increase transport of alanine into cells, resulting in decreased blood levels of alanine but increased isoleucine levels. This was due to enhanced intracellular conversion of alanine to pyruvate and glutamate.
title: Integrative analysis of metabolite GWAS illuminates the molecular basis of pleiotropy and genetic correlation

finding: The variant rs6453393 was identified as the top cis-eQTL for SCAMP1, a gene linked to cytokine secretion and vesicular trafficking, demonstrating a strong genetic effect unique to CD14+ monocytes in COVID-19 patients, underscoring its relevance in the immune response to SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Widespread gene-environment interactions shape the immune response to SARS-CoV-2 infection in hospitalized COVID-19 patients

finding: This SNP contributed to new insights regarding the role of LMP1 in nasopharyngeal carcinoma, indicating its relevance in B-cell metabolic pathways and susceptibility to growth arrest in EBV-infected cells.
title: Epstein-Barr Virus Latent Membrane Protein 1 Subverts IMPDH pathways to drive B-cell oncometabolism

finding: The SNP rs2445874 was one of the fine-mapped variants showing significant associations with white matter microstructural differences, supporting its relevance in the genetic control of brain-related traits.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: The genetic variant rs3852188 was identified as part of the frequently fine-mapped variants associated with white matter traits, suggesting it plays a role in the genetic underpinnings of psychological and neurological disorders.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: The SNP rs3931702 was noted for its frequent association with DTI parameters, indicating its involvement in the genetics of white matter and related phenotypes.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: The variant rs7733216 was frequently linked to DTI parameters representing white matter structure, reflecting its potential importance in understanding the genetic factors of brain disorders.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: In TENT2, rs6896893 was predicted by SpliceAI to negatively influence pseudoexon inclusion, with testing showing that LCLs heterozygous for this SNP exhibited a higher proportion of canonical transcript following branaplam treatment.
title: PMS1 as a target for splice modulation to prevent somatic CAG repeat expansion in Huntington’s disease

finding: The polymorphism rs4263535 located in the intron 4 of the GABRA1 gene was associated with deeper sedation during treatment with intravenous midazolam. This finding suggested a significant role of GABRA1 in modulating the sedative response, which is particularly relevant in the context of its function in controlling inhibitory impulses in the nervous system.
title: Characterization of the zebrafish gabra1sa43718/sa43718 germline loss of function allele confirms a function for Gabra1 in motility and nervous system development

finding: The SNP rs2549003, located on chromosome 5, was identified as a male-specific locus associated with asthma in the meta-analysis, with an overall P-value of 2.0×10-14. This finding illustrated the significant gene-sex interaction in asthma susceptibility.
title: Large-scale Genetic Analysis Identifies 66 Novel Loci for Asthma

finding: The rs3749615 SNP was identified in peaks unique to developmental epithelial cell clusters. It was also predicted to create repressor binding sites, suggesting its involvement in regulatory mechanisms relevant to the pathogenesis of Barrett's oesophagus.
title: The metaplastic precursor state to oesophageal adenocarcinoma represents reversion to a transient epithelial cell state in the developing oesophagus

finding: The SNP rs11745375, associated with FGF18, exhibited a significant association with FEV1/FVC (p=1.6×10^-11). This finding underscored the importance of genetic variants in the pathways linked to lung function.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs10040093 was positively associated with cancer, particularly in relation to CD30-positive lymphomas, as described in the study by Garces de Los Fayos Alonso et al. (2018). This finding related to how mutations in pathways linked to the Activator Protein-1 (AP-1) family contributed to oncogenic processes. It supported the broader context of studies on neurodevelopmental disorders (NDDs) indicating that individuals with disorders such as autism spectrum disorder could have elevated risks for cancers, as the commonality in molecular pathways between NDDs and cancer was explored.
title: Neurodevelopmental disorders and cancer networks share pathways; but differ in mechanisms, signaling strength, and outcome

finding: Identified as the second most associated variant for increased MPN risk (p = 9.60 × 10^-41) and also linked to increased telomere length, establishing its dual significance in both hematopoietic traits.
title: Genetic predisposition to myeloproliferative neoplasms implicates hematopoietic stem cell biology

finding: The SNP rs4957144, found within the first intron of the C7 gene, showed a significant association with MSA and IBD in the conjFDR analysis, evidenced by a conjFDR of 0.0237. Its high CADD score of 14.2 indicated a potential deleterious effect, implicating it in the shared genetic mechanisms between the diseases.
title: A genome-wide genetic pleiotropy approach identified shared loci between multiple system atrophy and inflammatory bowel disease

finding: SNP rs40401 in the IL3 locus was found marginally associated with both malaria attacks and infections, showing p-values of 0.01 and 0.02 respectively.
title: First genome-wide association study of non-severe malaria in two birth cohorts in Benin

finding: This SNP demonstrated a suggestive association with the IL3 locus, evidenced by min-p values of 8.89×10-5 for RMM and 1.66×10-4 for RMI.
title: First genome-wide association study of non-severe malaria in two birth cohorts in Benin

finding: Fourteen individuals carried only the rs16891982-C allele, which was associated with dark hair and increased skin pigmentation. Three had both the C and G alleles.
title: Neolithic genomes reveal a distinct ancient HLA allele pool and population transformation in Europe

finding: The SNP rs6450176 was found to be positively associated with serum lipid levels in the Jing and Han populations. This association suggests that the genetic variation at this locus, specifically the ARL15 gene, may influence lipid metabolism, potentially impacting conditions such as dyslipidemia.
title: Arl15 upregulates the TGFβ family signaling by promoting the assembly of the Smad-complex

finding: Identified as a variant related to broadly defined depression, this SNP contributed to the understanding of mood-related psychopathology.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: The PAM gene rs13175330 A>G polymorphism was associated with hypertension in a Korean population, highlighting its potential role in cardiovascular health.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The Drosha rs10719 T>C polymorphism was found to have associations with preeclampsia susceptibility in related studies.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: As an infection eQTL, rs72773986 was associated with ERAP2, a gene involved in the immune response. The Neanderthal allele was predicted to disrupt binding of EPAS1, a transcription factor involved in hypoxia response.
title: A signature of Neanderthal introgression on molecular mechanisms of environmental responses

finding: The SNP rs12654264 had been associated with elevated levels of total cholesterol and LDL cholesterol as well as an increased risk for dyslipidemia, stroke, blood pressure, and coronary heart disease, highlighting its importance in cholesterol regulation.
title: MicroRNA-27a mitigates hyperlipidemia and atherosclerosis by modulating cholesterol homeostasis

finding: rs3846662 was linked to changes in total cholesterol and LDL cholesterol levels, and it was noted for its association with various cardiovascular risk factors, indicating its potential impact in clinical settings.
title: MicroRNA-27a mitigates hyperlipidemia and atherosclerosis by modulating cholesterol homeostasis

finding: Associations of rs7703051 with cholesterol levels and cardiovascular disease risks were reported, emphasizing it as a relevant SNP in the context of hyperlipidemia.
title: MicroRNA-27a mitigates hyperlipidemia and atherosclerosis by modulating cholesterol homeostasis

finding: The SNP rs5908 was found to correlate with total cholesterol and LDL cholesterol levels, marking it as a significant variant in studies of lipid metabolism.
title: MicroRNA-27a mitigates hyperlipidemia and atherosclerosis by modulating cholesterol homeostasis

finding: Evidence suggested that rs12916 affects the level of total cholesterol and could be associated with increased cardiovascular risk, underlining its relevance in lipid profile management.
title: MicroRNA-27a mitigates hyperlipidemia and atherosclerosis by modulating cholesterol homeostasis

finding: The SNP rs17238540 was correlated with variations in total and LDL cholesterol levels, reinforcing its association with cardiovascular disease risk.
title: MicroRNA-27a mitigates hyperlipidemia and atherosclerosis by modulating cholesterol homeostasis

finding: Findings indicated that rs3846663 had associations with cholesterol-related pathways and cardiovascular disease, validating its role as a genetic risk factor.
title: MicroRNA-27a mitigates hyperlipidemia and atherosclerosis by modulating cholesterol homeostasis

finding: The intronic SNP rs17244841, together with others, contributed to a haplotype that was less sensitive to the effects of cholesterol-lowering statins, highlighting its significance in pharmacogenomics related to HMGCR.
title: MicroRNA-27a mitigates hyperlipidemia and atherosclerosis by modulating cholesterol homeostasis

finding: The variant rs373863828 was originally identified in association with higher body mass index (BMI) and was later hypothesized to also impact height. The study provided strong evidence of a significant association between this missense mutation in the CREBRF gene and greater mean height in Samoan adults, estimating an increase of 0.77 cm in average height for each copy of the minor A allele. This association was similarly observed in Samoan children, demonstrating a consistent direction of effect across both age groups. Additionally, in a New Zealand population, an association with height was reaffirmed, further suggesting the variant's influence on body stature.
title: A missense variant in CREBRF is associated with taller stature in Samoans

finding: The rs114285050 variant was identified as a loss-of-function mutation in the GPR151 gene, and had a low allele frequency of 0.8% in European ancestry. It was associated with a reduced body mass index (BMI) and lower risk of type 2 diabetes (T2D), findings that were supported by larger independent genome-wide association studies (GWAS). Further associations indicated that this loss-of-function variant contributed to an improved lipid profile characterized by reduced triglycerides and increased HDL cholesterol, and was also linked to decreased waist-hip ratio adjusted for BMI (WHRadjBMI). Moreover, there were indications that carriers of the variant exhibited improved glycemic traits, such as nominal reductions in fasting glucose and fasting insulin. Thus, the presence of the GPR151 loss-of-function variant was strongly correlated with enhanced metabolic health.
title: G protein-coupled receptor 151 regulates glucose metabolism and hepatic gluconeogenesis

finding: The variant rs2563323 was identified as a putative eQTL for SRA1 in the hippocampus, suggesting its role in regulating this noncoding RNA that activates nuclear receptors.
title: Sex significantly impacts the function of major depression-linked variants in vivo

finding: Similar to rs2563323, rs250427 was also highlighted as a putative eQTL for SRA1, reinforcing the functional implications of these genetic variants in depression risk.
title: Sex significantly impacts the function of major depression-linked variants in vivo

finding: This SNP was found to have functional implications within the male hippocampus, contributing to the genetic framework relevant to MDD.
title: Sex significantly impacts the function of major depression-linked variants in vivo

finding: Associated with significant findings for MDD, rs1345818 demonstrated sex-dependent regulatory activity through close variants in linkage disequilibrium.
title: Sex significantly impacts the function of major depression-linked variants in vivo

finding: This SNP exhibited significant sex-interacting effects in the hippocampus, affirming its role in the genetic landscape of major depressive disorder.
title: Sex significantly impacts the function of major depression-linked variants in vivo

finding: Identified with hippocampal sex-interacting effects, rs5869417 was further implicated in the context of MDD-associated genetic regulation.
title: Sex significantly impacts the function of major depression-linked variants in vivo

finding: This variant was recognized for its sex-interacting role in Vglut1+ cells, solidifying its contribution to the understanding of genetic factors in MDD.
title: Sex significantly impacts the function of major depression-linked variants in vivo

finding: The SNP rs185531658 on chromosome 5 reached genome-wide significance across all congenital heart disease (CHD) phenotypes with an odds ratio of 2.16 (p=5.28×10−9) and was also indicative for septal defects with the same odds ratio and a stronger p-value (p=6.15×10−8).
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The SNP rs146300195 on chromosome 5 at the SLC27A6 locus achieved genome-wide significance in a subgroup of patients with left heart lesions.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The SNP rs13153676 was implicated in targeted alpha-particle radiotherapy and immune checkpoint inhibitors, potentially influencing tumor growth inhibition in malignant melanoma. Its correlation with treatment responses was established, highlighting its significance in the context of cancer therapies involving alpha-emitter-based treatments.
title: Pre-clinical Evaluation of Biomarkers for Early Detection of Nephrotoxicity Following Alpha-particle Radioligand Therapy

finding: The SNP rs13184507 was associated with the progression of cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (CSCC), particularly in relation to the role of p53, as indicated by the study referenced. This finding highlighted the potential impact of this SNP on tumor behavior and the effectiveness of immunotherapeutic strategies targeting p53 pathways.
title: Generating specific homologous neutralizing-antibodies: a novel therapeutic strategy in cancer treatment

finding: This SNP related to the p53 tumor suppressor pathway was identified as a vital component in the context of human oncoviruses and their regulation. The findings indicated that alterations in the p53 pathway could contribute to tumorigenesis in the presence of gammaherpesviruses, providing insight into intrinsic cellular defense mechanisms that limit viral colonization.
title: Intrinsic p53 Activation Restricts Gammaherpesvirus-Driven Germinal Center B Cell Expansion during Latency Establishment

finding: This SNP was connected to the relationship between p53 and viral infections. The study noted that p53 serves as a regulatory response to viral manipulations, which include gammaherpesvirus-induced B cell proliferation and differentiation. This highlights the significance of p53 in modulating cellular responses to viral infections, possibly leading to cancer development.
title: Intrinsic p53 Activation Restricts Gammaherpesvirus-Driven Germinal Center B Cell Expansion during Latency Establishment

finding: The splicing variant rs10069690 located in TERT resulted in a truncated protein INS1b and was noted for its effects on telomerase activity and increased DNA damage response, which are relevant to breast cancer pathology.
title: Fine-mapping of 150 breast cancer risk regions identifies 178 high confidence target genes

finding: The SNP rs16891982, which is located in SLC45A2, was found to significantly interact with rs12913832 in shaping eye color traits. This interaction highlighted the coordinated allelic differences among populations regarding pigmentation traits, underlining its importance in addressing complex genetic networks.
title: Detection of complex genetic architecture using two-locus population differentiation: modeling epistasis

finding: rs13153844 was identified for the first time in this study as being significantly associated with F1, near the gene PSMC1P5, suggesting its role in mood disturbances.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: The SNP rs1551765 represented a novel finding linked to the gene GRIA1, emphasizing its potential importance in psychiatric conditions.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: The SNP rs10078588, associated with the gene TENM2, showed significant links to food and liquid intake, including alcohol, as well as associations with trunk fat percent and smoking. This finding was derived from a Phewas analysis indicating the role of this SNP in dietary habits and body composition.
title: Evidence for Involvement of WDPCP Gene in Alcohol Consumption, Lipid Metabolism, and Liver Cirrhosis

finding: The SNP rs10070239 was associated with prostate cancer progression and found to be involved in S100A4-dependent and independent mechanisms, according to the study by Ruma et al. published in 2018. This study highlighted that Embigin, influenced by this SNP, plays a role in cancer advancement.
title: Dual role of CASP8AP2/FLASH in regulating epithelial-to-mesenchymal (EMT) plasticity

finding: The SNP rs35278 displayed a replicable association with familial schizophrenia in a large cohort (p=0.0012; OR=1.18, 95% CI 1.06-1.32). It was found to associate significantly with bipolar disorder, particularly within liability class 2 (LC2), showing associations of p=0.032 and OR=1.27. This SNP is located at a transcription factor binding site and was part of a haplotype that demonstrated over-representation in affected individuals.
title: Variants in regulatory elements of PDE4D associate with Major Mental Illness in the Finnish population

finding: The SNP rs165940 exhibited a strong replicable association with schizophrenia (p=0.0016; OR=1.27, 95% CI 1.13-1.41) and was identified as significantly correlating with the mRNA expression levels of PDE4D in the cerebellum (p-value=0.04; m-value=0.9). It further showed associations with psychosis (p=0.025, OR=1.18) and cognitive deficits, particularly verbal learning and memory (p=0.0091, beta=-0.044) and verbal working memory (p=0.0062, beta=-0.036). Thus, it was presented as the most likely functional variant at the PDE4D locus.
title: Variants in regulatory elements of PDE4D associate with Major Mental Illness in the Finnish population

finding: The SNP rs1120303 was reported to have a replicable association with schizophrenia, with a significance level of p=0.021. This implies its potential role in the genetic architecture of the disorder.
title: Variants in regulatory elements of PDE4D associate with Major Mental Illness in the Finnish population

finding: This SNP was significantly correlated with body height and associated with the gene SOHLH2, which is involved in reproductive processes.
title: pCMLM: Genome Wide Association Study of Body Size Traits in Multiple Regions of Yak Based on the Provided Compressed Mixed Linear Model

finding: This breast cancer-associated SNP is located within a proximal insulator classified by CoRE-BED. It showed enrichment of regulatory signals, including CTCF and RAD21, suggesting its role in the genomic regulation linked to breast cancer.
title: Minimum entropy framework identifies a novel class of genomic functional elements and reveals regulatory mechanisms at human disease loci

finding: The SNP rs10050691 was identified as being crucial in the implementation of the LandTrendr algorithm, which aided in the analysis of land use changes. This was significant for tracking alterations in land cover related to deforestation, specifically for rubber plantations, leading to a reassessment of environmental implications as discussed in the work of Kennedy et al. (2018).
title: New high-resolution maps show that rubber causes significant deforestation

finding: The missense variant rs27895 in the ERAP1 gene was associated with influenza A virus (IAV) burden in both cells and human volunteers. Specifically, the T allele (which causes a G346D substitution) was linked to higher IAV burden and more severe symptoms during a human IAV challenge study. This SNP showed substantial population differentiation, with the T allele found at a higher frequency in African populations, potentially contributing to increased susceptibility to IAV infection.
title: Single-cell genome-wide association reveals a nonsynonymous variant in ERAP1 confers increased susceptibility to influenza virus

finding: The variant Gln27Glu (rs1042714) in the ADRB2 gene, when analyzed in isolation, did not show a significant impact on BMI. Nonetheless, it exhibited significant synergistic interaction with the LEPR variant Gln223Arg (rs1137101) for BMI (beta = 0.04; P value = 0.013). The interaction was most impactful in individuals with BMI > 25, where the effect size further increased to beta = 0.047 (P value = 0.0056), suggesting a relevant association with obesity risk.
title: The perineurium integrates leptin with its sympathetic outflow to protect against obesity

finding: The SNP rs4150211, associated with the HBEGF gene, was the strongest locus for mean thickness, showing a beta of -0.05 (EAF: 0.265, p = 8.20 × 10^-18).
title: The Genetic Architecture of the Human Corpus Callosum and its Subregions

finding: The SNP rs13174255 was associated with the presence of microglia-like cells termed MECC in glioblastoma tissues, which were noted to express p16^INK4A and linked to worse patient prognosis. This association suggested a role for this SNP in influencing immune regulation within the tumor microenvironment, potentially impacting therapeutic outcomes.
title: Transcriptional profiling reveals a previously unknown population of Cdkn2a-positive tumor-associated macrophages in aggressive brain cancer

finding: The SNP rs10060182 was associated with breast cancer susceptibility, as reported in the study by Shupp et al. (2018). This finding highlighted its potential role in influencing the occurrence of breast cancer, particularly in relation to cancer-related deaths and the complexity of metastasis.
title: Live Cell Lineage Tracing of Dormant Cancer Cells

finding: The SNP rs530936609 was identified as part of the Fibrillin-2 gene (FBN2), which was associated primarily with aortic arch 3D structures. This finding contributed to understanding the genetic basis of aortic geometric phenotypes (AGPs) and was particularly relevant in the context of cardiovascular diseases (CVD) and coronary artery disease.
title: Three-dimensional aortic geometry: clinical correlates, prognostic value and genetic architecture

finding: The SNP rs73346354, also linked to the Fibrillin-2 gene (FBN2), was found to overlap with enhancer histone modification tracks. This SNP was identified in relation to the structure of the aortic arch and had implications for cardiovascular health, including associations with CVD and responses to calcium-channel blockers and beta-blockers.
title: Three-dimensional aortic geometry: clinical correlates, prognostic value and genetic architecture

finding: The research by Reiche et al. (2018b) highlighted SNP rs10050777 in characterizing tropical forest cover loss through dense Sentinel-1 data, corroborating its effectiveness as a marker for detecting changes in forest cover.
title: Detecting tropical selective logging with SAR data requires a time series approach

finding: The study found that hypertensive individuals under 51 years carrying the ERAP1 rs30187 risk allele exhibited increased salt sensitivity of blood pressure (SSBP). Specifically, carriers showed a 16 mmHg increase in SSBP compared to 9 mmHg in non-carrier males and 15.8 mmHg in carrier females compared to 8.4 mmHg in non-carrier females, indicating that the influence of this SNP on BP regulation was significant and aligned with animal model findings.
title: ERAP1 Shows Distinct Regulatory Mechanisms on Blood Pressure Modulation Between Males and Females

finding: The SNP rs74567345 was associated with subcutaneous adipose tissue regulation, leading to increased abdominal fat accumulation while simultaneously decreasing the risk for type 2 diabetes. Genes such as GIN1, PPIP5K2, and PAM were predicted to be influenced by this genetic association.
title: Predicting mechanisms of action at genetic loci associated with discordant effects on type 2 diabetes and abdominal fat accumulation

finding: This SNP was tied to expression changes in SETD9 and showed pleiotropic effects across multiple cancer types.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: The study referenced the SNP rs13164001 in the context of tunneling nanotubes (TNTs) demonstrating novel insights regarding their functionality in embryos, specifically in zebrafish. The positive finding was linked to the potential implications of TNTs in cellular communication and transport mechanisms, particularly their ability to transfer cargoes, which could relate to work on glioblastoma treatment as discussed in the publication by Taiarol et al. in 2021.
title: Tunneling nanotubes enable intercellular transfer in zebrafish embryos

finding: The sentinel SNP rs17421627 was associated with an intergenic region at 5q14.3, which had correlations with macular thickness, retinal vascular caliber, and age-related macular degeneration (AMD). The analysis demonstrated that this SNP intersected an enhancer whose activity was notably decreased by the presence of the risk allele. The enhancer's DNA accessibility was conserved between the human retina and retinal organoids, primarily showing accessibility in retinal progenitor cells and Müller glia, which are relevant to the pathology of MacTel.
title: Multi-omic Analysis of Developing Human Retina and Organoids Reveals Cell-Specific Cis-Regulatory Elements and Mechanisms of Non-Coding Genetic Disease Risk

finding: The SNP rs13164242 was associated with the transcriptional control exerted by YAP/TAZ as discussed in its influence on tumorigenesis, particularly in various cancer types, highlighting its significance as a potential therapeutic target.
title: Structure-based discovery of a novel small-molecule inhibitor of TEAD palmitoylation with anticancer activity

finding: The SNP rs3805683 showed a highly significant association with inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD), with an association signal of 2.267e-23. As indicated in the findings, this SNP also overlapped with other anchors in GM12878 cells, reinforcing its importance in the context of distal CRE activities and their influence on IBD.
title: GTAGMe-seq: joint profiling of genetic variants, DNA methylation, GpC methyltransferase footprints, and 3D genome in the same DNA molecules

finding: As the tag SNP for haplotype 5AM1, rs701383 was associated with hastened onset of HD and increased MSH3 expression, and it significantly deviated from Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium, indicating an association with increased somatic CAG expansion.
title: Huntington’s disease onset is determined by length of uninterrupted CAG, not encoded polyglutamine, and is modified by DNA maintenance mechanisms

finding: Located within an intron of TCERG1, this SNP was associated with delayed onset of HD and prompted further study of this locus.
title: Huntington’s disease onset is determined by length of uninterrupted CAG, not encoded polyglutamine, and is modified by DNA maintenance mechanisms

finding: This SNP was linked to haplotype 5AM3, associated with onset-delaying effects.
title: Huntington’s disease onset is determined by length of uninterrupted CAG, not encoded polyglutamine, and is modified by DNA maintenance mechanisms

finding: The study identified the rs6190 SNP, a coding single nucleotide polymorphism in the glucocorticoid receptor gene, as significantly associated with increased cholesterol levels in women from the UK Biobank and All Of Us datasets. This SNP was linked to enhanced GR activity, leading to increased transactivation of Pcsk9 and Bhlhe40, which are negative regulators of LDL and HDL receptors in the liver. The findings supported a zygosity-dependent effect, with homozygous carriers exhibiting the highest plasma cholesterol levels and increased odds ratios for hypercholesterolemia and cardiovascular disease mortality.
title: The human glucocorticoid receptor variant rs6190 promotes blood cholesterol and atherosclerosis

finding: rs188904275 was located in the gene JAKMIP2 and was associated with mean activity levels during sleep, with a p-value of 3.7×10^-8. This gene was previously found to be associated with Body Mass Index (BMI) measurements and pulmonary diseases.
title: Automated Feature Extraction from Population Wearable Device Data Identified Novel Loci Associated with Sleep and Circadian Rhythms

finding: The rs1501357 SNP, associated with the HCN1 gene, was previously implicated in schizophrenia through genome-wide association studies. In the context of the provided abstract, this SNP was found to be significantly upregulated in parvalbumin-expressed neurons (PVALB neurons) specifically in the temporal lobe (TL) of schizophrenia patients. This suggests a strong correlation between this genetic variation and the vulnerability of neuronal populations to neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Decoding frontotemporal and cell type-specific vulnerabilities to neuropsychiatric disorders and psychoactive drugs

finding: The SNP rs10040118 was linked to the study of polyploid/multinucleated giant cancer cells's roles in metastasis and disease relapse following anticancer treatments. This finding indicated a direct correlation with the mechanisms involved in DNA damage response and telomere regulation in cancer.
title: Role of the circadian clock “Death-Loop” in the DNA damage response underpinning cancer treatment resistance

finding: The SNP rs267949 was noted as an intron variant of the DAP gene on chromosome 5 and while not identified in the univariate GWAS used, it was previously associated with ulcerative colitis (UC) according to earlier studies.
title: JASS: Command Line and Web interface for the joint analysis of GWAS results

finding: The marker rs6874700 achieved a highly significant p value of 1.48 x 10^-24 in the genome-wide association study, identifying it as a key susceptibility marker associated with classic bladder exstrophy (CBE). This marker was pivotal in connecting variations in the ISL1 gene region to the development of CBE, which encompasses conditions such as epispadias and bladder exstrophy.
title: EZH2 specifically regulates ISL1 during embryonic urinary tract formation

finding: Marker rs2303751 was identified as having the highest regulatory effect in the study, with a p value of 8.12 x 10^-20. It was found to be in strong linkage disequilibrium with the top marker rs6874700 and was suggested to define a binding site for the EZH2 transcription factor. The functional assays indicated that rs2303751 plays a significant role in regulating ISL1 expression, highlighting its crucial contribution to susceptibility for bladder exstrophy.
title: EZH2 specifically regulates ISL1 during embryonic urinary tract formation

finding: The SNP rs13153692 was identified in the context of human colorectal cancer tissue, where it played a role in tackling tumor cell heterogeneity at the super-resolution level. This finding was part of a study that explored the complexities of cancer tissues using advanced imaging techniques, indicating its potential significance in cancer research.
title: Ring Array Illumination Microscopy: Combination of Super-Resolution with Large Field of View Imaging and long Working Distances

finding: The SNP rs116483731, which represents a rare missense variant in SPDL1 (NM_017785.5 p.Arg20Gln), was identified as a novel genetic risk factor for idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF). It exhibited a significant association with IPF, demonstrated by a p-value of 2.35 × 10^-7 and an odds ratio of 2.87 in the primary cohort. Further validation in the FinnGen cohort showed this variant achieved genome-wide significance with a p-value of 9.97 × 10^-16, and a higher odds ratio of 3.13, indicating its strong association with increased IPF risk.
title: Identification of a novel missense variant in SPDL1 associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The variant rs10052710 located in VCAN linked to QSM IDP findings, relevant for extracellular matrix interactions in the context of inflammation and brain structure.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: The SNP rs12653308, located at the 5q14.3 locus in the gene body of VCAN, was found to be strongly associated with various diffusion metrics from white matter fiber tracts and cortical surface measurements, particularly showing a strong association in the hippocampus bilaterally. The study indicated that VCAN plays a critical role in astrocyte-mediated neuroinflammation, linking the positive finding to neuropsychiatric disorders, as alterations in CSPGs were observed in patients with schizophrenia and bipolar disorders.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association study on tissue-sensitive diffusion metrics identifies key molecular pathways for axonal growth, synaptogenesis, and astrocyte-mediated neuroinflammation

finding: The SNP rs257899 was identified as a significant eQTL associated with SLC27A6 expression specifically in a well-powered human dataset. The findings indicated that this SNP had measurable regulatory activity in humans, with eQTL effect size estimates and nominal P-values demonstrating its influence on gene expression in heart tissue. However, no significant eQTL activity for this SNP was detected in chimpanzees.
title: Gene expression variability in human and chimpanzee populations share common determinants

finding: The A allele of rs33961405 located in an intron of the telomerase reverse transcriptase gene (<TERT>) was associated with decreased telomere length of T-cells. This finding was a novel association determined by a genome-wide association study (GWAS), with an effect size of -0.19 and a standard error of 0.03, indicating a significant impact on telomere length in T-cells.
title: Genetic, parental and lifestyle factors influence telomere length

finding: The SNP rs12517864 was found to enhance the PU.1 binding motif score, leading to increased <ZNF608> expression. It represented a secondary eQTL for <ZNF608> and colocalized with lymphocyte count association. This linkage was derived from analysis showing that its regulatory effects could significantly impact gene expression relevant for lymphocyte development.
title: Colocalization of blood cell traits GWAS associations and variation in PU.1 genomic occupancy prioritizes causal noncoding regulatory variants

finding: The intronic variant rs766919361 by FGF18 was found to be associated with height. Similar to other markers, its association was not previously recorded in UK Biobank studies, reinforcing the necessity of WGS data in uncovering height-related variants.
title: Joint modelling of whole genome sequence data for human height via approximate message passing

finding: The risk allele of rs56132153 was shown to associate with decreased expression of PIK3R1 specifically in PBS-treated chondrocytes. This association underscores its relevance in OA pathology.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: This SNP was associated with eQTLs impacting PAPPA expression in both conditions and was part of the analysis related to OA risk through its connection to specific GWAS signals.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: SNP rs2248374 was identified as influencing the expression of the full-length ERAP2 protein. Individuals with the A/A genotype expressed ERAP2, while those with the G/G genotype did not express the full-length protein but instead a shorter isoform (~55 kDa). The study linked this SNP to immune responses in macrophages, with findings suggesting that the truncated form of ERAP2 could be stabilized in an acidic microenvironment, which is of particular relevance in macrophage biology.
title: A short ERAP2 that binds IRAP is expressed in macrophages independently from gene variation

finding: In the study, rs1173771 was identified as significantly associated with blood pressure, particularly the G allele, which correlated with higher mean arterial pressure (MAP), systolic and diastolic blood pressure (SBP, DBP), and pulse pressure. The research demonstrated that deletion of the orthologous noncoding region containing rs1173771 in Dahl salt-sensitive rats led to a nearly 10 mmHg reduction in salt-induced hypertension. This effect was linked to the upregulation of the adjacent gene Npr3, which plays a role in vasodilation. The blood pressure-elevating haplotype that included rs1173771 was also shown to reduce NPR3 expression in endothelial and vascular smooth muscle cells derived from edited isogenic hiPSCs. There was significant evidence that the 11 SNPs in linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs1173771 collectively influenced chromatin interactions with the NPR3 promoter, further supporting the hypothesis that rs1173771 is a key player in regulating blood pressure through genetic and epigenetic mechanisms.
title: Physiological role and mechanisms of action for a long noncoding haplotype region

finding: In the study, the T allele of rs11750646 was associated with increased expression of PIK3R1, an OA-related gene, by enhancing AR binding in an open chromatin region. This regulatory mechanism suggested that the variant plays a significant role in the etiology of osteoarthritis by promoting PIK3R1 expression.
title: Comprehensive profiling of transcriptional regulation in cartilage reveals pathogenesis of osteoarthritis

finding: The SNP rs16891982 was associated with differences in skin and hair pigmentation among various human populations, including Europeans and South Asians. This variant resulted in an amino acid change from leucine (L374) in individuals with darker skin to phenylalanine (F374) in those with lighter skin. The light F374 variant was found to be nearly fixed in light-skinned populations, suggesting a significant role in pigmentation variations. The study noted that while the F374 variant led to a reduced functionality in melanosome activity, the exact mechanisms causing this decrease were not fully understood.
title: SLC45A2 protein stability and regulation of melanosome pH determine melanocyte pigmentation

finding: The SNP rs832582 was identified as a colonic Crohn's disease (cCD) specific variant that may predispose carriers to a more intense inflammatory response. This finding was linked to MAP3K1 signaling, which was suggested to play a role in Infliximab resistance, indicating that patients with this SNP might not benefit from anti-TNF therapy.
title: An Inter-Species Translation Model Implicates Integrin Signaling in Infliximab-Resistant Colonic Crohn’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs374702773, identified as a delta T allele in intron of UBXN3B, was associated with protection against alcoholic liver cirrhosis. This finding highlighted the potential role of UBXN3B in moderating inflammatory conditions in humans, supported by its function in balancing myelopoiesis and lymphopoiesis during immune responses.
title: UBXN3B Restricts Viral Pathogenesis by Maintaining Hematopoietic Homeostasis

finding: The SNP rs7731626 was identified as the main risk SNP at the ANKRD55 locus associated with multiple sclerosis (MS) and rheumatoid arthritis (RA). It was noted to modulate the expression of both ANKRD55 and IL6ST in CD4+ T lymphocytes. Additionally, rs7731626 was co-localized with the strongest cis-expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for ANKRD55 in whole blood and spleen, indicating its significant regulatory role in gene expression related to autoimmune processes.
title: ANKRD55 interacts with an IFT-B-like complex in microglia

finding: The rs11950533 variant was associated with the gene CATSPER3 in the context of rare coding variant burden analysis, highlighting its significance in the genetic risk for PD.
title: Expanding Parkinson’s disease genetics: novel risk loci, genomic context, causal insights and heritable risk

finding: The SNP rs226198 was highlighted for its association with two other breast cancer GWAS SNPs (rs146817970 and rs7707921). It overlapped with a MYC:MAX heterodimer motif, crucial for MYC binding, with implications in breast cancer as both MYC and MYC:MAX are oncogenes. The SNP was also located in a chromatin accessibility region.
title: funMotifs: Tissue-specific transcription factor motifs

finding: The G388R single nucleotide polymorphism (rs351855) was reported to have an aberrant activation of FGFR4 signaling, promoting progression and mediating treatment resistance in multiple types of cancer. In the context of breast cancer, the study highlighted that FGFR4 has an involvement in tumor oncogenesis and that mutations of FGFR4, including this specific SNP, could contribute to therapy resistance and metastasis, with a noted significant enrichment of FGFR4 mutation in metastatic breast cancer compared to primary tumors.
title: Estrogen regulation and functional role of FGFR4 in estrogen receptor positive breast cancer

finding: In the PDGFRB locus, the SNP rs2304058 had a meta-P-value of 4.06 × 10-9, indicating a significant link to the cytokine network and immune-related responses.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of a cytokine network reveals variants with widespread immune, haematological and cardiometabolic pleiotropy

finding: The study confirmed that the non-synonymous SNP rs1131769 in TMEM173 results in a histidine (H) substitution at position 232 in the STING protein, leading to a 90% reduction in the secretion of IFNα in response to vaccinia virus stimulation. The finding highlighted significant inter-individual variation in immune response to smallpox vaccination, indicating that individuals carrying the H232 variant of STING have impaired innate immunity, thereby affecting their response to the vaccine.
title: Polymorphisms in STING affect human innate immune responses to poxviruses

finding: The SNP rs7380824 (R293Q) was found to independently associate with a decrease in IFNα response. Specifically, when comparing haplotypes, the analysis indicated that the presence of this variant contributed significantly to the reduction in immune response, alongside the effects observed for rs1131769.
title: Polymorphisms in STING affect human innate immune responses to poxviruses

finding: The finding related to rs13163934 was linked to the enzymatic metabolism of flavonoids by gut microbiota, highlighting its role in the context of gastrointestinal cancer. This SNP was discussed in the context of how specific flavonoids, such as rutin, interact with gut microbiota to produce beneficial metabolic outcomes, which contributed to understanding the importance of this genetic variant in metabolism and potential therapeutic applications.
title: Inducing a synergistic anti-obesity effect by increasing the bioavailability of the flavonoid rutin with a L. plantarum species

finding: The SNP rs13174486 was implicated in the context of CD82, a tetraspanin protein identified in the study as having increased abundance, polarization, and colocalization following fludarabine treatment in an acute lymphoblastic leukemia cell line. This finding was significant as CD82 is related to chemotherapy resistance, linking the SNP to potential therapeutic implications in cancer treatment.
title: Mapping the Spatial Proteome of Leukemia Cells Undergoing Fludarabine Treatment

finding: The SNP rs13153798 was linked with the regulation of alloimmune signaling during allogeneic transplantation. It was found to play a significant role in the immune response mechanisms pertinent to T cell behavior, particularly in regard to T Cell Factor-1 (TCF-7) function. The presence of this SNP was associated with CD8 T cell activation and modulation of anti-tumor responses, highlighting its potential impact on therapeutic strategies in cancer treatments and transplantation.
title: TCF-7 is dispensable for anti-tumor response but required for persistent function of mature CD8 T cells

finding: The variant rs10793810 was identified as a MG-specific sc-eQTL of the SLC27A6 gene, which enhanced the binding of FOXP2 – a transcription factor that is highly expressed in MG – to a MG-specific enhancer of SLC27A6.
title: Integrative single cell multiomics analysis of human retina indicates a role for hierarchical transcription factors collaboration in genetic effects on gene regulation

finding: The variant rs6859300 was identified as a Rod-specific sc-caQTL that enhanced the binding of EPAS1, which is highly expressed in Rod, resulting in increased accessibility of its residing master region in Rod. This variant was also a sc-eQTL of WWC1 in Rod.
title: Integrative single cell multiomics analysis of human retina indicates a role for hierarchical transcription factors collaboration in genetic effects on gene regulation

finding: The variant rs7705526, located in the 5th intron of TERT, was identified as the lead variant in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs34002450. It was found to independently associate with CHIP status, demonstrating a 1.3-fold increased risk (OR 1.3, p=6.1x10^-10) after conditioning on the lead SNP.
title: Inherited Causes of Clonal Hematopoiesis of Indeterminate Potential in TOPMed Whole Genomes

finding: The SNP rs13167280, another intronic variant in TERT, was found to independently associate with CHIP status, showing an odds ratio of 1.3 (p=6.1x10^-10). This finding contributed to the understanding of genetic predispositions in CHIP.
title: Inherited Causes of Clonal Hematopoiesis of Indeterminate Potential in TOPMed Whole Genomes

finding: The rs31746 variant within the PCDH-α, -β, -γ gene cluster was previously found to be associated with nicotine cravings and likelihood of relapse in self-reported smoking behavior. This variant was related to differential expression of the PCDHβ8 gene in postmortem prefrontal cortex tissue. Although no direct evidence linked this SNP to opioid use, the present study's findings indicated that protocadherin genes, including PCDHB12, might be implicated in acute opioid intoxication, suggesting a functional relevance of this SNP in substance use disorders.
title: Differential Expression of NPAS4 in the Dorsolateral Prefrontal Cortex Following Acute Opioid Intoxication

finding: The rs115865641 variant in PCDHB16 was identified to be associated with fluid intelligence, demonstrating that it may influence cognition through its potential genetic pathways and indicating its role as a rare but significant variant.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The intronic rs7725495 variant in POLR3G was identified as influencing episodic memory, underlining its relevance in cognitive genetics.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The study indicated that the SNP rs13163969, which is associated with the Kallikrein-Related Peptidase 6 (KLK6), showed a significant association with the tumor microenvironment of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC). This finding underscored the relevance of KLK6 in the context of PDAC, emphasizing its role in cancer biology and potential as a diagnostic marker.
title: Targeted and Explorative Profiling of Kallikrein Proteases and Global Proteome Biology of Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma, Chronic Pancreatitis, and Normal Pancreas Highlights Disease-Specific Proteome Remodelling

finding: The study indicated that rs7730971 had a strong association with alternative splicing in the FBXO38 gene, with a colocalization posterior probability (CLPP) of 0.845. This SNP was discovered to influence the inclusion of a novel cryptic exon in the FBXO38 gene, with evidence showing a higher presence of the exon in the GG genotype compared to the CC genotype. The cryptic exon leads to a premature stop codon, suggesting a protective role against COPD.
title: Analysis of genetically driven alternative splicing identifies FBXO38 as a novel COPD susceptibility gene

finding: Associated with the same locus as rs7730971, rs4597955 demonstrated significant GWAS associations with COPD. It was included in the broader analysis of the locus at 5q32, though specific details on its direct effects on alternative splicing were not highlighted independently of other SNPs in this region.
title: Analysis of genetically driven alternative splicing identifies FBXO38 as a novel COPD susceptibility gene

finding: The SNP rs10040093 was associated with the role of Activator Protein-1 (AP-1) family members in CD30-positive lymphomas. This finding was relevant in understanding genetic predispositions and molecular mechanisms underlying these specific lymphomas, as detailed in the publication by Garces de Los Fayos Alonso et al. (2018), which highlighted the importance of AP-1 in mediating responses in cancer contexts.
title: EAP: a versatile cloud-based platform for comprehensive and interactive analysis of large-scale ChIP/ATAC-seq data sets

finding: The predicted damaging missense variant rs200373343 (p.Arg94Cys) in THBS4 was found to be 45 times more frequent in the Finnish population than in the Northern European population and was associated with a mean decrease in body weight of 5.9 kg.
title: Exome sequencing identifies high-impact trait-associated alleles enriched in Finns

finding: This SNP was related to research on neo-antigen discovery in metastatic melanoma, facilitated through cloud computing and community curated variant libraries. The study demonstrated improvements in the identification of neo-antigens which could have implications for cancer immunotherapy.
title: Diagnostic Ion Data Analysis Reduction (DIDAR) allows rapid quality control analysis and filtering of multiplexed single cell proteomics data

finding: The SNP p.A279T (rs61748181) was classified as a common variant and was found in both MDS and NHL cohorts at similar frequencies (11.9% in MDS vs. 12.0% in NHL, p=0.79). However, it primarily represented the common <italic>TERT</italic> variant group and was not linked with inferior outcomes in MDS patients.
title: The clinical and functional effects of TERT variants in myelodysplastic syndrome

finding: The SNP p.H412Y (rs34094720) was categorized as a common variant in the study's analysis. It appeared with a prevalence of 11.9% in MDS patients, comparable to that in the NHL cohort at 12.0% (p=0.79). This SNP was part of the common variants for <italic>TERT</italic> but did not demonstrate a direct association with MDS severity.
title: The clinical and functional effects of TERT variants in myelodysplastic syndrome

finding: The SNP p.A1062T (rs35719940) was also classified among the common variants. It had similar prevalence in both the MDS cohort at 11.9% and NHL cohort at 12.0% (p=0.79). Like the other common variants, it did not show a direct correlation with MDS pathogenesis.
title: The clinical and functional effects of TERT variants in myelodysplastic syndrome

finding: The study highlighted the prognostic quality of activating TERT promoter mutations in glioblastoma. This particular SNP, rs2853669, was found to interact with these mutations and the age of patients at diagnosis. It indicated that the presence of this SNP could influence the clinical outcome for glioblastoma patients.
title: A liquid biopsy platform for detecting gene-gene fusions as glioma diagnostic biomarkers and drug targets

finding: The SNP rs112072727 was significantly associated with the trajectory probability of left ventricular diameter (LVIDd). It formed a linkage block with other significant variants, suggesting regulatory implications in cardiac dimensions.
title: Trajectory analysis of cardiovascular phenotypes from biobank data uncovers novel genetic associations

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with LVID trajectory probability and was implicated as part of a regulatory variant cluster affecting MYO10 expression.
title: Trajectory analysis of cardiovascular phenotypes from biobank data uncovers novel genetic associations

finding: The variant rs74669701, located in the MYO10 gene region, showed significant associations with LVID trajectory. It was highlighted as creating a potential SOX9 transcription factor binding site upon variation.
title: Trajectory analysis of cardiovascular phenotypes from biobank data uncovers novel genetic associations

finding: This variant was significantly associated with LVIDd trajectory probability and showed enrichment in H3K27Ac marks suggesting its role as an enhancer in heart and vascular tissues.
title: Trajectory analysis of cardiovascular phenotypes from biobank data uncovers novel genetic associations

finding: SNP rs76494545 was associated with LVID trajectory probability and displayed H3K27Ac enrichment in aorta, supporting its regulatory role in MYO10 expression.
title: Trajectory analysis of cardiovascular phenotypes from biobank data uncovers novel genetic associations

finding: This SNP showed a significant association with LVIDd trajectory and was located in regions of H3K27Ac enrichment, indicating it's interactive in transcriptional regulation linked to myocardial changes.
title: Trajectory analysis of cardiovascular phenotypes from biobank data uncovers novel genetic associations

finding: The TIMD4 SNP rs6882076 was associated with decreased triglyceride levels and reduced risk of coronary heart disease and ischemic stroke, underlining its significance in cardiovascular pathology.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The AGXT2 SNP rs37369 was identified as a risk factor for diabetes mellitus in a cohort study in Japan, suggesting its influence on metabolic disease development.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs13153678 was associated with the expression of IL-21 in Tfh-like cells, which helped promote antitumor immunity in ovarian cancer by coordinating immune cell actions responsive to 7α,25-HC, indicating its relevance in T cell differentiation and function within the tumor microenvironment.
title: Predicting developmental relationships of tumor resident and circulating T cells in ovarian cancer

finding: The SNP rs445118 was identified as a cis-eVariant for the gene C6, related to the immune complement cascade, reinforcing its role within immune responses.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs12655804 was linked to NK cell proportions, indicating its relevance in modulating immune cell characteristics.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The ADRB2 variant rs1042713 was associated with obesity and related phenotypes, as well as its interaction with dietary fat, indicating its relevance in metabolic characteristics among Malaysian adults.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers associated with endometriosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The study found that rs188427942 was associated with individuals in the European American (EA) population, where carriers exhibited no significant response to phenylephrine, showing an average delta systolic blood pressure response of -9 mmHg compared to 20 mmHg in non-carriers. This SNP was located in regions previously associated with systolic blood pressure.
title: Rapid response to the Alpha-1 Adrenergic Agent Phenylephrine in the Perioperative Period is Impacted by Genomics and Ancestry

finding: Similar to rs188427942, rs147664194 was identified as another rare variant in European Americans associated with non-responsiveness to phenylephrine. Carriers of this variant also exhibited an average delta systolic blood pressure response of -9 mmHg, aligning with findings for rs188427942.
title: Rapid response to the Alpha-1 Adrenergic Agent Phenylephrine in the Perioperative Period is Impacted by Genomics and Ancestry
