finding: The SNP rs145337816 was described as a rare variant only present in European Americans and Hispanic/Latinos. It was associated with a significantly high BP response to phenylephrine, categorizing carriers as potential 'super-responders' with a delta systolic blood pressure of 37 mmHg in EAs and 53 mmHg in Hispanic/Latinos.
title: Rapid response to the Alpha-1 Adrenergic Agent Phenylephrine in the Perioperative Period is Impacted by Genomics and Ancestry

finding: The variant rs77704739, located near the PELO gene, indicated a four-fold risk for type 2 diabetes (MAF=0.036, OR [CI 95%] = 4.3 [2.7 - 6.9], p = 1.75 × 10−8). It also demonstrated significant associations with metformin use in the UK Biobank, underlining the necessity of using recessive models in GWAS.
title: The impact of non-additive genetic associations on age-related complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs2950846, located within the gene PCDHB16, showed low expression levels in AUD subjects but higher expression levels after ethanol treatment in SK-N-BE(2) cells. This finding suggested that the allele expression was sensitive to ethanol treatment.
title: Allele-Specific Expression and High-Throughput Reporter Assay Reveal Functional Variants in Human Brains with Alcohol Use Disorders

finding: The SNP rs2338530 was associated with differential alternative allele expression sensitivity to ethanol, showing significant differences between the AUD subjects and controls under different ethanol treatment conditions.
title: Allele-Specific Expression and High-Throughput Reporter Assay Reveal Functional Variants in Human Brains with Alcohol Use Disorders

finding: The SNP rs173754 was identified as significant at the p-value level of 3.33 × 10^{-6} and has been implicated in ADHD, suggesting potential neurobehavioral connections with Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Deep Learning-based Feature Extraction with MRI Data in Neuroimaging Genetics for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Variant rs7719885 showed differential DNA binding as observed in the EMSA, despite predictions indicating a decrease in binding affinity. It was found that this variant actually increased the binding affinity, demonstrating a significant alteration even though its original prediction was incorrect.
title: Disease-Associated Non-Coding Variants Alter NKX2-5 DNA-Binding Affinity

finding: The G allele of rs185220 was associated with increased chromatin accessibility in both neurons and progenitors at a caPeak overlapping with the SETD9 TSS, leading to increased expression of SETD9. This SNP disrupted motifs of transcription factor REST, indicating a reduced binding of REST, which is consistent with the function of REST as a chromatin repressor.
title: Cell-type specific effects of genetic variation on chromatin accessibility during human neuronal differentiation

finding: SNP rs34220 on chromosome 6A was found to be significantly associated with leaf rust resistance. It is located in proximity to several seedling resistance genes (Lr56, Lr62, Lr64) and two QTLs (IWA680_6AS, 6A_t1). Given the absence of genetic materials for these genes in the panel, the rs34220 is likely associated with distinct loci related to leaf rust resistance.
title: Identification of novel leaf rust seedling resistance loci in Iranian bread wheat germplasm using genome-wide association mapping

finding: SNP rs6864758, located intergenically in LINC02227 on chromosome 5, affected the change in surface area across different ages, suggesting an age-dependent impact on gene expression related to brain morphology.
title: Dynamics of Brain Structure and its Genetic Architecture over the Lifespan

finding: The rs78393591 SNP in DROSHA was associated with an increased risk of breast cancer.
title: A pan-cancer atlas of somatic mutations in miRNA biogenesis genes

finding: The SNP rs6882046, near LINC00461, emerged as an outlier in the analysis where it related to traits influencing body mass index (BMI), such as alcohol intake frequency. This underscored its role in the association between education level and BMI.
title: MR-TRYX: A Mendelian randomization framework that exploits horizontal pleiotropy to infer novel causal pathways

finding: The rs1064793933 SNP represents a GABA receptor variant, specifically the G251D variation in the GABRA1 gene (NM_001127644.2(GABRA1):c.752G>A). This variant was identified as causative for genetic epilepsy, and studies indicated that it resulted in loss of function by impairing the folding and surface trafficking of the α1 protein subunit. The context of this finding highlighted its significance in understanding epilepsy phenotypes, ranging from mild to severe.
title: Pharmacological chaperones restore proteostasis of epilepsy-associated GABAA receptor variants

finding: The SNP rs10040093 was linked to the regulation of the AP-1 network genes, which were identified as critical for tumor growth in small cell lung cancer (SCLC). This connection suggested a potential role for this SNP in influencing tumor dynamics and survival outcomes in SCLC patients.
title: Single Cell lineage Tracing Identifies Cancer Testis Antigens as Mediators of Chemoresistance in Small Cell Lung Cancer

finding: The SNP rs10060178 was associated with the TP53 gene, which in the context of SARS-CoV-2 infection, was found to be stabilized on chromatin, influencing the host cytopathic effects linked to viral infection. The study provided insights into how this variant was connected to the chromatin alterations induced by the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein, particularly in relation to syncytia formation, cellular senescence, and inflammation that varied across different SARS-CoV-2 variants.
title: Differences in syncytia formation by SARS-CoV-2 variants modify host chromatin accessibility and cellular senescence via TP53

finding: The variant <italic>rs16891982</italic> was associated with increased tint of blue eyes, indicating it has a role alongside <italic>rs12913832</italic> in the expression of the blue eye color phenotype, despite being located on different chromosomes.
title: A general model for two-locus assortative mating analysis and prediction

finding: The SNP rs7726159 was involved as a candidate causal variant (CCV) colocalizing with a cell-type-specific cis-regulatory element (cCRE) within the TERT gene in basal cells, which were responsible for 1.8% of the lung cells analyzed. The expression of TERT is significant in the context of lung cancer, as reactivation of TERT is associated with cellular immortalization and tumorigenesis.
title: Context-aware single-cell multiome approach identified cell-type specific lung cancer susceptibility genes

finding: The SNP rs7725218 also colocalized with a cCRE within the TERT gene, similar to rs7726159. This variant demonstrated significant allelic transcriptional activity when assessed in A549 lung cancer cells, with the lung cancer risk-associated allele showing higher transcriptional activity, further supporting its role in lung cancer susceptibility.
title: Context-aware single-cell multiome approach identified cell-type specific lung cancer susceptibility genes

finding: The G>C substitution (SNP rs2910164) was positioned in the 3p passenger strand of hsa-miR-146a. This SNP was associated with an increased risk of papillary thyroid carcinoma. It was shown that the C allele of the SNP altered the structure of the precursor, decreased expression of the mature miRNA, and activated the passenger strand, which became the second mature miRNA modulating many genes involved in apoptosis regulation.
title: Pan-Cancer analysis of somatic mutations in miRNA genes

finding: The SNP rs17555038, located in the sarcoglycan delta (SGCD) gene, was also identified as a significant variant activated by the GLN model during the analysis of T1D. Its effects included non-additive interactions that were crucial for understanding T1D risk.
title: Deep integrative models for large-scale human genomics

finding: SNP rs702634 was identified in the ARL15 gene locus and was associated with metabolic traits. It showed a credible set probability of 0.48 for being the causal SNP, disrupted a MEF2 motif and was found to be within a mesenchymal stem cell-specific ATAC-seq peak, suggesting its regulatory role in T2D risk.
title: Human and rat skeletal muscle single-nuclei multi-omic integrative analyses nominate causal cell types, regulatory elements, and SNPs for complex traits

finding: The SNP rs7722456 demonstrated an anomalous pattern of adenine reads across all assessments in the initial dilution series. Although it was detected as having issues by the HSG's quality control measures, which flagged only 37 out of 108 unusual occurrences, the newly implemented SMLR model proved to be more effective at identifying allelic imbalances. The model identified that 106 data points fell within the no-call zone using a probability threshold of q = 0.99, indicating significant allelic imbalance.
title: Enhanced SNP Genotyping with Symmetric Multinomial Logistic Regression

finding: Tier-1 SNP rs9293708 was investigated as it influenced expression through adipose tissue and had been associated with obesity risk. It had a key role in the long-distance chromatin interactions involving <italic>ZBED3-AS1</italic>, suggesting its impact on obesity regulation.
title: Epigenomic and transcriptomic prioritization of candidate obesity-risk regulatory GWAS SNPs

finding: This SNP was identified as a Tier-1 SNP with significant regulatory implications in both adipose tissue and pancreatic islets, modulating the expression of neighboring genes which influence obesity.
title: Epigenomic and transcriptomic prioritization of candidate obesity-risk regulatory GWAS SNPs

finding: The SNP rs351855 in FGFR4 was associated with drug response to doxorubicin, cyclophosphamide, and fluorouracil, highlighting its importance in therapeutic outcomes for DLBCL patients.
title: Epigenetic inhibitors sensitize DLBCL cells to rituximab and doxorubicin

finding: The PTGER4 gene variant rs76523431 was identified as a candidate risk factor for radiological joint damage in rheumatoid arthritis, enhancing understanding of genetic contributors to joint health.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs383830 near <FAM174A> had originally been reported as associated with CAD, although it failed to replicate at genome-wide significance in subsequent consortia. However, its impact on lipid parameters was significant during cellular assays, hence it was maintained for further studies.
title: Pairwise genetic interactions modulate lipid plasma levels and cellular uptake

finding: The SNP rs13184609 was found to be associated with variations in macrophage metabolism in colorectal cancer (CRC). Specifically, it was implicated in the metabolic competition between tumor-associated M1 and M2 macrophages, highlighting its role in influencing the metabolic state of these immune cells. This finding contributed to understanding how metabolic shifts in macrophages can promote anti-tumor activity within the tumor microenvironment.
title: Ensemble-based genome-scale modeling predicts metabolic differences between macrophage subtypes in colorectal cancer

finding: The SNP rs2248374 was critical for ERAP2 expression. The A allele of rs2248374 facilitated full-length ERAP2 expression while the G allele disrupted this, leading to decreased mRNA and protein levels, primarily due to nonsense-mediated mRNA decay.
title: A cis-regulatory element regulates ERAP2 expression through autoimmune disease risk SNPs

finding: The SNP rs2548224 was highlighted as a significant eQTL influencing ERAP2 expression levels and was suggested to have regulatory functions interacting with the ERAP2 promoter, independent of rs2248374.
title: A cis-regulatory element regulates ERAP2 expression through autoimmune disease risk SNPs

finding: The SNP rs10060207 was found to be related to hypersialylation in cancer. This finding was associated with modulation of inflammation and offered potential therapeutic opportunities in the context of cancer, providing insights into how glycan ligands interact with immune cells.
title: A Versatile Soluble Siglec Scaffold for Sensitive and Quantitative Detection of Glycan Ligands

finding: The SNP rs73351608 was associated with blood protein measurement in humans. The negative correlation of gene expression with parasitemia in the context of the study suggested that this SNP's association could relate to the immune response in the setting of malaria-like infections in red colobus monkeys.
title: Immunogenetic response to a malaria-like parasite in a wild primate

finding: The 'T' allele of the top eSNP (rs1295686) within IL13 was associated with greater IL13 expression in PHA-stimulated T cells and increased risk of asthma, allergic sensitization, and allergic disease, with strong linkage disequilibrium observed with other SNPs in the IL13 region.
title: Neonatal genetics of gene expression reveal the origins of autoimmune and allergic disease risk

finding: The SNP rs325506 was identified as a novel shared risk SNP for ASD and ADHD, although it did not map directly to any known genes. However, the region around it was associated with various traits such as depression.
title: Combining multivariate genomic approaches to elucidate the comorbidity between ASD and ADHD

finding: The SNP rs875741 was identified as a fine-mapped causal variant linked to the gene CPEB4, specifically in hematopoietic progenitors. This finding was notable because it illustrated a cell-type specificity, with the enhancer linked to this variant being active in hematopoietic progenitors but not in other blood cell types like B-cells and T-cells. The association was made using the ENCODE-rE2G model, emphasizing the utility of this model in elucidating enhancer-gene interactions relevant to gene regulation in specific contexts.
title: An encyclopedia of enhancer-gene regulatory interactions in the human genome

finding: The SNP rs13164040 was associated with the PI3K/Akt pathway, which played an essential role in the therapeutic approaches for cancers including prostate cancer. This locus was implicated in the context of immune checkpoint inhibitors and the resistance mechanisms observed in PTEN-deficient prostate cancer.
title: Suppression of tumor cell lactate-generating signaling pathways eradicates murine PTEN/p53-deficient aggressive-variant prostate cancer via macrophage phagocytosis

finding: The frequency of the derived allele at rs16891982 in the SLC45A2 gene was found to be 0.7098, which indicated its association with skin depigmentation in Europeans. This finding provided insight into the pigmentation phenotype of the ancient population from the Mokrin necropolis.
title: Kinship, acquired and inherited status, and population structure at the Early Bronze Age Mokrin necropolis in northern Serbia

finding: The variant located in the LIPC gene region demonstrated a distinct and possibly pleiotropic effect on AMD risk. While it was negatively associated with AMD in contrast to the expected positive association with XL.HDL.C, this unique finding warranted further investigation to clarify its role in AMD risk.
title: Selecting causal risk factors from high-throughput experiments using multivariable Mendelian randomization

finding: The SNP rs10060154 was associated with p53 mutant aggregation-related cancers, suggesting a significant correlation between this SNP and the presence of P53 mutations. This finding was reported in the context of treating cancers influenced by p53 aggregation, and the SNP's relevance to the mechanisms underlying amyloidogenic protein aggregation indicated its potential role in cancer pathogenesis.
title: P53 TAD2 Domain (38-61) Forms Amyloid-like Aggregates in Isolation

finding: The SNP rs10060166 was associated with the ability of zinc metallochaperones to reactivate mutant p53. This finding was linked to potential implications in cancer therapeutics, indicating that zinc plays a crucial role in modulating p53 functionality, particularly in cancer contexts.
title: Phage libraries screening on P53 : yield improvement by zinc and a new parasites-integrating analysis and rationale

finding: The SNP rs1173771 was associated with the NPR3 gene and was involved in bone density regulation, demonstrating a positive association with eQTL data in relevant tissues.
title: Prioritization of osteoporosis-associated GWAS SNPs using epigenomics and transcriptomics

finding: The SNP rs7733331, in high LD with rs1173771, was confirmed as an eQTL for NPR3 with substantial implications in bone growth and metabolic processes, related to osteoporosis.
title: Prioritization of osteoporosis-associated GWAS SNPs using epigenomics and transcriptomics

finding: The SNP rs13174304 was analyzed in the context of inhibiting PIM kinases, which appeared to be involved in the replication cycle of the Mayaro virus (MAYV). The study found that inhibition of PIM kinases reduced viral titers and cell damage in MAYV-infected cells. This suggests that rs13174304 could have implications for antiviral strategies targeting PIM kinases, particularly in the context of MAYV and possibly other arboviruses.
title: Targeting Host PIM Protein Kinases Reduces Mayaro Virus Replication

finding: As part of the Irisplex system, this SNP was known to play a role in human pigmentation and was also part of Hirisplex-S for determining eye, hair, and skin color.
title: How to choose sets of ancestry informative markers: A supervised feature selection approach

finding: For the rs12916_T>C variant, while it presented significant associations with LDL, analysis suggested it was not the causal variant impacting traits of interest, indicating potential misinterpretations in prior studies.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The variant rs2549794 near ERAP2 was identified as the strongest candidate for selection, exhibiting a highly significant p-value of 1.2×10⁻⁵, which fell below the Bonferroni-corrected significance threshold of 2.8×10⁻⁵. It was associated with protective effects against severe respiratory infections during the Black Death, supported by both functional and epidemiological data. The C allele of this SNP was found to induce a unique immune response to Yersinia pestis, thereby demonstrating its role in the immune response during that historical epidemic.
title: Reply to Barton et al: signatures of natural selection during the Black Death

finding: The rs41115 polymorphism in the apc gene was associated with survival outcomes in Iranian colorectal cancer patients. This finding indicated that the genetic variant may influence patient prognosis, making it an important marker in understanding the survival dynamics in colorectal cancer.
title: NestedBD: Bayesian Inference of Phylogenetic Trees From Single-Cell DNA Copy Number Profile Data Under a Birth-Death Model

finding: The SNP rs2736098 was associated with pancreatic cancer risk in this study, adding to the growing list of relevant SNPs.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs401681 was noted for its association with pancreatic cancer risk, corroborating results from the existing literature.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs13153843 was identified as a significant marker related to ATM kinase inhibition, a process relevant to the treatment of cancers associated with Fanconi anemia. This finding contributed to understanding pharmacodynamic biomarkers that may influence the efficacy of cancer therapies in patients with FA.
title: Fanconi anemia-isogenic head and neck cancer cell line pairs - a basic and translational science resource
